110101.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Max HP by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color>.
110101.Mania Intensify Text: All allied Sinners on the field will gain an Attack increase equal to <color=#63b4c3>0.5%</color> of their Shield Value.
110101.Name: Demon
110101.Criminal Record 1: The suspect for attempted murder of the to-be Speaker of the City Council Abel Schilder at the City Council election speech, then violently resisted arrest, severely injuring dozens of Special Task Force members. In the following several years, the subject continued to carry out assualt against officials of the City Council, and was never caught.
110101.Criminal Record 2: An anonymous source reveals that the DisCity Councilor serial murder case contains multiple discrepancies, such as the use of Mania weapons and the severe disfiguring mutation of the corpses. The 9th Agency's investigation has confirmed that the case is related to Parma and corrupt city councilors. The subject suffered a certain degree of false accusation and was followed by hired assassins for several years.
110101.Ability Summary: With the strategic shield, hostile attacks can be warded off within a short period and morale of allies can be effectively boosted. These effects are especially effective on Demon himself.
110101.Awakening Signs: The subject's ability awakened at the scene of Abel's murder. This case consists of many suspicious details. The reports suggest that the subject erupted in intense rage and hatred at the time, but more details are to be verified in further interrogations.
110101.Corruption State: All cognitive assessments and physical examinations have returned normal results. The subject's corruption level is low and his mind is clear, with no physical signs of mutation detected.
110101.Arrest Records 1: The subject escaped the Special Task Force's siege and was on the run for years, during which he violently resisted arrest repeatedly. The MBCC and FAC joined forces to send out a large number of police officers and eventually arrested the subject after making a great deal of sacrifice.
110101.Arrest Records 2: Demon Schilder, formerly named Demon Borne, was born in Syndicate. In N.F. 95, Demon was adopted by councilor Abel Schilder and later became a captain of the Special Task Force under the FAC.
110101.Arrest Records 3: During the time when he was the FAC's Special Task Force's captain, Demon was proactive with his duties and helped Abel gain support from a considerable portion of Eastside's population. After the incident, the subject was struck off and besieged by the Special Task Force.
110101.Arrest Records 4: Investigation shows that the real culprit of Able's death is an opposition party. During the election speech, Abel was showing signs of mutation after being attacked by a Mania Weapon, and the subject had no choice but to end his life. A family member, Vera Schilder, was kidnapped by Parma lab after the incident, and is now confirmed to be dead.
110101.Performance 1: Possesses excellent shooting and wrestling skills and is well-known for that, so is frequently challenged by other Sinners. When this kind of situation occurs, no need to alert security, as the row will typically be resolved within five minutes. When it's over, please be reminded to notify the medical staff.
110101.Performance 2: Pretty receptive to media such as novels, comics, music, and films. Mostly spends his free time reading literary works. Since the subject spent most of his energy on fighting at work in the past, he hasn't yet found any hobbies he's passionate about.
110101.Performance 3: Demon is especially patient and kind toward younger Sinners, and does not usually strike back directly when encountering those Sinners' provocations and attacks. He even tries to catch up on those young Sinners' fashion and interests despite finding it very hard to chime in on these discussions.
110101.Performance 4: Having always thought his presence will bring bad luck to people around him, the subject's tendency of self-destruction is getting more serious after having learned about Vera's death. The only time this tendency is under control is when battling together with Chief.

110102.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time. If the Sinner moves, the lion head [Seven Star] will be left in the original grid. [Seven Star] can only appear once in 20 seconds. It has 100% of OwO's Max HP, Defense, and Magic Resistance, but is unable to attack. It can block 2 enemies and is immune to control effects. It will disappear after it's been attacked 6 times. Only one [Seven Star] can exist on the battlefield.
110102.Mania Intensify Text: When OwO uses [Star of Fortune], the lion head [Seven Star] will use the same skill simultaneously. The buff is not stackable.
110102.Name: OwO
110102.Criminal Record 1: OwO is an immigrant who hails from a satellite town in Outland. Cute as a button, she was adored and pampered by every household in Drifter Camp. OwO was set on keeping alive the family tradition of lion dancing, but due to her young age and the obscurity of the art form, she was virtually unknown outside Drifter Camp. It's not until the release of her blockbuster that she started attracting public attention.
110102.Criminal Record 2: Investigation reveals that the subject's power awakened due to her instinct to protect a stranger in an emergency situation. She is in fact kind and innocent, highly resistant to contamination, and mentally stable. She got into a series of accidents and disputes due to her ignorance about Sinners and the related regulations. Under the Bureau's education and monitoring, there have been no similar occurrences since.
110102.Ability Summary: Evil spirits and vicious enemies, the majestic lion keeps out. Good fortune and bountiful blessings, the glorious lion brings in.
110102.Awakening Signs: After the DisCars Incident, OwO volunteered to escort Stella the Starbeast back to its hometown. But before they arrived, they were attacked by unidentified monsters, and OwO, seized by an overwhelming desire to protect Stella, awakened her power.
110102.Corruption State: A battery of medical examinations has been conducted on OwO. The results show that she is in good mental health; as it turns out, not only does OwO has a knack for the lion dance, but she also has a knack for resisting Maniac corruption.
110102.Arrest Records 1: Chief made the acquaintance of OwO in the Blockbuster Films Incident and helped her with filmmaking. After the incident was resolved, OwO embarked on a journey to find her hometown, while her whereabouts and the situation she was in were being monitored by an MBCC agent.
110102.Arrest Records 2: OwO's parents joined the Goldionville Caravan as a way to better their situation. The family of three traveled with the caravan to DisCity. Later on, OwO's parents, convinced that DisCity would be a better place for OwO to grow up in, entrusted her to a trustworthy fellow clansman from Drifter Camp, where she was adored and pampered by the locals. Because of her upbringing, she has become a willful character who throws tantrums when things don't go her way and who never hides her pleasure when compliments come her way.
110102.Arrest Records 3: Following in her parents' footsteps, OwO took up lion dancing, and she has an all-consuming love of the art form. OwO has a giant lion head that she carries with her at all times. According to OwO herself, she and her parents once found themselves in grave peril on their way to DisCity, and she escaped unhurt by, at her parents' urge, hiding inside the lion head. So to her, it is more than just a symbol of good luck; it's a holy object that has protected her and her loved ones all this way.
110102.Arrest Records 4: OwO grew up in DisCity, but under the influence of her family, she wholeheartedly adopted the customs of her distant hometown. She felt like a misfit growing up, and loneliness was a constant companion. That's how the idea of one day returning to her hometown to reunite with her clansmen was planted.
110102.Performance 1: OwO is insolent and willful, but it's hard not to have affection for her. She became one of the most popular figures in the MBCC almost instantly, sneaking her way into the hearts of many of the Sinners and staffers.
110102.Performance 2: OwO is a big fan of Movie Night, an event organized by the MBCC in the recreation area on a regular basis. She never misses a movie, and nothing makes her tick like old-time kung fu movies. When caught up in the moment, she'll jump up and start swinging her arms and kicking her legs.
110102.Performance 3: OwO and Dudu are close; they reportedly come from the same place, and that's why they have so much to say to each other. OwO once did a lion dance accompanied by Dudu on Suona, but the effect left much to be desired.
110102.Performance 4: At first, OwO's unruliness was a real headache for Chief. But after spending time with her, Chief has figured out a way to deal with her. OwO is a crybaby who flouts rules and raises hell, but she can always be calmed down by a well-placed, well-timed compliment.

110103.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Blocks 2 enemies at the same time. When Rahu's HP is above 30%, she gains a 10% increase in Physical Damage; When it's below 30%, she gains a 10% damage reduction.
110103.Mania Intensify Text: Rahu immediately triggers [Counterblow] once when her weapon form switches to [Guardian Blade].
110103.Name: Rahu
110103.Criminal Record 1:
Born in Syndicate, she signed up with the FAC during her youthful days. After breezing through the initiation, she made her way to the FAC's elite division, showcasing her skills on the frontlines for over a decade.
Yet, in N.F. 103, tragedy struck when her squad met its end in the DisSea. This drove her to the edge, leading her to lash out at the top brass. She might have cooled down since, but whispers say she's plotting something big and dangerous.
110103.Criminal Record 2: Upon the Chief's deep dive, it's clear the subject's been brainwashed, now puppeteered by some shadowy figure from Paradeisos. This sinister influence led her to throw wrenches in our investigations and even lash out at Chief. But there's hope. Thanks to Chief's shackle abilities, this mind grip is loosening. The subject's starting to piece together her memories, and their hostile edge seems to be dulling.
110103.Ability Summary:
The subject has an innate defensive power tailored specifically to shield those she's fiercely loyal to.
After enduring the loss of someone she first vowed to protect, she recognized that just sitting back and defending wasn't enough. To truly protect, she had to be assertive and take action. That's when she mastered the skill to convert her defensive strength into raw, destructive power.
110103.Awakening Signs: Rumor has it that the subject, desperate for the "ultimate power of revenge," voluntarily used Mania Crystals. Fighting against its Mania corruption, she held onto her sanity and emerged as one of the Sinners.
110103.Corruption State: After using the Mania Crystals, she's deeply corrupted. She can suddenly lash out, tormented by sharp pain and illusions. This becomes especially noticeable when she's in a fight.
110103.Arrest Records 1: After the events at Erica Villa, the subject disappeared without a trace. However, a few months later, she came back. Because her true role as a Sinner came to light, she was moved to MBCC. While it was publicly labeled as a simple "work transfer," she was actually being detained as a Sinner.
110103.Arrest Records 2: She worked on the front lines at FAC for over a decade, joining countless missions. In July, N.F. 113, she requested some time off from her boss, Conrad Cage, and headed solo to Erica Villa. She vanished for a few months, and when she finally came back, she wouldn't talk about what happened during that period.
110103.Arrest Records 3: From Syndicate, Varna Yano, captain of the FAC's G-47 squad, brought the subject back after some mission. Once trained, the subject became an integral part of Varna's crew. However, in N.F. 103, tragedy struck: G-47 was wiped out. This catastrophe threw the subject into a spiral of severe PTSD, leading her to make some reckless decisions. Thanks to the FAC's medical team, she found her way back. But because of this dark chapter, she's always been overlooked for promotions within the FAC.
110103.Arrest Records 4: Following the mysterious assassination of Conrad Cage, there were whispers in the Bureau that she might have leaked some info that sealed his fate. But after a whirlwind of events, Chief shot down that theory. Still, playing it safe, they've kept a close eye on the subject.
110103.Performance 1: In the thick of MBCC missions, the subject stands out with an uncanny knack for battle. She's not just in sync with MBCC teammates but also gels seamlessly with other Sinners. More often than not, she'll step up to shield Chief, a habit that probably traces back to her distinct fighting flair during her time at FAC.
110103.Performance 2: The subject has been heavily affected by Mania, battling severe migraines and hearing voices that aren't there. She has a noticeable aggressive side too. But her remarkable strength of will has so far kept her from acting on these dark urges. However, we should be on high alert around her.
110103.Performance 3: The subject wields a shield, the GH-4 close-combat gauntlet from the Ring Research Institute. It wasn't initially designed to be deadly. The glowing blade that she uses during combat comes from her own power.
110103.Performance 4: Lately, the subject has been shadowing Chief everywhere. When asked about this behavior, she claim it's to protect Chief, and also to supervise, ensuring the Chief doesn't step out of line.

110104.Info: A Sinner highly contaminated by the DisSea who can block 2 enemies at the same time. Gains <color=#63b4c3>2</color> M-Value each time damage is taken, up to <color=#63b4c3>10</color> M-Value per second. Enters [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>60</color>, gaining a <color=#63b4c3>15%</color> HP boost while consuming <color=#63b4c3>4</color> M-Value per second. Leaves [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>0</color>.
110104.Name: Vanilla
110104.Criminal Record 1:
The subject was once part of the Black Ring Expedition, mainly responsible for logistical equipment maintenance. Due to her exceptional machine operation skills, she also participated in several important battles.
For ten years, she had been working alone at the DisSea Observation Outpost established right after Nightfall, where she monitored and kept records of DisSea. She later joined the expedition.
110104.Criminal Record 2: Currently detained by the MBCC. No significant abnormalities or harmful incidents have been observed to date. The subject remains within the control of the MBCC.
110104.Ability Summary: The subject uses a contaminated mechanical exoskeleton for combat. With its beyond-science transformation capabilities and extreme strength, it brings destruction in battle with its mass alone and is almost insusceptible to attacks.
110104.Awakening Signs: The subject appeared on the day of the full Illusory Moon and was personally detained by the Chief of the MBCC. Her body was severely corrupted by contamination, turning her mind completely into that of a Corruptor.
110104.Corruption State: In a state of total corruption. Entire body covered in crystalline contamination and almost completely devoid of humanity and rationality. Extremely dangerous.
110104.Arrest Records 1: After being detained during the Illusory Moon operation in DisSea, the subject has been placed in solitary confinement for observation and treatment. Since all current communication methods have proven futile, the MBCC has received the order for Chief to personally conduct dream dives with the subject.
110104.Arrest Records 2: Before her mutation, the subject was a staff member at the DisSea Observation Outpost. Her parents were scientists who worked at the outpost at the dawn of Nightfall and disappeared around N.F. 11.
110104.Arrest Records 3: In the last ten years of the outpost's operation, the subject was left alone in the station. Nonetheless, she continued to perform daily maintenance duties on her own, ensuring the basic functions of the outpost.
110104.Arrest Records 4: The subject crafted a military-grade trekking mecha alone to break through the temporal storms of DisSea. During the creation of the mech, her mind was exposed to chaotic time for an extended period and was eventually obliterated by it. The *Vanilla* observed now is believed to be her lingering thoughts attached to her mech.
110104.Performance 1: Vanilla. Female. Height: Approximately 175cm in her infected state. Her body has endured years of contamination and is covered in an extremely tough exoskeleton, under which her clothes from before her mutation are still visible. The Chief of the MBCC has awakened her remaining consciousness with the shackles. She is currently detained in a solitary cell, awaiting psychic diving.
110104.Performance 2: After completing the psychic diving, the subject will continue to be observed in solitary confinement. According to observation logs, the subject shows some response to external stimuli but lacks further interest. However, she exhibits strong emotional fluctuations and mental agitation when Chief presents to her a certain pocket watch.
110104.Performance 3: Due to the subject's habit of logging her observations, while she's being closely observed and documented, the subject also observes and studies Chief at a close distance. Her research materials have now been compiled into a volume.
110104.Performance 4: The subject is highly experienced in vehicle operation. She once evaded arrests and fled the Bureau with Chief and later returned voluntarily on the same day. The subject offered no explanation for this, but according to Chief, she simply turned back after observing the Black Ring for a brief moment. No casualties resulted from this incident, but Chief has since refused to ride in any vehicle driven by the subject.

110105.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time. At the start of the battle, Moore prioritizes granting [Matrixes] to allied Sinners on both sides. If there are fewer than two allied Sinners by her side, Moore gains the [Matrix] herself.
110105.Name: Moore
110105.Criminal Record 1: A core member of the Nirvana Cybersecurity Center, she possesses excellent network-related skills and knowledge, and was among the first to issue warnings about the dark web. Since the Gray Mirror incident, she has been involved in and provides technical support for the MBCC's dark web investigations.
110105.Ability Summary:
The subject's special power doesn't have obvious physical signs, but investigations show that her intelligence and information processing capabilities have been significantly enhanced by Mania.
With the subject's technical skills and special equipment, she can create a unique digitalized Mania-based physical firewall, providing complete defense against most known attack methods.
110105.Awakening Signs: The exact time of the subject's infection hasn't been determined, but her mental state suggests it was not recent.
110105.Corruption State: There are no obvious signs of corruption on the subject's body, but her mind has clearly been affected by Mania, showing issues like drowsiness and forgetfulness.
110105.Arrest Records 1: A core member of the Nirvana Cybersecurity Center, she exposed her identity as a Sinner while helping out with the MBCC's dark web investigations. Subsequently reassigned to the MBCC by the Cybersecurity Center, she is detained and managed there as a Sinner.
110105.Arrest Records 2: Leveraging her outstanding skills, the subject was able to detect the dangers of the dark web at its earliest stage. After a thorough investigation, she issued warnings to the authorities. These warnings were not heeded until the later stages of the Perfect Vote incident.
110105.Arrest Records 3: Investigations reveal that the subject began living independently from a young age. Influenced by a neighboring couple working at the Nirvana Cybersecurity Center, she started to delve into the study and research of network engineering-related technologies and eventually joined Nirvana.
110105.Arrest Records 4: Under the investigation of the MBCC Chief and the 9th Agency, the subject's identity was exposed as one of the creators of the entire dark web system. The subject is confirmed dead during the capture operation against her on █ █.
110105.Performance 1: Due to the nature of her work, the subject's daily routine is almost the opposite of everyone else. MBCC personnel rarely see her after 10 a.m.
110105.Performance 2: The subject has an almost pathological dependence on caffeine, with extremely high standards for coffee products. Whenever new coffee beans arrive at the Bureau, she always shows interest in trying them.
110105.Performance 3: Proficient in various network information technologies, the subject is often asked by Bureau staff and Sinners to repair computer equipment or solve network issues. Some who are addicted to online games use this as an excuse, when their real intention is to get her to boost their ranks.
110105.Performance 4: The subject is enthusiastic about modifying any network-connected devices around the Chief to block external interference. However, this causes numerous issues for the Chief when using the devices, and the subject often needs to explain the functions and usage methods. The Chief seems to have grown accustomed to this.

110106.Info: A Sinner adept at defense who can block <color=#63b4c3>2</color> enemies simultaneously. When casting her Ultimate, Yugu consumes [Tale] stacks instead of Energy. Whenever an allied Sinner casts an Ultimate that consumes at least <color=#63b4c3>15</color> Energy for one single use, Yugu gains 1 stack of [Tale], up to a maximum of 5 stacks.
110106.Mania Intensify Text: At the start of the battle, Yugu attempts to fictionalize her identity. If a certain class of allied Sinners outnumbers other classes and there are at least <color=#63b4c3>3</color> of them on the field, Yugu gains an additional tag of that class.
110106.Name: Yugu
110106.Criminal Record 1:
A mysterious storyteller from Eastia who has gained widespread acclaim in DisCity for her vivid and ingenious tales.
After careful verification, the subject has been identified as the primary culprit responsible for introducing the Mania-infected wisteria into DisCity, posing a serious threat to the city and its residents. When confronted with these accusations, the subject claimed to have no malicious intent, stating she was merely seeking *the end of the story*.
110106.Criminal Record 2: During her detention, the subject has displayed a cooperative attitude and actively assisted all investigations. Although findings indicate she still has an unhealthy obsession with tragic narratives, under Chief's guidance, she has not exhibited any further extreme behaviors. The two reached an agreement during her interrogation, and she now views Chief as essential to fulfilling her artistic pursuits, expressing willingness to remain voluntarily under the Bureau's supervision.
110106.Ability Summary: The subject's special power allows her to *create* and *record* stories through narration, projecting people or objects influenced by her Mania into these narratives. The degree of projection depends on her mental strength and the physical capabilities of those being projected. There has been at least one documented case where a person's entire existence was directly and completely projected into her story. Within these narratives, she serves as the *controller* who can alter characters' bodies and even their destinies, though using this ability depletes her own willpower. Staying in the subject's story world for too long may potentially affect a person's existence in reality.
110106.Awakening Signs: Under the subject's influence, her Mania-plagued friend fell apart in illness and became a Corruptor. Upon witnessing this tragedy of a wonderful person meeting ultimate destruction, the subject suddenly realized this was what she had been seeking all along. Wanting to hear her friend's stories, in a moment of frenzy, the subject awakened the ability to resurrect her friend within her own fictional reality.
110106.Corruption State: Moderate degree of corruption, with partial deformation in the oral cavity. She is mostly lucid and can lead a normal daily life, though in rare instances when her fervor turns uncontrollable, she could suddenly become overly immersed in her narratives.
110106.Arrest Records 1: After the wisteria fete concluded, the subject voluntarily remained in DisCity and did not resist the MBCC's apprehension and supervision, actively cooperating with all investigations. When questioned about her motives, she claimed she had developed an interest in DisCity and Chief, though the veracity of this statement is still to be determined.
110106.Arrest Records 2: The subject was born into a prestigious family in Eastia. Her parents worked in artistic fields and maintained a harmonious relationship. Growing up in a happy and loving family, she received an excellent education, read extensively, and never experienced significant setbacks. Because happiness came too easily, she lacked a concrete understanding of the idea of hardship.
110106.Arrest Records 3: The subject's family later relocated to escape the frequent disasters. During their flight, she witnessed the true face of catastrophe outside of books for the first time. The despair and suffering of people shook her immensely, marking the beginning of her later obsession with tragic destruction.
110106.Arrest Records 4: After recognizing her obsession with tragedy, she decided to embark on journeys, constantly seeking out cities in turmoil. She collected the stories of their downfall, which she would then dramatize and retell. Over time, her reputation as a storyteller became an urban legend that spread throughout Eastia and eventually reached DisCity after diplomacy between the two regions was established. Currently, she voluntarily remains at the Minos Bureau of Crisis Control, claiming she wishes to stay near Chief to witness the city's ending.
110106.Performance 1: During the early period of detention, the subject adapted well, maintaining her customary unhurried pace of life. The Bureau's library became her most frequented location, where the rich collection of DisCity stories provided her with abundant inspiration for her tragic narratives.
110106.Performance 2: The subject is considerably knowledgeable about flower planting, yet plants under her care inexplicably wither. Unlike other Sinners who lack gardening skills, she is not discouraged by this outcome. Rather, she takes pleasure in it, finding a unique beauty in withered plants.
110106.Performance 3: During her free time, the subject seems to maintain friendly relationships with most people in the Bureau and enjoys chatting with other Sinners to collect their stories. Additionally, she regularly holds storytelling sessions where she adapts and narrates new tales she has gathered.
110106.Performance 4: The subject habitually compiles her travel accounts and collected stories into bound volumes. Starting with the first volume about a *storyteller leaving her home*, she plans to chronicle everything until the day she meets her own destruction. After deciding to remain at the Bureau, she's added a blank page at the end of her collection, reserved for documenting the ending she and Chief will meet together.

110201.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110201.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110201.Name: Zoya
110201.Criminal Record 1:
The leader of Syndicate's largest violent gang *West District Legion*. Allegedly involved in over a dozen crimes including armed confrontation, arms trade, assault, etc. Took over and eliminated other gangs by illegal means and incited a new wave of unrest within Syndicate, escalating the violent conflicts in Syndicate within a short time and causing serious casualties across a wide area.
The subject's use of her power to subvert Syndicate's order severely disrupted the West District Public Security Bureau's management. The subject crossed the line and Public Security Bureau of the West District requested sent multiple requests to FAC to eliminate Zoya.
110201.Criminal Record 2: In her daily life in detention and on missions, the subject has frequently offered help to Chief. Besides, considering her actions during the containment of BR-004 and the retrieval of the Corpuscle, it's evident that her true character is considerably different than what's described in the FAC's records. She's likely not a blind supporter of violence and chaos. Despite the subject's past conflicts with the MBCC, her interests are now aligned with the Bureau's.
110201.Ability Summary: The epitome of pure physical strengthening, the subject possesses shocking power. Combined with the excellent fighting skills gained from years of training, the subject's unarmed fighting ability has pushed beyond the recorded limits of human beings.
110201.Awakening Signs: Investigation shows that the subject ambushed a gang hideout alone many years ago and was injured by a heavy mania weapon. The infection awakened the subject to her special powers and she gained control over it in no time, singlehandedly butchering the enemies at the hideout.
110201.Corruption State: Possesses impressive adaptability to one's special power, resisting almost all possible side effects the Mania can cause. No matter what tests or stimulation are applied, no signs of mutation can be detected. The subject's mental and physical conditions both remain exceptionally stable.
110201.Performance 1: No one had believed the Legion's leader would turn herself in to the MBCC, so Zoya's appearance caused quite a stir. Due to the large number of her admirers, Zoya has immense influence and appeal. This requires close attention by the Bureau.
110201.Performance 2: The subject occupied a communal lounge without approval, modified it into a *head office* with the personal signature purple and black color tones, and stored a large volume of common arms from unknown sources. Since no staff dared to stop her, the MBCC decided to turn a blind eye to this.
110201.Performance 3: Despite being revered by all Sinners with common sense, the subject never tries to put on airs in everyday life and treats everyone as comrades, teaching them fighting techniques personally. Certain Sinners are deeply touched by this and have even expressed their wish to join the *West District Legion*.
110201.Performance 4: The subject probably started saying *Chief* half-jokingly out of condescending humor, but she now uses the title out of genuine respect for a friend. Apparently, after spending much time together, there have been some changes in the subject's attitude toward the MBCC and Chief.

110202.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110202.Name: NOX
110202.Criminal Record 1:
The subject has been wandering around the DisSea for a long time, and is the origin of the urban legend *Sinner Grim Reaper*.
According to data analysis, the body mutation of the subject is highly similar to that of Corruptors, and has contagion like the Corruptors, possessing risks of further spreading the infection in DisCity.
110202.Criminal Record 2:
Since her detention, the subject's severe Mania mutation has been alleviated with Chief's help, and rumors about sightings of the so-called *Sinner Grim Reaper* have gradually died down.
In addition, the assistance and care the subject receives from other Sinners in the MBCC have lowered her risk of contagion to the minimum. She's now virtually harmless to society.
110202.Ability Summary: The subject's special power can drain the life of living beings with means beyond scientific explanation, which will continue the subject's life.
110202.Awakening Signs: Used to suffer from illness where crystals constantly grew on her body. The crystals and the explosion resonated and gave the subject special powers and new life. It is speculated that the strange disease recovery, new life generation, and power awakening happened simultaneously. The reason is unknown.
110202.Corruption State: Suffers from extremely severe infection and almost shows no signs of life, while showing characteristics of human, Sinner, Corruptor, and even corpse. The data of the subject's vital signs cannot be detected with the Bureau's equipment.
110202.Arrest Records 1: Traces of the subject's whereabouts were found in the DisSea after the FAC and MBCC sent out a large number of staff. Due to the harsh environment and the subject's dangerous powers, conventional means of arrest were not sufficient to capture the subject, who was eventually taken back by Chief.
110202.Arrest Records 2: There is no record of the subject's experience during the DisSea catastrophe. The information is destroyed in the explosion, and the MBCC is unable to investigate in the high-risk restricted area. The subject has blurry memory and is unable to perfectly recall the past. Further interrogation is needed after psychiatric treatment.
110202.Arrest Records 3: The subject used to suffer from mutation caused by aberrant crystal hyperplasia of the soft tissues, and was not able to move around freely. The subject spent 6 years living in a nursing home, "Lakeside Residence", during which her will to live came from the the rising sun under the Black Ring.
110202.Arrest Records 4: After the Black Ring's eruption, the subject wandered around in areas around the DisSea for many years in a mentally unstable state. When wandering around the DisSea, the subject constantly shifted between the controlled and power awakened states, due to the strong desire to survive. The subjective consciousness of the subject seems to have no intention to harm humans.
110202.Performance 1: Close to becoming a Corruptor, the subject has been given "extra care" by the FAC and quarantined with the highest defense standard. No normal humans are allowed to go near the room.
110202.Performance 2: Curious about everything. Often asks Chief to bring back all kinds of small appliances, game consoles, etc. and spends most of the time in the room playing with these objects to learn about modern society.
110202.Performance 3: Rarely approaches people due to contamination, but does not resist friendly socialization with some Syndicate Sinners. Being born before the DisSea explosion, only Syndicate has traces of the life of that era the subject is familiar with.
110202.Performance 4: Under Chief's guarantee and supervision, the FAC finally treats NOX less harshly, and her cheerful personality gradually started to restore. But after a series of events, the humanity in her was completely gone.

110203.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110203.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110203.Name: Deren
110203.Criminal Record 1:
Deren used to be a talented filmmaker of great renown. She was well-versed in filmmaking and was called the Master of Grotesque Romcom. But she has since stopped making movies, for reasons unknown.
In the Blockbuster Films Incident, the unleashing of her power wrecked public property and caused a large-scale stampede. She should be detained as soon as possible.
110203.Criminal Record 2:
The subject's works still contain residual Mania effect. With her permission, they have all been removed to eradicate possible contamination.
Having spent time with Chief during the blockbuster films incident and in the Bureau, the subject gradually begins to trust Chief and becomes more willing to open up. Chief's talks with the subject have been effective. Though her mindset is yet to be entirely shaken, she's not as pessimistic and indifferent as before.
110203.Ability Summary: Deren's power allows her to turn what she imagines into reality. She can turn the script or whatever she's holding into a sharp, heavy weapon by thinking about it, and she can also acquire a close approximation of the abilities of a powerful superhero by picturing herself being that superhero.
110203.Awakening Signs: According to available data, Deren's M-value might have reached the power-awakening threshold after she was exposed to an unidentified source of Mania some time ago. She then became an S-Class Sinner after experiencing mood swings while making movies. It's suspected that her movies can subject viewers to a certain level of Maniac contamination, so as a precaution, the MBCC, upon getting Deren's agreement, pulled all her movies out of circulation.
110203.Corruption State: Deren awakened her power relatively early, and suffers only from a low level of Maniac corruption, with no abnormalities found on her body. Most of the time, she's mentally stable; but her mental state is liable to become unstable when she is making movies.
110203.Arrest Records 1: During the investigation of Blockbuster Films Incident, Chief met Deren, who had been assisting OwO with film production. While resolving the crisis, Deren's powers were unleashed, causing a series of accidents including damage to public property and people being trampled. After the incident was resolved, she sought help from Chief and agreed to be detained by the MBCC.
110203.Arrest Records 2: A well-known director whose work won many DisCars, Deren was regarded in the film industry as a rare talent. She was well-versed in many aspects of filmmaking, such as writing, camerawork, soundtrack, and editing. She is also observant; she is attuned to people's feelings but knows when to step back to better dissect these feelings. She masterfully wove together the characters, the story, and the mood into a breathtaking work of art.
110203.Arrest Records 3: The movie Deren had intended to submit for DisCars consideration was dark yet romantic. Based on what she had observed, the movie brought to light the struggle and outcry of those trapped in the darkness. But under pressure from the film distributor and investors to improve their chances of winning, Deren agreed to have the movie re-edited by someone else. The re-edited version won many DisCars, but it failed to convey the message in the director's cut.
110203.Arrest Records 4: Deren didn't attend the DisCars ceremony that year, nor did she give any interviews. She received many compliments for the movie, but the compliments were nothing more than a flattering label. She left Eastside and gave up her directing career. She became nonchalant and indolent, putting up a shield of indifference to protect herself against the absurdity of the world and the stupidity of her followers.
110203.Performance 1: Deren has been nonchalant and indolent ever since she arrived at the MBCC. She goes about her business, including tasks assigned to her, without much enthusiasm, although she seems to agree with everything, never raising objections.
110203.Performance 2: Deren has the habit of springing jokes on her interlocutors, jokes that often leave them lost for words. If a joke falls flat, she won't feel upset; she'll just smile, eyes narrowed, and turn around and leave.
110203.Performance 3: Deren carries a pen and notebook in person wherever she goes. If she notices something interesting during a conversation or sees something interesting as she goes about her life, she will whip out the pen and notebook and make a note or two. You've learned that the notes she makes are ideas for movies and material that she can use in movies. To most people, the notebook is more like an unsavory collection of their embarrassing deeds.
110203.Performance 4: Deren once offered to make a documentary about the MBCC, but Chief declined, saying that the existence of the MBCC should be kept a secret. But she's persistent, still busy convincing Chief to give her permission to make movies based on the life stories of the Sinners.

110204.Info: When Donald is on the field, the Magic Damage dealt by [Electrocution] will be converted into Physical Damage at the same percentage.
110204.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110204.Name: Donald
110204.Incident: Rustfire and Drifter Camp Serial Event
110204.Criminal Record 1:
The former leader of Rustfire, who played a key role in the conflict between the West District miner union and the Nirvana Group from N.F. 103 to N.F. 104.
Joined the Executive Committee in N.F. 113, but later defected again, causing great harm to public safety in West District.
110204.Criminal Record 2: Given the significant role the subject played in the reconstruction of West District, he is allowed more freedom to move around as he pleases. He is even allowed to act as a "West District diplomat" to discuss various cooperation matters in the satellite town and Outlands.
110204.Ability Summary: During battles, the subject can summon storms and thunderbolts, sweeping across the battlefield at an extremely rapid speed, causing massive destruction. At the same time, this ability also enhances his physical capabilities in all aspects, allowing him to win and survive in almost any harsh battlefield environment.
110204.Awakening Signs: The subject claims that he awakened a very long time ago, dating back to as early as his teenage years when he fought gang members on the streets, but he doesn't explain the specifics.
110204.Corruption State: The subject was treated inhumanely after N.F. 104 as he suffered a mental breakdown, and his ability went out of control for a while. But after treatment, he is cured and mentally stable, showing no obvious signs of Mania.
110204.Arrest Records 1: Shortly after the conclusion of the serial incidents in West District, the subject unexpectedly turned himself in and expressed to Chief that he required the MBCC's support for some reconstruction matters in West District.
110204.Arrest Records 2: The former leader of Rustfire, disappeared after the BR-002 mining incident and didn't return until N.F. 113. Operating in the West District as an Executive Officer of the Executive Committee, he was considered a traitor by the remaining members of Rustfire for a while.
110204.Arrest Records 3: After the mining incident, the subject was confirmed to be under the control of a subordinate organization affiliated with the Nirvana Group, forced to make a public speech betraying Rustfire. He was then sent to Banyan Fourth Hospital for research on the stimulus and intensification of Sinner Mania. After a mental breakdown, he was abandoned and handed over to Dr. Das Alz.
110204.Arrest Records 4: During his treatment at the hospital, he met Samuel, an acquaintance from his Rustfire days. Until he was removed from Banyan Fourth Hospital by the Executive Committee for unknown reasons, the two maintained close contact, plotting several covert operations to assist Rustfire.
110204.Performance 1: The subject is quite outgoing, attempting to strike up conversations with anyone he can communicate with and trying to persuade them to assist in the reconstruction of West District. Due to the frequency and intensity of these conversations, he has received numerous complaints.
110204.Performance 2: For unknown reasons, the subject rarely uses his Sinner abilities. However, thanks to his superior physical capabilities and combat skills, he can easily handle most combat scenarios.
110204.Performance 3: The subject has an excellent relationship with his aunt. He often invites the Chief and his close Sinner friends to his aunt's place for a visit and to taste her homemade stew.
110204.Performance 4: With the Chief's special approval, the subject was allowed to walk around freely in the MBCC, traveling to the West District, Eastside, and many other places to support the reconstruction of the West District.

110205.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Gains a <color=#63b4c3>50%</color> Attack Speed boost when the Ultimate energy is fully charged.
110205.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110205.Name: Yao
110205.Incident: Tide of Ashes - Ten Scorching Suns
110205.Criminal Record 1: A mysterious woman who appeared in Chief's dream, foretelling the calamity of the Ten Scorching Suns. Her true identity is unknown, but she is suspected to have a deep connection with the S-Class Apostle of Ashes - Sun Crow who wreaked havoc across the Eastian continent.
110205.Criminal Record 2: The subject has returned to WhiteSands, fighting against the Tide of Ashes by instinct. Her threat level is currently deemed low, and Paradeisos has arranged for personnel to closely monitor her. Emergency measures will be taken immediately if any danger arises.
110205.Ability Summary: This special power allows precise control over physically inextinguishable flames. These flames disregard physical combustion points and burn everything they touch, tainting it deeply with Mania until the subject stops the attack or the target is completely destroyed.
110205.Awakening Signs: According to the MBCC Chief's investigation, the subject had awakened as a Sinner before the Eastian disasters. At the time, her ability was a channeling Mania power very commonly seen in Eastia. Later, her power underwent significant changes for unknown reasons during Eastia's ten-sun disaster in N.F. 106.
110205.Corruption State: The subject's body is covered in contamination, closely resembling that of the Apostle of Ashes - Sun Crow. With a high level of corruption, she relies on the shackles to suppress the Mania and maintain a certain degree of human mentality.
110205.Arrest Records 1: After *Ten Scorching Suns* ended, with the Apostle of Ashes - Sun Crow defeated, the MBCC's Chief temporarily lost connection with the Sinner. Later, with the help of Eastian Sinner Yanyan, a child form of the alleged target Sinner was found in the heart of WhiteSands.
110205.Arrest Records 2:
After the defeat of the Sun Crow Apostle, the subject was reborn as a child. Chief personally cared for her and suppressed the Sun Crow Apostle's Mania power inside her with the shackles, thus keeping her sane and preventing her from turning into an Apostle.
The Bureau collected samples of her flames during her sleep and sent them to Paradeisos for evaluation. Chief's judgment proved correct. It is indeed Sinner Yao's ability and the juvenile Sinner's identity is confirmed as *Yao*.
110205.Arrest Records 3: The subject has been growing at an astonishing rate. In just a few months, she has grown into an adult female form. However, her consciousness and cognition are still in need of guidance and she still exhibits animalistic, instinctual behaviors, and sometimes even goes into an Apostle-like state. Close attention from all staff is constantly required.
110205.Arrest Records 4:
It has been confirmed that the Bureau's Tide of Ashes alarm was triggered by an unrecorded Apostle of Ashes lurking in the depths of WhiteSands. This Apostle's power is comparable to that of Sinner Yao. This has led the authorities to believe their power shares the same source and that as the subject's ability grows, the corresponding power of the Apostle of Ashes will also intensify. Therefore, Paradeisos has made an exception and approved the continuous detention and supervision of the subject by the Minos Bureau of Crisis Control. However, the Chief of the Bureau is to closely monitor the subject and her growth for information necessary for deductions about the Apostle of Ashes.
It is noted that the subject is currently allowed to reside in WhiteSands and return to the Bureau regularly for examinations and interrogation.
110205.Performance 1: During the early stages of detention, as the subject was still very young and didn't have perfect control of her power, she would sometimes leak out sporadic flames unknowingly, burning a total of thirty-seven items in the Bureau. Following repeated reminders from Chief, she's begun learning to control it, and the staff also make sure not to let flammable objects near her.
110205.Performance 2: Due to her animalistic nature, the subject sometimes demonstrates non-human behaviors such as flying, eating without utensils, and sleeping while standing. As long as she doesn't disrupt the normal operations of the Bureau, Chief and the staff generally do not intervene in these behaviors.
110205.Performance 3: Upon reaching adulthood, the subject can communicate normally with people. However, perhaps inheriting part of her *parent*'s temperament (real reason to be explored), she doesn't always tell the truth, and the genuineness of her words requires verification. Currently, having mistakenly believed what she says, some Sinners have begun to sleep standing, believing they can grow wings for flying that way.
110205.Performance 4: Having spent her childhood alongside Chief, the subject displays complete trust and a certain dependency on Chief. After returning to her life in WhiteSands, she regularly returns to the Bureau for examinations and to visit Chief. Chief stores the fiery feathers left behind by the subject during each visit in a special storage box in the office.

110206.Info: A Sinner highly contaminated by the DisSea. She gains <color=#63b4c3>3</color> M-value whenever any unit dies on the field, up to <color=#63b4c3>15</color> M-value per second. When an allied Sinner dies, she gains <color=#63b4c3>60</color> M-value additionally. This effect can be triggered up to <color=#63b4c3>3</color> times per battle. When her M-value reaches <color=#63b4c3>60</color>, she enters [Corruption State], gaining an <color=#63b4c3>8%</color> Attack bonus while consuming <color=#63b4c3>4</color> M-value per second. [Corruption State] ends when her M-value reaches <color=#63b4c3>0</color>.
110206.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110206.Name: Pylgia
110206.Criminal Record 1:
The subject formerly served as a diver in the Deep Dive unit of the Black Ring Expedition, primarily responsible for placing and maintaining equipment in DisSea, as well as conducting underwater inspections.
Despite the numerous hazards in the depths of DisSea, she has almost never been injured or lost during her missions.
110206.Criminal Record 2: Currently detained by and under the management of the MBCC. No significant abnormalities or harmful incidents have been observed to date. The situation remains within the bureau's control.
110206.Ability Summary: The subject's weapon is a diving harpoon, but she does not usually fish with it and instead only uses it for self-defense when attacked by hostile marine life.
110206.Awakening Signs: The subject appeared on the day of the full Illusory Moon, causing a widespread blackout in the DisSea region. She was personally detained by the MBCC's Chief. Her body shows signs of contamination and corruption, and is already transforming into a Corruptor.
110206.Corruption State: The subject exhibits moderate corruption, retaining both humanity and rational thought, though her body is already manifesting irreversible physical changes typical during the Corruptor transformation.
110206.Arrest Records 1: After being detained during the Illusory Moon operation in DisSea, the subject has been placed in solitary confinement for observation and treatment. Since all current communication methods have proven futile, the MBCC has received the order for Chief to personally conduct dream dives with the subject.
110206.Arrest Records 2: The subject was born in a coastal fishing town. Due to her flawed personality, she was highly unsociable and spent most of her time alone in the sea.
110206.Arrest Records 3: Intensifying disasters eventually forced all industries in the fishing town to come to a halt. Like many local residents, her parents chose to relocate in search of new opportunities. She had to leave the sea behind, struggling to blend in as a normal person.
110206.Arrest Records 4:
In N.F. 22, the subject joined the DisSea Expedition as a diver. While her assignments were significantly more dangerous and demanding than those of regular divers, she was unfazed by these challenges.
The subject preferred staying in the ocean to navigating the complexities of human interactions.
110206.Performance 1: Pylgia. Female. Height in infected state: approximately 169cm. Her skin is covered in numerous barnacles and a damaged diving suit. Her body is mildly decayed and has developed several long extra appendages.
110206.Performance 2: After completing the psychic diving, the subject will remain in confinement for observation. According to the log, she prefers staying in vast, dark waters quietly.
110206.Performance 3: The barnacles and appendages on the subject's body are not mere contamination, but have become part of her body. They shed and regenerate from beneath her skin periodically.
110206.Performance 4: The subject exhibits extremely limited social engagement, responding to no humans other than Chief. Reminding Chief to visit her regularly can effectively slow down the contamination rate and prevent the Mania from worsening.

110208.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110208.Mania Intensify Text: For each [Life Loss] state carried by the enemy, Jasmine gains a <color=#63b4c3>6%</color> damage boost against them.
110208.Name: Jasmine
110208.0: The subject was a member of an Outlands delegation that visited DisCity during the Great Expo, operating under the guise of a performer. During her performance, her abilities destabilized, resulting in extensive property damage. Given the severity of the incident, immediate detention and further investigation are recommended.
110208.1: Investigations indicate that the subject is a victim of an Outland war. During the conflict, she endured severe physical and psychological torture, leading to a loss of rationality and distorted perceptions. As a result, conventional treatment methods proved ineffective. However, after receiving comfort and guidance from the Chief, her cooperation has significantly improved, and her aggressive tendencies have diminished. With the Chief's support, she is now working to overcome her trauma and reintegrate into a normal life.
110208.2: The subject can form a deep resonance with specialized War weapons, enabling their physical attacks to be infused with Mania. This infusion forces victims into a state of uncontrollable bleeding.
110208.3: The subject claims to have accidentally come into contact with residual battlefield Mania during the Outland war, an exposure that triggered her awakening as a Sinner.
110208.4: Corruption levels are critically high, and her mental state is profoundly unstable, marked by symptoms including auditory hallucinations. Despite this, her ability to disguise herself is extraordinary. At first glance, she could easily pass as an ordinary human. However, when subjected to extreme excitement, the scars inflicted by Mania would begin to glow across her body.
110208.5: During her performance at the Great Expo's closing ceremony, the subject publicly disclosed her identity as a Sinner and proceeded to destroy multiple high-value artworks. Following her apprehension by the FAC, she was remanded to the MBCC for detention and further management.
110208.9: Upon resuming normal activities, the subject adapted to the Bureau environment with remarkable speed, systematically identifying all supply sources and potential hiding spots, even discovering Faye's secret stash.
110208.10: Upon discovering clusters of jasmine flowers in the Bureau's greenhouse, the subject exhibited remarkable enthusiasm and promptly volunteered to assume plant care responsibilities in exchange for daily access to the blossoms. The Chief approved the request, simultaneously granting permission to move several jasmine plants to the subject's room.
110208.11: In daily life, the subject engages in surprisingly broad social interactions, showing a distinct preference for befriending Sinners with straightforward personalities. Observations indicate that she has discussed dance with Hamel and shared wilderness survival tips with Mantis. However, to mitigate potential risks, direct contact between her and Sinners tied to the FAC, such as Rahu, should be minimized whenever possible.
110208.12: The subject initially refused the private accommodations arranged by the Bureau, insisting instead on sharing a room with the Chief. She was so determined that she even offered to bring her own bedding and sleep on the floor beside the Chief's bed. Despite repeated attempts to dissuade her, she remained adamant, claiming that only by the Chief's side could she feel the comfort of home and sleep peacefully. It was only after the Chief personally promised to check on her nightly—whenever possible—that she reluctantly agreed to stay in her own quarters.
110208.13: The subject is, in fact, a covert Outland extremist who infiltrated DisCity with the intent to assassinate high-ranking FAC officials and undermine DisCity's security. The attack she initiated during the Great Expo's closing ceremony resulted in significant casualties and widespread destabilization, warranting immediate detention and stringent containment measures.
110208.14: During the Outland war, the subject was captured by enemy forces during a battlefield sweep. Exposed to Mania from enemy weapons, she awakened to newfound abilities, and with them, a burning vengeance.

110301.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Can deal multiple Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
110301.Mania Intensify Text: Upon breaking enemies' cores, CRIT Rate is increased by <color=#63b4c3>50%</color> for <color=#63b4c3>10</color> seconds. This effect cannot be stacked by breaking enemies' cores multiple times.
110301.Name: Bai Yi
110301.Criminal Record 1:
The owner of shell company *Whitestone Industries*, the subject engaged in illegal businesses such as debt collection and hired thug recruitment. The subject has indirectly participated in all sorts of violent and illegal activities over a hundred times, causing massive property damage as well as posing an immeasurable threat to the Syndican region's stability.
The subject claims to have grown up in Syndicate, but no records concerning the identity *Bai Yi* dated before N.F. 105 can be found, so the subject is suspected to have forged her identity to cover up other crimes.
110301.Criminal Record 2:
Although the subject remains sluggish and noncompliant after her arrest, she's ceased all illegal activities, both personal and under the name of Whitestone Industries. Currently, all three members of the company, Bai Yi, K.K., and Che, are stable and happy about their newfound life security and the fact that they don't need to exhaust themselves with work anymore. They show no tendency or possibility of escape.
It's confirmed that the subject has no other aliases or criminal records except those that are already on file. The only new discovery is that the subject may be related to *Parma*.
110301.Ability Summary: The power supports the subject's movement at supersonic speed while maintaining impressive preciseness. Equipped with her sword named *Halo*, the subject can vanquish dozens of enemies within three seconds. Seeing that the record is still being broken constantly, the subject possesses unimaginable potential.
110301.Awakening Signs: The subject seems to have awakened years ago, but no available means can accurately deduce the time she first used her power and the reason for her awakening is still unknown.
110301.Corruption State: Despite the subject's potent power, no Mania symptoms can be detected in her unless through advanced screening and lab analysis. The subject's condition seriously contradicts existing Mania level patterns and its cause is still to be investigated.
110301.Arrest Records 1: The subject accidentally bumped into the MBCC's patrol while evading debt collectors, injuring several people. Later, a surveillance check suggested that this person showed signs of possessing Sinner power, and the subject was arrested after confirmation.
110301.Arrest Records 2: The database denied the MBCC's request to access the subject's early records, and the subject is unwilling to provide relevant information. There has been no progress on the investigation of the subject's childhood and family background.
110301.Arrest Records 3: With limited access to the subject's records, it's currently only known that before settling in Syndicate, the subject apparently changed identities frequently to evade an unknown power hunting her down. After settling down in Syndicate, the subject started running *Whitestone Industries* with Che and K.K., taking the role of the company's owner. The company has since been on the verge of bankruptcy multiple times.
110301.Arrest Records 4: The subject hides her past and her true levels of power under her playful and frivolous appearance. Her real identity, and the mysterious individuals hunting her down when she's after the fake Whitestone Industries require further investigations.
110301.Performance 1: In stark contrast to her appalling power, the subject is unenthusiastic about all basic job duties and assigned missions and completely lacks the concept of time. There has been no improvement even after repeated warnings.
110301.Performance 2: Having taken miscellaneous jobs like hired thug, delivery worker, and missing person searcher in the past, the subject is very willing to share her seasoned work experience with other Sinners. But as the subject's sharing often reflects questionable personal values, these chats have been interrupted by staff many times.
110301.Performance 3: Skilled at making her own drinks with various grains and unknown ingredients, but never sells them and only shares them with other Sinners within a certain range. Among them, a drink named *Moonlight Baby* has received many praises and won the subject quite a few friends in the Bureau.
110301.Performance 4: Have made several attempts to sell *Whitestone Industries*'s shares to people around her, but in vain. Out of compassion and encouragement, Chief has bought a small number of shares. To show her gratitude, the subject has suggested partnership with Chief to bind their interests together. Chief has not responded so far.

110302.Info: A Sinner adept at stealth assaults. Can deal Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
110302.Mania Intensify Text: Automatically enters [Shadow Stealth] once at the start of a battle.
110302.Name: Crache
110302.Criminal Record 1:
Rumored to be the leader of an influential group in Syndicate. Any marginalized individual who goes to the "appointed place" with the badge to seek help from Crache will receive unconditional help from her.
The subject has led the group to participate in more than a hundred violent conflicts, and used her special powers to seriously injure countless people in other groups of Syndicate.
110302.Criminal Record 2:
The subject claims to be the leader of the Syndican gang *the Homeless* and helps other children solve their problems. She offers aid exclusively to children. The Homeless got involved in street fights mostly because the subject wanted to stop human trafficking and violence toward children.
Since her detention, the subject has appeared less motivated in general. Although she's shown no signs of violence or tendency to escape, further supervision is required.
110302.Ability Summary: She can use all shadows around her as weapons. Her ability, however, has a strong side effect. It will create great inertia, causing mental fatigue to the user and creating dependence on special powers.
110302.Awakening Signs: Her awakening was rather recent. She is suspected to be involved in an important case regarding another dangerous group in Syndicate. Further interrogation and investigation are required to shed some light.
110302.Corruption State: Suspected exposure to contamination derivatives, but no close contact with the contamination source itself. Some degree of listlessness is present, but no further deterioration of symptoms for the time being.
110302.Arrest Records 1: Based on the information provided by the Executive Committee and the 9th Agency, the MBCC organized a search operation for the S-Class Sinner Crache. Finally, with the assistance of several Sinners, Chief succeeded in controlling the subject.
110302.Arrest Records 2: According to credible intelligence: Crache is a founding member of the Syndicate organization "the Homeless", and it is highly likely that she's its leader.
110302.Arrest Records 3: Crache has been protecting "the Homeless" for years. Whenever a kid paints a "Homeless" emblem nearby, the gangsters who hurt them reportedly get "punished".
110302.Arrest Records 4: "The Homeless" is a relatively loose organization. Under Crache's protection, they hardly face any threats to their safety. They band together to live, and each does their part to find basic necessities. Intelligence has not observed Crache in any leadership role. Thus, there is insufficient evidence to designate "the Homeless" as a gang.
110302.Performance 1: She resorted to hiding in the shadows many times to dodge all MBCC fieldwork. As a result, the Bureau staff members can be seen looking for the Sinner with flashlights during the day.
110302.Performance 2: As she lacks interest in everything, the Bureau staff helped her develop her interests and complete her basic education. It did not work out in the end due to reasons such as being caught sleeping under her desk, injuring a teacher or staff member, disappearing in the middle of class.
110302.Performance 3: The majority of Sinners from Syndicate are aware of Crache's existence and appreciate her capabilities. However, Crache does not care about this and would only refer to the vast majority of Sinners in the Bureau as "obnoxious adults."
110302.Performance 4: Unlike people of her age, the subject hates sweets, especially lollipops, even if they are given by Chief. "But I'll think about it if it's hand-made by Chief."

110303.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Damage whose Ultimate deals Core Damage. Normal Attack is dealt first to enemies with [Fang] marks together with additional (Attack * <color=#63b4c3>40%</color>) <color=#c47d20>Magic Damage</color>.
110303.Mania Intensify Text: When an enemy with a [Fang] mark receives another [Fang] mark, the enemy suffers (Attack *<color=#63b4c3>200%</color>) <color=#c47d20>Magic Damage</color> from Serpent.
110303.Name: Serpent
110303.Case: Multiple Cases of Missing Persons of Interest
110303.Criminal Record 1:
One of the top performers in Phantom Entertainment. She searches for specific targets using a novelty show as a cover and confines them, among other things, without any regard for consequences. This has caused a panic and greatly disrupted the order in Eastside.
The subject once took extreme measures to put the Chief of the MBCC in danger in their confrontation. Therefore, the object is regarded by the FAC as a highly dangerous Sinner and must be detained immediately.
110303.Criminal Record 2: Since her detention, regular examinations have found that the subject's stress has reached a dangerous level. The finding can explain her various behaviors prior to her detention. To lower her insecurity and stabilize her mental state, the MBCC conducts desensitization therapy on her in the form of monitored physical contact with other Sinners or Chief when her conditions allow it. So far, this has been effective and her various indicators have been kept within the normal range.
110303.Ability Summary: The subject awakened her power after being infected with Mania and bitten by a snake. When the snake venom combined with the Maniac energies inside her, she became a Sinner with some of the characteristics of snakes. The subject is good at covering her tracks and sensing heat sources, and her blood is toxic—these characteristics make her a great stealthy fighter.
110303.Awakening Signs: The subject doesn't know where she got infected with Mania, but remembers being on the brink of death due to a snakebite she sustained as a teenager. She was saved by Mania, which awakened her power and turned her into a Sinner.
110303.Corruption State: Upon examination, it's found that the subject suffers from a high level of Maniac corruption, but that her mind has not been affected significantly. No Mania Crystals have been found on her body, but her teeth, ears, eyes, and skin have taken on a snake-like characteristic.
110303.Arrest Records 1: When Chief is on a mission in Eastside, Serpent gets in the way of and tries to provoke Chief. After Chief has solved everything, Serpent owns up to the crimes she has committed, and voluntarily agrees to be detained, though it is not clear if she has an ulterior motive.
110303.Arrest Records 2: Serpent's origin is a mystery. She's registered as an orphan from Eastside by Phantom Entertainment. But further investigations show that she's closely linked to the Pet Snake Incident, the Disappearance of Phantom Entertainment Guests, and other strange cases.
110303.Arrest Records 3:
A family of four from a villa neighborhood in Eastside has gone missing mysteriously. According to info on the internet and testimonies of the family's neighbors, the family kept a python as a pet, which was taken care of by a girl. The girl and the snake has also gone missing.
Through a comparison of different sources of information, it's confirmed that the girl is Sinner Serpent.
110303.Arrest Records 4: A recheck on all the information concerning Serpent turns up something bewildering about her, like where she attained the Bottle of Dreams. The MBCC is convinced that some person or people put Serpent up to it, and decides to dig deeper into her background.
110303.Performance 1: The MBCC tried to detain Serpent and her snake in separate places, but the snake becomes agitated and restless in its cage, posing a threat to the lives of the staffers. Therefore the MBCC had to return the snake to Serpent's side.
110303.Performance 2: The subject is very demanding about the temperature and humidity of living quarters. She demands a constant temperature, or she will not cooperate in any operations. Once, on a hot summer day, the subject stripped off every piece of clothing, let her snake cover up the private parts, and carried out a protest, to express her dissatisfaction.
110303.Performance 3: The subject retains some habits she acquired as a performer with Phantom Entertainment, which help her build fairly amicable relationships in the MBCC. But when the subject perceives sarcasm or threat in the interlocutor's remarks, she tends to overreact. Some staffers said they felt their lives were under threat, and only a few Sinners find the way Serpent reacts quite amusing.
110303.Performance 4: Once, while talking with Chief, the subject used her snake to bind her feet and Chief's together to stop Chief from leaving the room. When questioned, the subject claimed that she just wanted a warmer to put under her blanket.

110304.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
110304.Mania Intensify Text: When no other Sinners are present within the cross area range, Adela gains a <color=#63b4c3>15%</color> CRIT Rate increase.
110304.Name: Adela
110304.Criminal Record 1:
An Eastside hairdresser as well as the subject of the *Fog Alley* urban legend. Appearing mostly in the dark alley at night, she's been accused of multiple crimes including attacking residents and obscuring their memories.
Due to the nature of her ability, her victims' accounts are often dismissed as fiction. Incomplete research shows that she's victimized close to a hundred people.
110304.Criminal Record 2: With Chief's help, the subject has regained partial memories about the Fog Alley case. When her identity was exposed, she often severed all relationships and moved to a new place. It's believed that she aspires to the mundanity of daily life to compensate for the lack of close relationships. Through interactions with Chief, she gradually recognizes the MBCC as her new base and no longer provides her previous extreme services.
110304.Ability Summary:
Her ability can interfere with others' minds and perception of the past. So far, the recorded direct effect is influencing or altering memories. The duration and effect of the ability depends on the subject's condition.
Besides causing mental influence, her shears, made of a material stronger than regular metals, can also deal physical damage.
110304.Awakening Signs: The reason and exact time of power awakening is unknown. The nature of her ability severely hinders the investigation, but judging from the timeline of the spread of the Fog Alley legend, she must have already awakened for some time.
110304.Corruption State: Although her physical appearance is normal, her physical abilities are actually far superior to those of ordinary people. It's not immediately apparent, but the subject has long been plagued by hallucinations and her memories show signs of self-interference.
110304.Arrest Records 1: During the Fog Alley case, the subject fled after severing all the witnesses' memories about her. She then repeatedly escaped the FAC's arrests and was eventually captured by Chief and brought back to the MBCC.
110304.Arrest Records 2: The subject has repeatedly altered others' and her own memories, which seriously impacts her own mental state. It's currently impossible to verify if her obsession with the mundanity of daily life is linked to her past experiences.
110304.Arrest Records 3: The investigation shows that the subject lived with her mother since childhood, shouldering most daily chores and tolerating her mothers' negative emotions constantly. Her past with her mother could be key to her awakening.
110304.Arrest Records 4: For her mother's happiness, the subject trimmed off both her and her mother's memories of each other. In the following years, she *served* her clients with her ability by cutting away their trouble-inducing memories until she was found out. She kept moving homes to protect her daily life, unintentionally spreading the urban legend surrounding her.
110304.Performance 1: Though she hasn't shown particular interest in things other than serving clients, she often keeps flowers and fragrances in her cell, calling it *a trick to mask the smell of hair spray*.
110304.Performance 2: The subject's highly likable character makes the Sinners and staff lower their guard and open up to her easily. After two attack attempts, the MBCC decided to hold an internal seminar to promote the importance of privacy. In response, Adela claimed that she was only trying to help them.
110304.Performance 3: The subject has transformed her cell into a vintage-style hair salon where she provides various services to the Sinners in the Bureau. Rumor has it that she can produce anything from her counter, and many like to test that theory for fun. But this service has soon been restricted ever since she took out a forbidden weapon from her counter.
110304.Performance 4: She invites Chief to an afternoon tea every week and always prepares ample treats beforehand. This is the only occasion that she insists Chief come alone as she prefers not to be disturbed by other Sinners. "Being by Chief's side is the mundane routine I dream of."

110305.Info: A Sinner highly contaminated by the DisSea. Gains <color=#63b4c3>2</color> M-Value each time damage is dealt, up to <color=#63b4c3>10</color> M-Value per second. Enters [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>50</color>, gaining an <color=#63b4c3>8%</color> Attack increase while consuming <color=#63b4c3>4</color> M-Value per second. Leaves [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>0</color>.
110305.Name: Mantis
110305.Criminal Record 1:
The subject was once a member of the Black Ring Expedition, but due to missing data, her identity cannot be confirmed.
The subject has been wandering in DisSea for a long time, and is often sighted. FAC personnel refer to her as "Mantis."
110305.Criminal Record 2: Currently detained by and under the management of the MBCC. To date, no obvious abnormalities or incidents of harm have occurred. Everything is under the MBCC's control.
110305.Ability Summary: The subject's physical structure closely mirrors that of some known calamitous apostles, namely the Mantis tribe. Her biological organs and abilities include high-speed vision, super reflexes, and a chitinous exoskeleton. This allows her to adapt to the extreme survival conditions within the Black Ring.
110305.Awakening Signs: The subject typically appears during the active period of the Black Ring in DisSea, and was personally detained by the MBCC Chief. Unlike some other Sinners who have been in DisSea for a long time, her body still retains some vitality, but vastly differs from human physiology.
110305.Corruption State: In a state of total corruption, she has almost completely lost her humanity and rationality, making communication impossible.
110305.Arrest Records 1: After the subject was detained near DisSea under the Illusory Moon, she was placed in confinement for observation and treatment. Since it was impossible to communicate with her using normal means, the MBCC was instructed that the Chief would personally reach out to her via psychic diving.
110305.Arrest Records 2: Upon investigation, the subject's original name was discovered to be Marguerite Nash. She was a member of the Black Ring Expedition, and a renowned archaeologist and survival show host during the early days of the post-Perishing Star era. Throughout the later stages of her career, she was dedicated to pursuing and studying the Tide of Ashes and calamitous apostles.
110305.Arrest Records 3: The production team the subject was part of was confirmed to have perished due to an accident ■■ years ago. She was the sole survivor. Her impressive archaeological and survival skills led to her joining the Black Ring Expedition.
110305.Arrest Records 4:
During her time with the Black Ring Expedition, the subject firmly believed that the calamitous apostles could be understood and communicated with. She left the team on her own on Day ■ and has been missing since. 
Her body, affected by Mania, has assimilated with the apostle tribe "Mantis." Since then, she has been wandering around DisSea.
110305.Performance 1: Mantis, female, 171cm tall in her infected state. Her physiological structure is consistent with the calamitous apostle tribe "Mantis," thus her name.
