Her body is covered in an insect-like chitinous shell, and some of her habits are also similar to insects. Currently, she is shackled in the containment room by the MBCC Chief, waiting to undergo psychic diving.
110305.Performance 2: After the completion of the psychic diving, the subject has been placed in the containment room for long-term observation. She appears to maintain a strong sense of curiosity and goodwill. However, severe Mania contamination and other unknown factors cause adverse physical mutations in humans around her. Therefore, contact with her should be avoided by anyone other than the Chief.
110305.Performance 3: Due to her physiological structure, the subject has retained some insect habits. Her senses are extremely sharp, capable of hearing sounds from several rooms away. The subject seems to have a certain desire to express herself and attempts to communicate with other individuals. However, apart from the Chief, no one can understand what she is trying to express.
110305.Performance 4: Compared to the food produced in the cafeteria, the subject prefers "collecting" fresh ingredients. After being counseled by the Chief, this behavior has been curtailed.

110306.Info: Angell collects a [Blade Shade] every <color=#63b4c3>15</color> seconds or when an enemy loses a core. She gains <color=#63b4c3>2</color> Energy for each [Blade Shade] collected. [Blade Shade] can be stacked up to <color=#63b4c3>6</color> times.
110306.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110306.Name: Angell
110306.Criminal Record 1:
A renowned contractor on the dark web with skills so refined she can navigate the most guarded environments with ease. The subject has never failed a task accepted on the dark web. Despite that, she's aloof and mysterious and only takes on few orders on an irregular schedule.
To the unsuspecting neighbors, the subject's just a quiet, introverted girl who's not good at socializing and rarely leaves her home.
110306.Criminal Record 2:
Never intending to commit crimes or harm others, the subject simply sees the dark web jobs as a means to make a living. Under Chief's attention and guidance, her mental state and living conditions have significantly improved.
After assessment, it's clear the subject simply got used to her profession and lifestyle and poses no threat to society. She could even potentially provide invaluable help to the Bureau if needed.
110306.Ability Summary: Her special power can significantly enhance her senses. When fully alert, the subject can detect any lethal threats or potential dangers within a kilometer radius of herself and those around her.
110306.Awakening Signs: According to the subject, her awakening happened early in her career. She was critically injured by a Mania weapon on a job and her special power awakened on the brink of death.
110306.Corruption State: Her overall level of corruption is moderate, with no obvious signs on her body. However, her mental corruption is rather severe, leading to a demeanor that is indifferent, apathetic, and detached.
110306.Arrest Records 1: During the MBCC's cleansing operation against the gang remnants, the subject accepted a dark web job to abduct Chief that did not inflict any harm on Chief. Later, she escorted Chief to rejoin the MBCC's crew and secretly helped eliminate a large number of residual gangsters.
110306.Arrest Records 2: Highly tolerant of chaotic environments, the subject lacks a sense of cleanliness which leads to her dwelling's floors being so cluttered there's not even space to walk on. The subject doesn't have a saving habit, and only accepts orders on the dark web when she runs out of money. Unless required by a job, the subject does not actively follow any external news, leading an almost static, isolated life.
110306.Arrest Records 3: Affected by her special power, the subject's senses are overly sharp, hence she usually needs to wear headphones and play music to block out noise in order to sleep. The subject also listens to music during outdoor activities or combat to shield herself from external disturbances so that she can focus.
110306.Arrest Records 4: The subject's apparent indifference stems from a clear understanding of herself and reality. Since being pulled into the shadows of the dark web as a contractor, the subject has realized she can no longer return to normal social life. She has accepted her life as an outcast in the dark and carved out her own path, always guarding what she's determined to protect in her own way.
110306.Performance 1: Aloof and taciturn, the subject prefers enclosed spaces and rarely leaves her room unless necessary. She often spends her free time staring blankly at a fish tank in her room.
110306.Performance 2: The subject cherishes her blade, regularly cleaning and maintaining it. She practices swinging it every day without fail. The blade is always with her and she considers it as an extension of her body, even keeping it by her side while sleeping.
110306.Performance 3: The subject's many legendary deeds had already spread among the Sinners upon her arrival at the MBCC. Her unassuming, solitary, and taciturn nature gives her an attractive and mysterious air. Her *self-reliant and aloof* demeanor has once attracted the admiration and emulation of many younger Sinners.
110306.Performance 4: The subject rarely initiates contact with others, but Chief is an exception. After leaving the MBCC, she invites Chief to her safe house periodically. Chief always honors the invitations regardless of the amount of work at hand, bringing along heaps of fresh ingredients and cleaning supplies.

110308.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
110308.Incident: N.F. 114 DisCity Dark Web Serial Event
110308.Criminal Record 1:
In N.F. 114, a series of malicious events stemming from the dark web erupted across the city. All are catalyzed by Mania, and possibly the work of a criminal organization.
The subject is active in the dark web and closely linked to this serial event.
110308.Criminal Record 2: Twl yiuyy uv Mbid oqdx Qe hdtc gyvpm jv tjaco ixtcn
110308.Ability Summary: Measurement results abnormal. Forced interference may lead to reality distortion and other adverse consequences. Close observation is required.
110308.Corruption State: The degree of Mania corruption is extremely high, manifesting as abnormal substances on the surface of the body. Specific values cannot be detected by conventional methods.
110308.Arrest Records 1: The subject first appeared around the time Top Hitman Angell kidnapped the Chief. Her identity and past are unknown, and she mainly operates via the Internet. After detecting the subject's connection to the dark web incidents, the MBCC detained her.
110308.Arrest Records 2: Investigations indicate that the subject lost her parents early in life and was taken in by the "Noir" organization, which exploited her hacking skills for profit. After coming of age, she chose to leave Noir, but they processed the software she left behind into a malicious virus, which continues to spread on the dark web.
110308.Arrest Records 3: In July N.F. 114, the remnants of Noir were completely subdued by the MBCC. However, both the Chief and the subject went missing after the operation.
110308.Arrest Records 4: With the subject's help, all individuals involved in the dark web incidents were captured, and all virus files were found and destroyed. Henceforth, the subject will continue to provide technical support to the MBCC as an external aid.
110308.Performance 1: The subject enjoys pranks, often hacking into the Bureau's system or uploading her photos to everyone's desktops. Given that her actions haven't caused significant harm, only minimal surveillance is currently maintained.
110308.Performance 2: The subject is keen on socializing and likes to attend Sinners' video game parties. However, due to her advanced skills, the other Sinners complain that she cheats and banned her from further participation.
110308.Performance 3: Thanks to her exceptional hacking skills, she helps solve difficult problems for the tech department from time to time. However, as one employee mentioned, she always adjusts the UI to maximum brightness, blinding others.
110308.Performance 4: The subject proposed holding regular firework shows and invited Chief to join her in igniting her massive DIY fireworks. Given the danger of her customized fireworks, the Bureau declined her proposal. The invitation was modified to a viewing from a distance.

110309.Info: A Sinner adept at physical damage whose Ultimate can deal core damage. At the start of battle, for each allied Umbra Sinner present, Graves will convert 1 enemy core into an [Umbra Core] when enemies expose their cores, up to a maximum of 3 conversions.
110309.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110309.Name: Graves
110309.Criminal Record 1:
Wearing a tattered, soiled wedding dress, the subject wanders the abandoned Morveth Castle and is dubbed the *Ghost Bride*. Her presence is highly destabilizing and she demonstrates bizarre behavior, mental instability, as well as an extreme obsession with weddings and vows.
After Morveth Castle was abandoned, spirits gathered there, giving rise to a legend that making wishes here could reconnect one with the dead, attracting many gullible visitors. Immediate detention of the subject is recommended to prevent the legend from escalating and to curb further Mania contamination.
110309.Criminal Record 2: Investigation reveals that the subject is innocent and kind-hearted by nature, and has never used her special power to harm others. According to her own account, someone left a ring in the castle, which she picked up. Under the ring's influence, she made a wish and accidentally summoned Chief to the location.
110309.Ability Summary: The subject possesses highly dangerous neural control capabilities, able to hijack and distort the target's perceptions. Her special power can deprive sensory abilities and thus self-control of the target. Alternatively, it can also maximize sensations, transforming a light touch into excruciating pain, causing the target to collapse from fear and phantom pain.
110309.Awakening Signs: The subject was born a Sinner, contaminated with Mania from birth.
110309.Corruption State: The subject exhibits high-level Mania corruption, with severe physical mutations on her body and visible signs of Corruptor transformation. Additionally, her mental state is unstable. When subjected to certain stimuli, she experiences symptoms such as hallucinations and clouded consciousness.
110309.Arrest Records 1: During the Morveth Castle incident, the subject encountered Chief due to her obsession with weddings and companionship. After the event concluded, her wish was fulfilled and she voluntarily accepted detention and investigation by the MBCC.
110309.Arrest Records 2: The subject was born into a regular family in a small town on the outskirts of Syndicate. Contaminated with Mania from birth, she was abandoned by her fearful parents at a church in another town. After being taken in by Sister Elsie, the subject became part of the church community, but her life was never happy, as she remained feared by others and grew up in isolation.
110309.Arrest Records 3: As the only church in the town, all weddings and funerals were held there. Weddings became the only source of solace for the subject. She learned a lot about weddings and was gifted an old wedding dress that had lost its owner. However, as more and more residents left and the nun passed away, the church was eventually abandoned.
110309.Arrest Records 4: With nowhere else to go, the subject could only wander the dilapidated castle in her wedding dress, accompanied only by spirits. Day after day, the forgotten castle gradually became known as the rumored *posthumous wedding hall* and the subject became the legendary *Ghost Bride*.
110309.Performance 1: She knows everything, down to the most obscure trivia, when it comes to weddings. Familiar even with Outland marriage customs, she is certainly qualified as a wedding officiant, though unfortunately she has never had the opportunity to put this knowledge into practice.
110309.Performance 2: The subject's whereabouts are unpredictable. She likes wandering aimlessly in pitch-dark places, often scaring people unintentionally. However, contrary to the *Ghost Bride* legend surrounding her, she is surprisingly timid herself and has trouble sleeping every time she watches a horror film.
110309.Performance 3: Having only lived in the church before coming to the Bureau, the subject has many misconceptions about various aspects of life. Since her arrival, she seems at times awed or frightened by all modern electronic devices. For example, she's reluctant to use a communication device or be captured by the surveillance cameras, and she seems reverent toward microwave ovens.
110309.Performance 4: Romance-related holidays are particularly important to her. She often sends handwritten, wax-sealed letters inviting Chief to *go and make vows together at some wishing stone* or *put a love lock bearing both their names on some bridge*. Though Chief does not fully comprehend these rituals, the invitations are occasionally accepted when the schedule permits.

110401.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Summer automatically summons [Drones] while in combat. This effect has a <color=#63b4c3>20</color>-second cooldown. [Drones] prioritize enemies attacking Summer, and deal (Summer's Attack *<color=#63b4c3>20%</color>) <color=#c47d20>Physical Damage</color>each time. 4 [Drones] can exist on the battlefield at most. Lasts until the end of the battle.
110401.Mania Intensify Text: At the start of battle, Summer instantly summons 1 [Drone].
110401.Name: Summer
110401.Criminal Record 1:
Suspected to be a dangerous scientist spy with some anti-EDGE tendency. Once praised as an extremely rare genius, the subject was the Ring Research Institute's youngest member. The subject was exposed for owning the core technology of a classified forbidden weapon without permission. She refused the institute's collaboration request and betrayed the institute.
The subject's behaviors directly led to the leak of Ring Weapon technology into the market and facilitated the creation of Mania Weapons, greatly worsening the violence in Syndicate.
110401.Criminal Record 2:
It's now been proven that the Research Institute violated the regulations early on and sold Ring Weapon-related technology to Parma. The contamination-loaded Mania weapons available in the market are products of Parma's evil research.
It's confirmed that the subject has invented a contamination-free Ring Weapon. Her invention has improved the lives of many and she provides essential support behind various major missions of the Bureau.
110401.Ability Summary: The subject has lower-than-average physical health statistics but her intelligence far exceeds the mean, the upper limit of her IQ indeterminable by any currently available tests. Uses a personally developed drone-like Ring Weapon to aid fights.
110401.Awakening Signs: As reported by the Ring Research Institute, the subject carried out multiple unauthorized experiments during her tenure in the institute and purposely approached sources of contamination. It's believed that the accumulation of contaminants in her body reached a breaking point and triggered the awakening.
110401.Corruption State: Relies too much on the Ring Weapon to move around, leading to muscle degeneration and a weaker body. But the growth of her Mania level is significantly lower than that in normal people, so it's believed that the subject was born with higher compatibility with the Ring Substance.
110401.Arrest Records 1: Following an order from the top, the MBCC spent a long time tracking and observing the subject and finally arrested her when she attended her graduation ceremony while still injured. The subject had prepared close to ten escape plans but still ended up being captured by Chief personally.
110401.Arrest Records 2: Born in an Eastside family with a scientific and engineering background, the subject has demonstrated incredible intelligence and a gift for mechanical engineering since a young age. At fourteen, the subject had already mastered all doctoral courses and was exceptionally accepted into the Ring Research Institute by recommendation as a junior high school student, making headlines in Eastside.
110401.Arrest Records 3: As one of the youngest researchers in the Ring Research Institute, Summer picked Ring Weapon as her research topic and quickly achieved monumental breakthroughs in the field. The research was then suspended for some unknown reason, while the subject was transferred to *Project Genius* by the institute.
110401.Arrest Records 4: The institute passed the Ring Weapon to the Laboratory of Parma without Summer's agreement. She was enraged by this action and subsequently dug out the truth about the human experiments. After destroying the Parma lab, the subject escaped with the research result. She was charged with multiple crimes by the 9th Agency and included on the wanted list.
110401.Performance 1: Everything the subject owns has been highly customized by herself: a computer that follows her around, a hovering platform that carries her everywhere, the detention room that's been immediately modified into a lab... Even her utensils are equipped with an artificial intelligence speech recognition system.
110401.Performance 2: Overly obsessed with the idea of a *free and fun high school life*. The complex and unusual personnel in the MBCC have never been able to satisfy her fantasy. She once attempted to create forty android classmates to be her companions but was stopped by the staff.
110401.Performance 3: The subject has been specially allowed to visit her family. It's been observed that Summer is able to effectively hold back her uninhibited behavior a couple days before and after her parents' visits.
110401.Performance 4: Has been strictly demanded by Chief to swear off her Ring Weapon dependence and to train herself physically and walk with her feet. Summer has been following the training schedule very listlessly, keeping a record of four sit-ups in a minute. This is possibly the maximum compromise she's made in order to make Chief stay and watch anime with her.

110402.Info: A Sinner adept at Long-Distance Output. Can deal Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
110402.Name: Langley
110402.Criminal Record 1:
The current leader of the 9th Agency. The 9th Agency isn't big, but it is on the same administration level as FAC, and directly under Paradeisos. It is in charge of the DisCity's intelligence spies. The subject is known as a "cold-blooded Melanosuchus" and a "lapdog" due to the brutality, and has a bad reputation.
She was suspected of murdering the peace negotiator and disobeying orders, seriously endangering the safety of the city-state. She was sent to court but escaped from punishment for unknown reasons. Still a high-rank official who holds the DisCity's core political secrets to this day.
110402.Criminal Record 2: According to meticulously gathered information and the analysis of Chief's conversations with her, the subject is in fact extremely loyal to DisCity. Despite her radical means, she always puts the city's interests first and only defies her superiors' orders to protect DisCity from harm. The fact that the subject still holds her powerful position could have something to do with the Supervisory Committee.
110402.Ability Summary: Able to predict the required conditions needed to produce a specific result after firing the "Causality Gun" and able to manipulate the bullet to hit every target after completing all the conditions.
110402.Awakening Signs: Awakened during the BR-003 navigator observatory incident. Used special powers for the first time when insisting on assassinating an important individual. Case investigation not authorized.
110402.Corruption State: Awakened during the incubation period. No physical signs of mutation. Due to the subject's extremely strong mental power, the erosion and infection is weaker than average.
110402.Performance 1: The subject insisted on settling in DisCity. Pour-over coffee tasting is her only personal hobby and a way to relax after work. The quality is on par with that of professional baristas.
110402.Performance 2: Notorious for being cruel, but very kind to subordinates. Her confinement cell is often visited by agents from the 9th Agency, and it is said that there have been many cordial greetings from her subordinates. "Before you hide yourself here to loaf away, Commander, please process these documents..."
110402.Performance 3: Pays close attention to MBCC Sinners. Interrogate any suspected restless Sinners, which was highly praised by some Sinners instead of causing discontent.
110402.Performance 4: Langley dislikes alcohol and believes alcohol can cause problems. But she can drink a lot and studied dozens of ways to "look as if you haven't drunk." Always succeed in teasing Chief.

110403.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Enters the battle with Ultimate Energy fully charged.
110403.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110403.Name: Oak Casket
110403.Criminal Record 1:
Oak Casket is an underground information broker who uses Romanesque Hall as a front. She commits brutal murders, and sells classified information she has collected to violent gangs, which has brought about many large conflicts resulting in heavy casualties; she also disrupts the balance of power in Syndicate by using confidential information to stir up frictions between the various factions in the region.
Several cases of trafficking are also linked to Oak Casket. It's unclear where she obtained the trafficked products (later on, by her own admission, she obtained some of the products herself). This is a serious crime that has disastrous ramifications; she must be detained immediately.
110403.Criminal Record 2:
For a long time, the subject was active in Syndicate as *the only hall manager who could hold a funeral in Syndicate* and made a living with her ability to obtain information from Corruptor remains. But judging from her behavior after her arrest, she seems to have long tired of life around gangsters and looks forward to a change.
Currently, the subject's conduct in the Bureau is satisfactory. Although she still has an avid interest in death and remains, her obsession is overall still under control.
110403.Ability Summary: Oak Casket's power allows her to capture and decode the information that is carried in the electric field and magnetic field created by a newly-dead Maniac's brain and body. How much information she can attain is inversely proportional to how long the person has been dead.
110403.Awakening Signs: Oak Casket was infected with Mania and awakened her power in a mass grave somewhere in Syndicate when she was a teenager; she was badly injured, but miraculously survived. As a Sinner, she has the ability to heal her body to a certain degree without any external help, and to attain useful information from newly-dead Maniacs.
110403.Corruption State: The test results show that Oak Casket suffers from a moderate level of Maniac corruption. No abnormalities have been found on her body, but when her mind is exposed to certain types of stimulation, she will hallucinate and exhibit other symptoms.
110403.Arrest Records 1: The Chief meets Oak Casket in Syndicate during a rescue mission. The Chief first clashes with and then works with her, and at the end of the mission, she goes to the MBCC with the Chief of her own volition, and agrees to be detained.
110403.Arrest Records 2: Born during the most chaotic period in Syndicate, the subject was adopted by a kind soul at a rescue station and lived with several other children. This rescue station would later become the Romanesque Hall. During this time, because of her introverted personality, she was regarded as an oddity by those around her.
110403.Arrest Records 3: At around thirteen, the rescue station was besieged due to involvement in gang-related incidents, and the subject was seriously injured in the assault. Barely clinging to life, she was abandoned by her benefactor. From then on, she awakened as a Sinner.
110403.Arrest Records 4: Investigations reveal that after being abandoned, the subject became disillusioned with the chaotic situation in Syndicate, believing that there was no hope in the world. After resolving her obsessions with Chief, her perspective changed, and she held a funeral for her past self.
110403.Performance 1: In the early days of her detention, Oak Casket is passive and cold, with vital signs once being abnormally low. She is then diagnosed with *information input disruption syndrome*, which manifests itself as a passiveness arising from an inability to adjust to a normal environment after a long period of residing in an abnormal environment.
110403.Performance 2: After a period of adjustment, Oak Casket starts getting accustomed to her life in detention. She is still passive and cold, and is not performing as well as she should be in battles, but has a tremendous fighting spirit. The MBCC later decides to let Chief include her in as many battles as possible, so as to satisfy her need of extracting information from the newly dead.
110403.Performance 3: To further alleviate Oak Casket's passiveness, the MBCC agrees to move her to the room next to Dudu's, and replace the bed in the room with a long, black oak casket. She is doing well at the moment, on the road to recovery, and starts to get along with the other Sinners.
110403.Performance 4: Oak Casket's symptoms have been improving thanks to the comforting of Chief and Dudu, and she is returning to the physical status she was in back when she was in Syndicate. She is becoming more trusting of Chief, and more willingly to protect Chief in battles; she is not as obsessed as before with seeing those around her dead so that she can extract information from them.

110404.Info: A Sinner highly contaminated by the DisSea. Gains <color=#63b4c3>1</color> M-value whenever allied units deal [Life Loss] damage, up to <color=#63b4c3>5</color> M-value per second.  Enters [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>80</color>, gaining an <color=#63b4c3>8%</color> Attack increase while consuming <color=#63b4c3>5</color> M-Value per second. Leaves [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>0</color>.
110404.Mania Intensify Text: For each [Life Loss] state carried by the enemy, Dreya gains a <color=#63b4c3>6%</color> Damage increase against them.
110404.Name: Dreya
110404.Criminal Record 1:
The subject was once a "Black Ring Expedition" member, venturing deep into DisSea with other scientists to conduct close-range research on the Perishing Star.

Before going to DisSea, the subject was engaged in the first phase of her postdoctoral work at a research institute, focusing on astrophysics research.
110404.Ability Summary: Her power can overcome gravity and other force fields up to a limit, manipulate objects of certain mass to attack, and make nearby physical fragments land in a certain location like meteors.
110404.Awakening Signs: The subject appeared alongside overflowing contamination when the Illusory Moon turned full and the DisSea Black Ring was most active. Before she was detained, she was in a transitional state between Sinner and Corruptor.
110404.Corruption State: In a state of total corruption. Her entire body is covered in contamination, and almost completely devoid of humanity and rationality. Extremely dangerous.
110404.Arrest Records 1: After the subject was detained near DisSea under the Illusory Moon, she was placed in confinement for observation and treatment. Since it was impossible to communicate with her using normal means, the MBCC was instructed that Chief would personally reach out to her via dreams.
110404.Arrest Records 2: The subject was a member of the renowned Black Ring Expeditionary Force. She had voluntarily joined the expedition while working at the research institute, and kept it a secret from her family. While approaching the Perishing Star, the subject and other expedition members discovered data anomalies, and became mentally corroded like all those who ventured into the DisSea Black Ring.
110404.Arrest Records 3: The subject had lost much of her human characteristics by the [unknown - nd/rd/th] day of the expedition. Probably due to severe mental corrosion, she exhibited hallucinatory and rambling behavior. However, with the help of her companions, and her own will to survive, the subject seemed to have retained a certain level of human consciousness, enabling those who came later to awaken her.
110404.Arrest Records 4: Ever since witnessing the fall of the Perishing Star and experiencing the Apocalypse as a child, the subject has had a strong passion for both the truth and the unknown. This yearning is on full display in her subconscious, increasing the chance of the MBCC Chief stabilizing her condition.
110404.Performance 1: Dreya, female, around 173cm tall post-contamination. Her body is covered with contamination from DisSea, but one can still somewhat make out her previous clothing. She dons a face mask formed by Mania, which is used to control human thinking. She is currently bound in a cell by the MBCC Chief's shackles.
110404.Performance 2: After completing the Mirage dive, the subject has been put back in her cell for further observation. According to observation records, the subject does not show any movements except for breathing motions. Only when Chief appears does she engage in certain actions and dialogue.
110404.Performance 3: Because she had a strong interest in astronomy and the Perishing Star before getting completely corrupted by contamination, the subject is infatuated with the night sky. She tries her best to ask Chief to take her to observe celestial bodies and acquire astronomical knowledge.
110404.Performance 4: Based on information obtained by the Mirage dive, the subject had been a researcher at a certain research institute before getting completely corrupted by contamination. During the Black Ring Expedition, she insisted on carrying with her six cans of mixed fruit.

110405.Info: A Sinner adept at attacking with Schorl. Gains a <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> increase in damage dealt, and an extra <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> increase against enemies with broken cores.
110405.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110405.Name: Shalom
110405.Ability Summary: Her Sinner power is unknown, and there are no known records of her using any. The subject lacks independent combat abilities and relies on Schorl, a product of Paradeisos technology, for communication, combat, and information analysis.
110405.Corruption State: M-value measurement has failed. The numbers are all jumbled, making it impossible to determine an accurate result. Special instructions have been received: No need to apply shackles.
110405.Arrest Records 1: The subject, identifying as a Paradeisos official, suddenly visited the MBCC for a short-term inspection visit.
110405.Arrest Records 2: Currently visiting the MBCC as a Paradeisos representative, the subject claims to frequently meet and share a personal relationship with the current Chief in the past. However, no records related to their meetings can be found in the Bureau's database, and the authenticity of this information is yet to be verified.
110405.Arrest Records 3: The subject can use light tendrils to draw targets into an unknown space and interfere with their minds. She did this to Chief, but the specifics of that incident are unknown. Chief does not currently show any abnormal symptoms.
110405.Arrest Records 4:
Following the Rustfire unrest, she secretly went to West District on behalf of Paradeisos to retrieve the missing Shepherd. After being attacked by mysterious forces, she was forced to abandon her mission, marking the only failure in her career.
In August, she made notable contributions to the FAC's large-scale operation at BR-002, but was subsequently targeted for assassination by an Underground hitman. Suffering severe bodily injuries and mental corruption, she fell into a deep coma.
110405.Performance 1: As a Paradeisos envoy sent for inspection, she is kind and knowledgeable, and the Bureau staff frequently seeks advice from her. Other than Adjutant Nightingale, most developed a considerable liking and trust for her.
110405.Performance 2: She brought along an array of records, frequently playing music in her room and never turning down an invite to a live performance. Observations show that she doesn't have any specific genre preference. Her playlist even includes a mix of rock and rap.
110405.Performance 3: She is exceptional at capturing human emotions and boasts sophisticated photography skills. The subject has amassed a huge collection of photo albums at home, all filled with portraits she had taken herself. Yet according to unconfirmed rumors, many of these are of those who have passed away.
110405.Performance 4: She has unique taste and insight in the field of flower arranging, but struggles to keep real flowers alive. All the flowers in her room at the Bureau are artificial. She once gave Chief a floral crystal handicraft that bore a remarkable resemblance to her necklace, calling it a "gift to celebrate our reunion."

110406.Info: A Sinner adept at dealing Physical Damage. Fires multiple bullets with each normal attack, prioritizing different enemies. After the first bullet hits, subsequent bullets hitting the same target deal <color=#63b4c3>15%</color> of the original damage.
110406.Name: Lady Pearl
110406.Criminal Record 1:
The manager of the mysterious Fortuna theater and a high-end entertainment business owner. The subject rarely appears on stage, but has been a benefactor to many actors in Eastside.
Investigations reveal that the subject often uses her special power to manipulate performances in the theater. Every year, numerous spectators are affected by Mania, overwhelmed by the performance and disappearing after it ends.
110406.Criminal Record 2: During her monitoring period, the subject did not partake in any creative activities related to theater and maintained good relations with the Sinners and staff in the Bureau, with no suspicious activities. The subject occasionally appeared overly interested in Chief's activities, but showed no further disruptive tendency. Her threat level is deemed controllable, and she is allowed to go out on conditions.
110406.Ability Summary:
The subject's special power lures the target through choices into a specific, tangible illusion, allowing the target to fulfill their inner desires by *playing* a role.
According to experiment evaluations, the illusion can generally last for two to three hours, during which it constantly erodes the target's mental state until they surrender completely to the illusion.
110406.Awakening Signs: The subject's exact time of awakening is not verifiable. As her power is closely tied to theater performances, it is speculated that her awakening probably occurred at the initial stage of Fortuna's operation.
110406.Corruption State: No obvious signs of corruption are visible on her body, and her mental state is relatively stable. She only experiences illusions that can even affect her surroundings and others when she overuses her special power.
110406.Arrest Records 1: The Fortuna theater the subject operates attracts audience with its annual immersive performance, causing them to lose themselves in the illusion and leading to multiple missing person cases. After negotiating with the MBCC's Chief, the subject agreed to be detained by the Bureau.
110406.Arrest Records 2: Investigations reveal that the subject comes from a wealthy family in Eastside, had a good financial education, and was once rather well-known in certain social circles. One day, the subject suddenly severed ties with her family, came to the gutters of Eastside with a fake identity, then took over the Fortuna theater which would later win its fame.
110406.Arrest Records 3: Fortuna used to be a little-known troupe in Eastside surviving mainly on the subject's investments. Its core members repeatedly demanded money from her under the pretext of gathering operational funds, eventually putting up the entire troupe as collateral to her. These members disappeared one by one after leaving the troupe, and their current whereabouts are unknown.
110406.Arrest Records 4: The subject has reached a secret agreement with the MBCC's Chief and transferred the management rights of the theater. Some members of the troupe chose to stay and continue operating Fortuna, regularly sending complimentary tickets to the subject.
110406.Performance 1: The subject often encourages younger Sinners to act for her. Once, the staff arrived and found a game of house with puppets as actors. The incident caused no adverse consequences.
110406.Performance 2: The subject is versed in finance, and years of theater operation have made her an excellent equity trader. She occasionally shares stock-holding insights with the staff of the Supply Office and generates profits with leverage. The subject once suggested that the Supply Office should get publicly listed and that she could run the company, but Chief promptly turned her down.
110406.Performance 3: The subject knows the locations and programs of all the theater troupes in Eastside well and is good at scouting niche shows performed in street-side tents. She has invited Chief to go to these shows with her several times, but these plans have been temporarily put on hold due to time and security concerns.
110406.Performance 4: The subject once suggested that Chief take the lead role in the musical at the annual gala, but the offer was sternly rejected. After thorough negotiation, it was eventually changed to an invitation to the first dance at the annual gala.

110407.Info: A Sinner adept at dealing Physical Damage. Deals 5% more Damage, and another 5% more for enemies with broken Cores.
110407.Mania Intensify Text: Deal <color=#63b4c3>20%</color> more damage to enemies that have been marked with [Weakspot].
110407.Name: Bianca
110407.Criminal Record 1:
A former employee at DisTV News, the subject has covered multiple significant cases in Eastside at her job.
She is suspected of being involved in the Gray Mirror vote case, which has already caused several disappearances in Eastside and severely undermined social stability. Immediate detention is required.
110407.Criminal Record 2: Investigation shows that while working at the TV station, the subject dedicated herself to uncovering hidden crimes, exposing the truth, and seeking justice for victims. Moreover, she has demonstrated good behavior in the MBCC and promised not to expose others using extreme methods again. Currently, the subject is considered low-risk. After evaluation, the Bureau has decided to lower her surveillance level.
110407.Ability Summary: The special power uses a camera as a medium, pinpointing illegal acts within the frame and emitting laser-like beams to disrupt the enemy's actions. The attack's effectiveness fluctuates with her subjective perception, possibly depending on how wrong the subject deems the action.
110407.Awakening Signs: According to the assessment report, the subject might have been infected with Mania while investigating the Gray Mirror case and ultimately awakened as a Sinner due to the intense emotional impact during the fall.
110407.Corruption State: Having only been in contact with Mania for a short time, the subject shows no conspicuous signs of corruption. Her general excitement is likely just part of her natural character and requires no intervention.
110407.Arrest Records 1: The subject has investigated the Gray Mirror incident alongside Chief and disappeared after the fall. Despite the numerous eyewitness reports the MBCC has received, her agility has so far allowed her to evade capture by the Bureau.
110407.Arrest Records 2: Growing up in Eastside, the subject displayed an obsession over *righteousness* from a young age. Upon coming of age, she studied at the Eastside Media College and began to shine in journalism societies.
110407.Arrest Records 3: The subject joined DisTV News in N.F. 112. While working there, she investigated 103 cases and successfully covered 42 stories. Following the exposure of the Gray Mirror incident, she was dismissed by the TV station and her journalist license was suspended.
110407.Arrest Records 4: The subject once covered a cyberbullying case in which the victim, overwhelmed by public scrutiny after their personal information was exposed across various forums, chose to end their life. Consequently, she came into contact with the Gray Mirror server. Half a month later, the first Gray Mirror-related disappearance occurred in Eastside.
110407.Performance 1: The subject used to store cans of apple-flavored beverages in the communal fridge of the living area, after drinking which she would demonstrate uncontrollable aberrant behaviors. Although she insisted it was just apple juice, the staff and Sinners collectively decided to ban the beverage.
110407.Performance 2: Despite her dismissal, the subject still identifies as a journalist, frequently requesting permission to investigate various news events and expose them online. Possibly due to the sensitive nature of her area of interest, her online accounts frequently get banned, but that never dampens her passion.
110407.Performance 3: The subject often hums nursery rhymes and children's songs, adapting the lyrics flexibly to fit the situation. An MBCC staff member has privately complained about her poor singing skills and requested music lessons for her. The request has been denied.
110407.Performance 4: After obtaining permission to interview Chief, the subject locked herself in her room for three whole days, eventually producing an eighty-page interview outline, which included questions probing Chief's likes. At Chief's request, the outline was reduced to ten pages. The subject was advised to come directly to Chief's office for any additional questions.

110408.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110408.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110408.Name: Korryn
110408.Criminal Record 1:
An elusive bounty hunter in pursuit of high commissions, running at large around the WhiteSands trade route. The subject lingers across various factions and rarely initiates any moves, employing secretive methods to complete her jobs.
Investigation reveals her involvement in multiple recent incidents related to the trade route. The subject poses a severe threat to WhiteSands' Hypercube transportation and requires immediate detention.
110408.Criminal Record 2: Investigation reveals that the subject and Tuco residents' previous actions were driven by survival instinct. Following their cooperation with the MBCC, Tuco residents can now obtain reasonably priced supplies through the Bureau and will no longer disrupt the trade route's security.
110408.Ability Summary: Able to infuse weapons with Mania to deal massive damage. Due to her style of acting, her special power produces greater effect on firearms.
110408.Awakening Signs: According to the subject's testimony, she was caught in the Tide of Ashes during a mission. To survive, the subject chose to deliberately expose herself to Mania, awakening as a Sinner.
110408.Corruption State: The subject's corruption level is moderate. She exhibits heightened mental agitation when using her special power, with visible Mania patterns on her body. Nevertheless, the subject remains sane and her ability is still within control.
110408.Arrest Records 1: Having entered DisCity covertly from WhiteSands, the subject deliberately revealed herself near the MBCC, proposing a deal to Chief as a bounty hunter.
110408.Arrest Records 2: The subject's exact birthplace is unknown. She was adopted by Tuco's townspeople as a child and raised on Tuco's nomadic ship. Later, the subject became a bounty hunter, working with accomplices on bounty contracts to obtain survival supplies.
110408.Arrest Records 3: To survive, Tuco's townspeople must regularly relocate their base to avoid sandstorms and pursuers. During one such evacuation, the subject was caught in the Tide of Ashes while aiding her companions' retreat. 32 hours later, she was found severely wounded in the desert three kilometers away, heavily corrupted by Mania and awakened as a Sinner.
110408.Arrest Records 4: Investigation reveals that following the West District BR-002 incident, anomalies in WhiteSands intensified and disasters became frequent. Aware of these changes, to protect her Tuco companions, the subject chose to journey alone to DisCity to seek out a way to ensure Tuco's survival.
110408.Performance 1: The subject keeps a pet lizard named Sheriff, with whom she likes to have a back-and-forth dialogue, sometimes to make fun of others. Currently, the show of the subject's amusing chat with her pet is welcomed within the Bureau.
110408.Performance 2: The subject always requests nearly decommissioned vehicles for field missions, claiming that "nice cars make her nauseous." In reality, the subject enjoys outmaneuvering enemies driving an old car with her exceptional driving skills.
110408.Performance 3: The subject likes to conceal spoils everywhere on her person, including but not limited to the brim of her hat, shoe heels, and clothing layers. Once, coins were even found on Sheriff the lizard. After her cooperation with the MBCC was confirmed, she appears to have brought this treasure-hiding habit to the Bureau.
110408.Performance 4: She has repeatedly made up excuses to barge into Chief's office during work hours to invite Chief for a joyride. Chief later turned her down as it might disturb work and reminded her such requests should be made on Chief's days off.

110409.Info:
A Sinner adept at fighting with Aurum Secretum technology. Hypatia summons a [Gilded Machina] on grids accessible to allies around her at the start of the battle. This counts as an [Aurum Secretum Tech] type summoned creature.
[Gilded Machina] inherits 80% of Hypatia's Max HP, 120% of her Attack, and 100% of her Defense and Magic Resistance. It can block one enemy.
[Gilded Machina]'s normal attack range and damage coefficient are the same as [Alchemic Smelt].
110409.Mania Intensify Text: Hypatia and [Gilded Machina]'s normal attack range extends forward by two columns.
110409.Name: Hypatia
110409.Criminal Record 1:
A legitimate Campbell offspring and the youngest researcher in the history of the Fraser Institute, the subject has made significant contributions to the advancement of Aurum Secretum technology. She typically devotes herself to academic pursuits and rarely appears in public. This exchange marks her first official visit to DisCity.
According to the 9th Agency's investigation, the subject is deeply involved in a highly classified project at the Institute. This project receives covert backing from the Campbell family. Specific details remain unknown and require further investigation.
110409.Criminal Record 2: The subject demonstrates strong self-control, maintains a positive attitude, and actively cooperates with the Bureau's investigation while providing support for special operations. Researchers at the Institute have also highly commended her exceptional academic abilities. Upon confirmation, it has been determined that the subject does not require mandatory detention, but only needs to report periodically to the Bureau for routine Sinner examinations.
110409.Ability Summary: She can manipulate matter upon physical contact, transforming its properties and restructuring its composition. Special metals processed by the subject can resonate with Mania substances, exponentially amplifying their power.
110409.Awakening Signs: She was already proficient in using her abilities when visiting DisCity. It is speculated that her powers had awakened during her time in Fraser, though the specific cause remains unknown.
110409.Corruption State: She displays a mild degree of Mania corruption with no visible symptoms on her body. She remains lucid, though she still experiences occasional mental fatigue and insomnia after using her abilities.
110409.Arrest Records 1: She represents the Fraser Institute on diplomatic missions to DisCity, exchanging Mania-related technology with the Ring Research Institute. While she enjoys various privileges as an Outland envoy, her status as a Sinner requires her to be registered with the MBCC and regularly examined.
110409.Performance 1: Coming from the prominent Campbell family of Fraser and always busy with her official duties, even when she works at the Institute, she usually has her daily life taken care of by personal attendants. Despite that, during her temporary stays at the MBCC, she has declined such services offered by the Bureau and insists on maintaining her own quarters.
110409.Performance 2: She prefers a quiet lifestyle and rarely displays any emotion in daily interactions, but will occasionally showcase her deadpan humor in private. She's apparently noted down numerous joke ideas in her personal notebook, but they are indeed not that good and the other Sinners usually just excuse themselves quietly after hearing them.
110409.Performance 3: She enjoys collecting travelogues from various regions and shows great curiosity about the experiences of other Sinners at the Bureau, even asking about their travels and adventures in their hometowns. Meanwhile, she appears to be compiling a travel bucket list, though her numerous responsibilities consistently force her to postpone these travel plans.
110409.Performance 4: She previously sought to observe and analyze the capabilities of the shackles. After this request was denied, she's begun having scheduled academic discussions with Chief instead. However, their conversations have gradually extended beyond designated times, with the subject now frequently visiting Chief's office in the afternoons to share her homemade Campbell herbal tea.

110501.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can alter effects depending on the target when casting an Ultimate.
110501.Name: Eirene
110501.Criminal Record 1:
Owned under the subject's name, Quinn has engaged in illegal business operations and hostile takeovers in multiple sectors in the DisCity as well as attempted to break into the Hypercube industry, undermining the foundation of the DisCity's economy. Investigation by the 9th Agency also suggests that Quinn has deep-rooted relations with foreign power, the Campbell family.
Considering that Quinn's president Eirene has a record of colluding with desert bandits, her intentional concealment of her Sinner identity may suggest a more ambitious intention. Special supervision is therefore required as her true purpose is being further investigated.
110501.Criminal Record 2: Due to the subject's powerful espionage and strategizing abilities, most of the previous allegations against her are in fact untrue. For example, the subject's detention by the MBCC is in fact also part of her plan. Although the new intelligence still contains many discrepancies, the subject has never displayed hostility or unauthorized behaviors during her detention. Chief is currently in charge of managing her.
110501.Ability Summary: Able to control and trigger mutation within a specific area and causes area-specific explosive energy fluctuations, possessing mass destruction power.
110501.Awakening Signs: The subject claims to have encountered desert bandits in WhiteSands at sixteen and awakened for justified self-defense purposes as her life was threatened. Considering the high number of victims, whether the act of self-defense was *justified* or not is still to be determined.
110501.Corruption State: The corruption level is low with no physical changes detected. The subject has a clear mind and a healthy mental state. Other than an exceptionally strong desire to conquer, no other abnormalities have been observed.
110501.Arrest Records 1: Voluntarily revealed the dangerous power she holds to the public on an open occasion. Suspected to have turned herself in intentionally for personal reasons. Investigation shows that the subject is not harmful to the MBCC at present, and detainment has been offered.
110501.Arrest Records 2: The illegitimate daughter of Bryce Campbell, the head of the Campbell family, and his mistress. The subject lived with her biological mother during childhood. Influenced by her mother's profession as a chess teacher, the subject is particularly good at playing chess. After Bryce recognized her identity and brought her home, the subject rarely contacted her mother again.
110501.Arrest Records 3: Having assisted the head of the family for years, the subject left the family for unknown reasons, moved to the DisCity, established Quinn, and continued to expand its power. Six years after her relocation, Quinn has become the largest private company in DisCity. Its influences and financial powers in DisCity are starting to surpass Campbell's.
110501.Arrest Records 4: The interrogation revealed that the assassination attempt the subject encountered were from her father's orders. This worsened the father-and-daughter relationship. The subject cultivated her power by herself in the DisCity for several years and launched a counter-attack to her father, controlling Bryce with special means, operating Quinn's acquisitions of Campbell, and secretly rearranging the power within the family.
110501.Performance 1: Despite having many tasks to tend to, the subject rarely requests to leave the facility, spending most of her time in the detention room playing chess with herself. It's said that the subject already planned out all of her current work in the last quarter so that she can handle everything without having to be physically present.
110501.Performance 2: The subject has extremely high standards for her quality of life. All of her everyday products must be manufactured by Quinn's high-end product lines. In-house designers from the fashion brands under Quinn also visit monthly to tailor luxurious gowns for her.
110501.Performance 3: Quite a few Sinners have been employed by enterprises owned or funded by Quinn, so they're inevitably nervous when going on missions with the former director. But Eirene only vaguely remembers a selected few of these former subordinates and refers to the rest as *insignificant pawns*.
110501.Performance 4: Though the subject has never lost in chess with Chief, she still always enjoys a good game with Chief and will occasionally even give way or offer guidance so long as the endgame is not affected. "Witnessing the growth of your own possession is an interesting thing, too."

110503.Info: A Sinner adept at wielding Magic Tools for Magic Output. Can increase Summoned Creature Damage by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color>.
110503.Mania Intensify Text: Ultimate can be used on an existing [Victory Star], dealing damage from [Realm of Truth] twice within range. New [Victory Star] will not be summoned at this time.
110503.Name: Stargazer
110503.Criminal Record 1:
Hard to predict whereabouts. Mainly hangs around the WhiteSands. Known as the "Dangerous Stargazer" due to mixing with desert bandits and stirring up violence.
Hid the identity as a Sinner during the MBCC's bandit investigation, and maliciously hindered the investigation and intensified conflicts using her powers, seriously staking the relationship between DisCity and the nearby city-states.
110503.Criminal Record 2:
The file states that the subject's awakened power enables her to read others' thoughts. Conflicts mostly arise when she bluntly expresses her crude opinions, though she never speaks maliciously on purpose.
Since her detention, the subject seems to have taken a special interest in Chief. She is mostly compliant with orders and no longer stirs up trouble.
110503.Ability Summary: The psychic ability uses void-related mental pollutants as a medium to connect to the void and attack with the power of the void.
110503.Awakening Signs: Stargazer claimed to have a mental breakdown when searching for her "kind" and fell into the WhiteSands. Having been accepted and saved by the Void that recognized her spirit, she crossed the Door of Void, saw the Realm of Truth, and thus awakened.
110503.Corruption State: Has moderate erosion and occasional hallucinations. The subject's unpredictable behaviors are influenced by Mania to some extent.
110503.Arrest Records 1: Recognizes that Chief was extremely likely to be her "kind" she had been searching for years. After the WhiteSands Ruins incident was resolved, the subject left vague, ambiguous messages, and escaped amidst the chaos. Detainment unsuccessful.
110503.Arrest Records 2: Real name is "Anarkia." Unknown parents and origin. Many different versions of the subject's childhood circulate in WhiteSands, but all are proved to be rumors.
110503.Arrest Records 3: Wanders around and makes a living by fortune-telling. Never settled in a place before arriving at the oasis and let the crystal ball and the tarot determine where to go.
110503.Arrest Records 4: Arrived at the oasis under the guidance of fate to look for her "kind." Under the inspiration summoning, the subject opened the ruins to seek the real and pure world by manipulating the desert bandits and beasts.
110503.Performance 1: Stargazer sealed all the corners in the house that could let in light and used candles instead of incandescent lights. All items were placed in an odd formation. She claimed that the mysterious and dark environment could draw her closer to "purity."
110503.Performance 2: Able to take out the crystal ball and tarot cards regardless of what style of clothing the subject wears. Crystal ball and tarot divination are necessary for any decision.
110503.Performance 3: The divination results are very convincing, despite most being undesirable results. The "guidance of fate" is listened eagerly by many Sinners and even some staff members.
110503.Performance 4: Teased and abetted Chief multiple times to run away together to the real world, which was all rejected and appeased by Chief.

110504.Info: Etti's normal attack has a 10% probability of forming a [Celestial Body] to attack the enemies.
110504.Mania Intensify Text: The probability of triggering Etti's initial attribute is increased by <color=#63b4c3>5%</color>.
110504.Name: Etti
110504.Case: Eastside Board Game Shop Missing Person Case
110504.Criminal Record 1:
The subject was the owner of a mysterious board game shop in Eastside well-known among local board game lovers. The shop did brisk business, but was related to multiple missing customer cases.
When she was confronted by Chief during the board game incident, the subject revealed the disastrous potential of her ability. It confirmed the suspicion of her confinement of multiple customers and immediate detention was thus required.
110504.Criminal Record 2:
Currently, under the MBCC's strict supervision, the subject consciously controls her power when organizing board game activities so as to ensure others' safety.
As she spends more time with other Sinners and Chief, the subject has become less obsessed with rules and control and her excessive urge to escape reality has been curbed. She's become more trusting and approving toward real life, herself, and the people around her.
110504.Ability Summary: With her ability, she can reshape the atomic structure of any substance to turn it into an object she wants. The effective time of her ability is controlled by her own will and mental power. The subject's attacks are usually the product of her imagination.
110504.Awakening Signs: Investigation reveals that the subject was directly exposed to BR-004's contaminants and was subsequently subject to long-term malicious mental influence by others. The two events awakened her ability.
110504.Corruption State: She suffers from a moderate level of corruption. Her body shows no apparent signs of mutation, but her mental state is unstable. Mood swings are particularly common when she organizes board games.
110504.Arrest Records 1: During the board game incident, Chief won Etti's game and successfully tore down her illusory realm. After the events, the subject was taken back to the MBCC by Chief where she was put under investigation and detention.
110504.Arrest Records 2: The subject's birth was an accident and her parents had no intention to raise her. She was left at her grandfather's door at birth. Growing up, she and her grandfather took care of each other. She had almost never met her irresponsible parents.
110504.Arrest Records 3: The lack of parental care and other external factors had made the subject extremely unsociable and lonely, so she began to immerse herself books and games. To guide her out of her trauma, her grandfather studied her hobby and turned their home into various game scenes with decorations to cheer her up.
110504.Arrest Records 4: The subject has a very deep bond with her grandfather. She treasures and is very protective of their old house and her memories about him. This is why she turned her home into the *game space* after awakening as a Sinner. Before he passed away, her grandfather left her an unfinished rulebook which carries his hope that his granddaughter could move on from darkness and sadness.
110504.Performance 1: Outgoing and witty, the subject has quickly gotten along with everyone in the Bureau and adjusts well to life under detention. But her extremely whimsical and active mind also makes it hard for many to match her tempo during conversations.
110504.Performance 2: Ever since the subject came, the Sinners in the Bureau have gained a new form of entertainment, TRPG game. The games held by Etti are so dramatic and thrilling that they have become hugely popular in the MBCC. To join the game, reservations usually have to be made a month earlier.
110504.Performance 3: Not only is the subject a master in board games, but she's also an expert in various video games. Because she broke the records of many games on the communal game console in the Recreation Area a week after she arrived, Sinner EMP sees her as her *archenemy*.
110504.Performance 4: The subject wants to design a brand new board game set in the MBCC, but her frequent unauthorized research visits to different sections of the Bureau have greatly troubled Chief and staff of various departments.

110505.Info: A Sinner adept at dealing Magic Damage. Enemies within Raven's Normal Attack range loses [Invisible].
110505.Name: Raven
110505.Criminal Record 1:
A writer who used to work part-time for Yagyu, managing their lackluster social media account. The subject also infiltrated the Executive Committee as an undercover agent and participated in the Rustfire unrest.

According to a lengthy investigation, the subject was found to have been responsible for spreading false information both online and in tabloids. She wantonly distorted facts, made inflammatory remarks, and fed her readers large amounts of disinformation. The subject seriously disrupted social order and must be arrested immediately.
110505.Criminal Record 2:
The subject's provocative behavior is actually aimed at Syndicate's evildoers, and her ultimate goal is to incite people to wipe them out.

After coming to the MBCC, the subject developed a strong interest in Chief, and has shifted her focus from writing fake news to composing literary works for Chief. Moreover, anything she wants to publish has to now undergo the Bureau's strict review, making it difficult for her to incite others.
110505.Ability Summary: The subject can use her power to "infect" ink with Mania and thus control and manipulate it. The effects and duration of her power depend on the level of her mental strength.
110505.Awakening Signs: The subject had once been imprisoned in a dungeon, where she recorded many of the cruelties and injustices there. She hoped to publicize them after she escaped, but after getting caught by the guards, the dual stimulation of intense danger and her own rebellious spirit awakened her as Sinner.
110505.Corruption State: The subject's corruption level is low, with no obvious signs of crystallization on her body. Her mental state is sound most of the time, and has only occasional abnormalities after writing for too long.
110505.Arrest Records 1: The subject planned to build a school in Syndicate, but the project was met with practical obstacles. Claiming that she found a batch of Mania waste that needed to be handled, the subject asked the MBCC for assistance. Although the incident did not cause any casualties or financial losses, the subject was still detained by the Chief of the MBCC.
110505.Arrest Records 2: Since the MBCC took over the Syndicate Academy construction project, the subject has been working hard to recruit students and compile the curriculum. However, she is dissatisfied with the history of Syndicate recounted by Eastside and wishes to rewrite it.
110505.Arrest Records 3: The subject fought alongside Rustfire in N.F. 103 and returned to Eastside in the same year to publicize Rustfire's achievements. However, because her reports could prove detrimental to Nirvana's interests, the subject was captured by the group's secret department *DRD* and later suffered abhorrent retaliation.
110505.Arrest Records 4: The subject is currently an instructor at Syndicate Academy who mainly teaches the Disian language and poetry. According to her, the teaching staff now comprises 15 people, and the number of students has also reached 136. If all goes well, the school will continue expanding in scale.
110505.Performance 1: The subject has an eccentric personality, behaves in an erratic and unconventional manner, always makes exaggerated physical movements and expressions of emotion. She particularly cares about children, however, which made some introverted younger Sinners feel like she may be mentally ill for the first several months in the Bureau.
110505.Performance 2: Even during her stay at MBCC, the subject kept a close eye on the news and information in Syndicate, especially on the latest developments and conflicts related to "the Homeless".
110505.Performance 3: The subject filed an application to organize the younger Sinners in the Bureau to study the appreciation of poetry from her. However, the application was rejected on the grounds that the Bureau considered it more appropriate to develop Sinners' literacy as the starting point.
110505.Performance 4: The subject is not a very good poet, but she is especially fond of composing lame poems for Chief. Since arriving at the MBCC, the subject has written an entire notebook of hymns, and she is looking for the right moment to recite them all to Chief in front of all Sinners and staffs in one sitting.

110506.Info: A Sinner adept at dealing Magic Damage. When an enemy on the field is in [Fear] state, she recovers 1 energy herself. The effect has a 1-second cooldown.
110506.Mania Intensify Text: Damage dealt by summoned creatures increases by <color=#63b4c3>15%</color>.
110506.Name: Eleven
110506.Criminal Record 1:
Once a well-known radio host, she ran a program named Call at 3 AM, which was one of the most popular shows in Eastside.
Later, this show and its audience got involved in dozens of disappearance cases and triggered a severe Mania overflow incident, affecting listeners' minds on a large scale and even endangering lives. As a result, it was determined that she needed to be detained immediately.
110506.Criminal Record 2: After a personal investigation by the Chief, it was determined that the Mania overflow incident happened because she was affected by Mania while under immense mental pressure from others. She had no real intention of harming others and is actively undergoing mental treatment.
110506.Ability Summary: Her special power is generated by her mind, amplified and spread through modern sensors like mobile phones, affecting the minds of the recipients. The impact can range from dizziness and tinnitus to cognitive disorders. In severe cases, it can cause the recipient's internal organs to vibrate and shatter.
110506.Awakening Signs: According to the news, she awakened as a Sinner after a severe mental breakdown due to immense mental pressure. Therefore, her mind is not stable and needs further treatment and analysis.
110506.Corruption State: No obvious signs of corruption are visible on her body, but her mental state is worrisome. Her body clock is extremely disordered, further exacerbating her poor mental state.
110506.Arrest Records 1: After resolving the massive impact caused by the Mania overflow, she disappeared. However, investigations found that she might have resolved the root cause of the overflow incident. In the end, she voluntarily went to the Bureau and asked the Chief for detention.
110506.Arrest Records 2: The remnants of her Mania ability have once again generated a space distorted by the Mania power. After an interrogation with her, it is known that she has repeatedly investigated this Mania power and attempted to destroy it, but to no significant effect.
110506.Arrest Records 3: She and the Chief investigated the twisted space and found the truth about the original Call at 3 AM urban legend and her connection to it. With the efforts of her and the Chief, the urban legend was resolved, and the twisted space returned to normal.
110506.Arrest Records 4: At her request, the Eastside TV station's program Call at 3 AM will be permanently canceled, and Eleven will be removed from the TV station. However, the TV station allowed her to record a final farewell program. The farewell program was a departure from her usual style, with witty and aggressive commentary. As a result, it once again became a top search keyword and spawned a completely different late-night radio program specifically for the new her.
110506.Performance 1: As a former late-night radio host, she initially had trouble adjusting to the Bureau's schedule, often staying awake at night. Given the nature of her unique voice, strange tales regarding "voices" soon started spreading around the Bureau.
110506.Performance 2: She keeps a collection of peculiar items in her room, such as candy wrappers, Martian sand, and "slimes." Investigations revealed that these were all tools for her ASMR recording sessions.
110506.Performance 3: Most people in the Bureau enjoy engaging in heart-to-heart conversations with her. She even knows Hella's bank account balance and where Bai Yi's secret stash of alcohol is. Many also confide their negative feelings to her, and she rarely disappoints them. Through witty and incisive conversations, she helps them vent their frustrations.
110506.Performance 4: She has an inexplicable obsession with Chief's working hours. If Chief works beyond the usual time, she will provide gentle reminders. However, most of the time, her reminders are of little use, and Chief often receives a call from her at 3 AM.

110507.Info: A Sinner highly contaminated by the DisSea. Gains <color=#63b4c3>3</color> M-Value whenever an allied Sinner applies a [Burn] mark, up to <color=#63b4c3>9</color> M-Value per second. Enters [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>60</color>, gaining an <color=#63b4c3>8%</color> Attack increase while consuming <color=#63b4c3>5</color> M-Value per second. Leaves [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>0</color>.
110507.Name: Hestia
110507.Criminal Record 1:
The subject was once a member of the Black Ring Expedition. The expedition found her and took her in after entering DisSea.
Although her vision is heavily impaired, the subject seems to have the ability to sense Mania disasters and other dangers. With this gift, she once served as the Pyromater Sect's Priestess in Stor Town outside DisSea.
110507.Criminal Record 2: Currently detained by the MBCC. No significant abnormalities or harmful incidents have been observed to date. The subject remains within the control of the MBCC.
110507.Ability Summary: The subject carries a long metal torch. The flame at the end of the torch burns constantly and can provide basic light and heat in any situation. Additionally, the flame can set Corruptors on fire, lessening Mania's harm to the environment to an extent.
110507.Awakening Signs: The subject appeared on the day of the full Illusory Moon, causing a large-scale blackout in DisSea. The MBCC's Chief detained her personally. Her body was severely corrupted by contamination and her mind was no different than that of a Corruptor.
110507.Corruption State: In a fully corrupted state, her arms have carbonized and she has nearly lost all her humanness and rationality, making communication impossible.
110507.Arrest Records 1: After being detained during the Illusory Moon operation in DisSea, the subject has been placed in solitary confinement for observation and treatment. Since all current communication methods have proven futile, the MBCC has received the order for Chief to conduct dream dives with the subject.
110507.Arrest Records 2: The subject was once known as Tia, a priestess from a town near DisSea. For unknown reasons, the subject was sent into DisSea, where she was saved and taken in by the expedition. The subject went missing around N.F. 21 after getting separated from the crew.
110507.Arrest Records 3: In her early years, the subject wandered WhiteSands with several companions, surviving through hardships. Due to some incidents, most of her companions perished. In the following years, the subject and her remaining companions survived by luring wanderers for the desert bandits.
110507.Arrest Records 4: Around N.F. 19, the subject went to a town named Stor in WhiteSands and became the so-called *priestess* there. The subject maintained a high status in Stor Town until she entered DisSea at the beginning of N.F. 21.
110507.Performance 1: Hestia. Female. Approximately 153cm tall in the infected state. Dressed in white clothing resembling a ceremonial gown. Her body is severely corrupted by highly concentrated contamination, but the infection rates of the torch she carries and her highly carbonized arms are surprisingly low.
110507.Performance 2: After completing the psychic diving, the subject will remain in confinement for observation. According to the log, the subject is repelled by dark and cold environments, where she shows fear and anxiety. Therefore, such conditions should best be avoided.
110507.Performance 3: Her torch does not require fuel and smolders under all circumstances. It is also unusually active even in highly contaminated environments. The principle behind is yet unknown.
110507.Performance 4: The subject is visually impaired but has exceptionally keen hearing. She is sensitive to all unfamiliar sounds in the detention room, which may cause her to panic and lose control. Only Chief's presence induces calm and positive emotions in her.

110508.Info: For every <color=#63b4c3>1%</color> Attack Speed increase, gains a <color=#63b4c3>0.3%</color> Skill Damage bonus.
110508.Name: Vautour Bleu
110508.Criminal Record 1:
The subject is the founder and de facto governor of Désir, an Outland immigrant town situated outside DisCity. She also leads a clandestine commercial organization operating along DisCity's borders, wielding considerable influence throughout WhiteSands and the border areas. Despite her mysterious background, she maintains a widespread reputation.
As the head of this organization, the subject's frequent activities along the borders pose a severe security threat to DisCity. Given their adverse impact, immediate detention is recommended.
110508.Criminal Record 2: Interrogation reveals that the subject's past experiences have shaped her as a pessimist, who firmly believes in the inevitability of tragedy and the immutability of the future. Given that, she dedicated herself to protecting dreams that were doomed to shatter, which ultimately precipitates into the Désir incident. Following Chief's intervention and sharing of personal stories, her fatalistic attitude began to soften. She later made a deal with Chief, voluntarily accepting the shackles in exchange for a more promising future. Her threat level has since decreased, her merchant caravan now a valuable trade partner to the Bureau.
110508.Ability Summary: The subject is able to capture and store others' disillusionment—an invisible substance akin to a compound of spiritual energy. Through specific mediums, she can manipulate these accumulated illusions and convert them into physically destructive force of detrimental magnitude.
110508.Awakening Signs: Frequent exposure to disasters in her hometown left the subject with latent Mania contamination. While trading in WhiteSands, she seemed to have formed a certain kind of contract with a mysterious power in the region, awakening her special power.
110508.Corruption State: Awakened during the latent period, she shows no physical signs of mutation. She dreams frequently, mostly peaceful and pleasant ones.
110508.Arrest Records 1: Throughout the Désir incident, the subject maintained an ambiguous stance, refraining from choosing a side. Her true thoughts regarding Désir and its residents also remained inscrutable. She monitored Chief during this period yet did not actively impede investigation. Their relationship evolved into a lasting partnership over time.
110508.Arrest Records 2: After the resolution of the Désir incident, the subject's whereabouts became unknown. She is believed to have resumed her trade in WhiteSands, with her current location traceable only through the gifts and letters she regularly sends to the Bureau. This indicates that the subject sustained minimal losses during the incident and maintained her extensive resources and business network.
110508.Arrest Records 3: Born as named Madeleine, the subject hailed from a wealthy merchant family in an Outland city. Her privileged upbringing distanced her from commerce, but a series of disasters left her family in desperate straits. Assuming the alias Vautour Bleu, she led her surviving relatives on a perilous journey to DisCity, which unfortunately claimed the lives of all her loved families before her arrival.
110508.Arrest Records 4: The subject arrived in DisCity only to be met with equally bleak conditions, leading to her complete disillusionment with the DisCity dream. Having lived through the trauma herself, she chose to conceal the truth and deceive the townspeople, taking them under her wing with various methods, such as the datura pollen.
110508.Performance 1: She maintains a leisurely daily routine and particularly enjoys sunbathing during lunch breaks. She has adapted well to the simulated sunlight in both the outdoor activity area and the greenhouse. Her half-dozing pose has quickly become a familiar sight at the Bureau.
