When a mischievous Sinner attempted to prank her during her nap, it became immediately apparent that she was not defenseless even in repose.
110508.Performance 2: Sophisticated and knowledgeable, the subject knows well WhiteSands specialties and the Eastside upper class. Her repertoire of insider stories and gossip has earned her popularity among Sinners. She'd also willingly exchange these plausible tales for small favors, such as dessert delivery from the cafeteria.
110508.Performance 3: The subject's approachable demeanor and accommodating personality prove highly charismatic, quickly attracting a group of Sinners who eagerly attend to her every need. Furthermore, her extensive network of connections enables uninterrupted external contact and management of affairs outside the Bureau despite her detention, garnering additional attention from Sinners seeking to leverage her influence.
110508.Performance 4: The subject invited Chief to an afternoon tea and specifically prepared a type of traditional seashell-shaped cake from Outland freshly baked by a top pastry chef in Eastside. Not well-versed in confectionery, Chief only learned the name of these delicate, airy pastries after tasting them.

110509.Info: A Sinner adept at dealing magic damage who enters the battle with a full Ultimate Energy gauge. When Yingying is on the field, allied Arcane Sinners' skill damage can land critical hits, with effectiveness based on each Sinner's own CRIT Rate and CRIT Damage bonuses.
110509.Mania Intensify Text: Damage dealt increases by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color>, with an additional <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> increase to enemies with broken cores.
110509.Name: Yingying
110509.Criminal Record 1: The Wisteria Fairy who's lived over a thousand years, documented in Eastian legends. Every New Year, she holds a fete to grant blessings, attracting numerous devotees who come to make wishes. However, rumors also claim the subject is a spirit transformed from a millennium-old wisteria tree that drains people's Qi and eventually their lives, and that none who attend her fete ever return alive.
110509.Criminal Record 2: The subject is a survivor of the Perishing Star's fall in N.F. 01. The collective dying memories and intense survival instincts of thousands at the fete merged with her, awakening her as a Sinner. For a century, whenever the fete reappeared, she always sacrificed her power and life energy to appease restless spirits and protect visitors caught within. After a chance encounter with Chief, and thanks to Chief's persistence, the subject, despite being severely corrupted by Mania, gained a sliver of hope for revival after the fete subsided. According to her, Chief embodies her purpose and hope for a new life, and she wishes to remain by Chief's side forever.
110509.Ability Summary: The subject can use a wisteria flower staff to manifest a blooming wisteria tree. Its fragrance and branches can dominate the minds of her prey, draining their mental energy and consciousness to serve as *nutrients* that nourish her power.
110509.Awakening Signs: In N.F. 01, the Perishing Star fell, triggering widespread disasters that struck a small town. Beneath the wisteria tree of this town, the subject endured both Mania contamination and physical devastation from the calamity. Overwhelmed by the power of the townspeople's wishes, she awakened her special power, becoming a Sinner and shouldering the survival desires of the entire town. From then on, she sustained her power and illusion by absorbing the Qi and consciousness of the living.
110509.Corruption State: Severely corrupted, her physical body remains inseparable from the Mania contaminants.
110509.Arrest Records 1: After the wisteria Mania was defeated, the century-old fete illusion was dispelled. The Sinner's physical body, having suffered severe corruption, could not be detached from the Mania remains. After days of continuous searching, Chief finally was able to connect with her spiritually through a new sprout at the bottom of the ruins.
110509.Arrest Records 2: The subject's recovery has seen little to slow progress, requiring generous Qi transfers from Chief to maintain minimal improvement. Upon realizing this process would seriously endanger Chief's health, the subject has become very reluctant to consider her own revival, refusing further spiritual contact with Chief.
110509.Arrest Records 3: Recently, an Eastian delegation has visited the Bureau. Claiming to be descendants from the subject's homeland and having learned of her stalled recovery, they've proposed to bring her back to her origin to facilitate her recuperation. After thorough verification, it's confirmed that the delegation members have deep historical connections to the original location of the wisteria fete. The delegation has demonstrated their sincerity and offered multiple guarantees for the subject's well-being. Their proposal is currently being carefully considered.
110509.Arrest Records 4: Of her own volition, the subject has declined the Eastians' proposal to bring her back to her homeland, choosing instead to remain in DisCity under Chief and the Bureau's care. Currently, the Bureau has already agreed to provide the Eastian representatives with regular remote communication and convenient visitation channels, ensuring unobstructed contact between the two sides.
110509.Performance 1: During the early days of detention, due to her extremely fragile condition, constant supervision was required. However, records indicated that the staff responsible for her care were significantly more likely to be late the next day. When questioned, the staff all claimed the cause was unknown, merely stating it was hard to get out of bed due to the pleasant dreams they recently experienced. Upon learning of this situation, Chief decided to personally take care of her in order not to jeopardize the Bureau's attendance rates.
110509.Performance 2: Recently, Chief has received numerous reports of paranormal phenomena, including but not limited to unexplained floral fragrance and incidents of people being struck on the head by random falling wisteria blossoms. Some staff have even reported sightings of an indistinct figure humming foreign melodies on the trees of the Outdoor Activity Area. So far, Chief has not taken any measures regarding these reports, merely instructing everyone to remain calm and not be too concerned.
110509.Performance 3: The subject is naturally drawn to lively environments. Having been stuck in the fete illusion for a century, she always maintains a profound interest and curiosity toward all things and people. She often listens attentively to other Sinners discussing various topics and enjoys the atmosphere of everyone gathering together to chat and laugh.
110509.Performance 4: The subject has meticulously crafted two wisteria bracelets for Chief. One features perpetually blooming wisteria, symbolizing everlasting affection. The other remains dormant and silent, only unfurling when the subject is nearby. She claims that the fragrance will remind Chief of her, so Chief won't forget to meet her every day.

110601.Info: A Sinner adept at supporting allies. She cannot block enemies, nor can she be targeted by the enemy.
110601.Name: Hamel
110601.Criminal Record 1: The initiator of BR-001 Black Ring. Used hallucinatory powers to cover up nearly 10,000 Corruptors and the existence of the Black Ring, causing the expansion of the contaminated area and seriously staking the reputation of the FAC. This was a crucial trigger that provoked the Eastsiders' objections to Sinners and the FAC to send the MBCC to arrest all Sinners.
110601.Criminal Record 2: As the first-ever registered Sinner, the subject has received excellent care for her fractured mind since her detention. With Chief's constant company, her mental state grows more stable day by day and she has performed splendidly in several missions. The success of her case has greatly boosted the MBCC's confidence in taking in more Sinners.
110601.Ability Summary: Unleashed power through dancing, which can cause an illusionary effect over a large area and mental effects such as sensory distortion on all living beings.
110601.Awakening Signs: Unleashed her powers the first time when feeling the strong urge to dance in the endless carnival, which suppresses all Corruptors and the subject herself.
110601.Corruption State: Extremely unstable mental state since early childhood and in constant pseudo hallucinations. Examinations show that the subject's mental state has been severely affected by DisSea Explosion, but the reason is unknown.
110601.Arrest Records 1: The Chief was commissioned to go to the endless carnival and suppress BR-001 Black Ring, and in the process successfully arrested Hamel, the first Sinner who revealed the identity of a Sinner. Since the subject is trapped in the illusion for many years, she was immediately taken in and provided psychiatric treatment after contamination from the Black Ring was removed.
110601.Arrest Records 2: Parents are working as agents to train the subject to become a famous dancer. Tired of the over-frequent commercial events, the subject has a poor relationship with both parents and is closer to her brother, Norman. After the siblings ran away, the parents disappeared with the money to escape debts.
110601.Arrest Records 3: The subject got famous with just one dance at the age of sixteen, and rose to the commercial and artistic peak in DisCity with the help of parents and talent. Escaped with younger brother, Norman, due to stage fright, but reappeared a few years later in the endless carnival event.
110601.Arrest Records 4: The investigation found that the BR-001 Black Ring inventor was someone else. The subject sacrificed personal freedom to confine the Corruptors and suppress the Black Ring after finding out the anomalies in the endless carnival, which effectively stopped the spread of the danger. Convicted of collective disappearance by the FAC, but it is still debatable whether the subject is guilty of committing a crime.
110601.Performance 1: Lacks the concept of time due to being trapped in illusions for over a decade. The youthful state of the personality and body have been kept by unknown influences. Extremely uncomfortable with real life. Often found zoning out and unresponsive to external stimuli.
110601.Performance 2: The dance costume has the same design as the one the subject wore in the last performance. The material test showed that she was wearing a silk nightgown at home, and what the people saw was an illusion created by her special power.
110601.Performance 3: Being the "first recognized Sinner," the MBCC was worried that she would be ostracized, but instead, people crowded around Hamel's room, wanting to see the legendary dancer.
110601.Performance 4: Hamel can communicate with Chief smoothly now. The two are said to often dance together in the cell to communicate. Chief's act of appreciating artistic treasure exclusively without sharing has been strongly condemned.

110602.Info: A Sinner adept at dealing disturbance to enemies. When an enemy on the field is in [Fear] state, this Sinner recovers 1 energy herself. The effect has a 1-second cooldown.
110602.Name: Enfer
110602.Criminal Record 1:
One of the top sculptors in Eastside. She comes from an artistic family, with both her parents being renowned artists. At first, her artistic style was not recognized in the mainstream, and she could only show her creations on a small scale. Her creations, according to herself, are representations of the world she sees.
The Witching Hour Incident, brought about by Enfer's power, has caused serious damage and painful repercussions in Eastside; she must be detained immediately.
110602.Criminal Record 2: According to Chief, the subject activated her power during the Witching Hour incident due to her own agony and her biased view of the world. Despite that, Chief still believes the subject has a good side, which Chief attempts to uncover and nurture. Though the outcome is still unknown, the subject is now stable and has warmed up to Chief. Her prognosis is rather promising.
110602.Ability Summary: The subject's power allows her to manipulate the mental images of her victims. By making them see images or objects that frighten them, she breaks them physically and psychologically.
110602.Awakening Signs: It's initially inferred that Enfer awakened her power after witnessing the death of her loved ones and being directly exposed to the BR-004 on the day of its appearance. But upon further investigation, the MBCC believes that this might not be the day on which Enfer awakened her power, and that it might have happened at an early date.
110602.Corruption State: Crystals are obvious on Enfer's body; Enfer has chiseled them into the shape of a heart. Though it's not easy to discern, her mental status is not very stable.
110602.Arrest Records 1: In the Witching Hour Incident, the Chief gets through the maze built by Enfer the Witch and rescues her. After that, Enfer goes to the MBCC with the Chief of her own volition, and agrees to be detained.
110602.Arrest Records 2: Coming from an artistic background, Enfer is one of the top sculptors in Eastside. She sees her creations as an extension of herself. In the Witching Hour Incident, her power increased drastically, and she is now an S-class Sinner. She is adjusting to her new role, learning to see the world through a new pair of lenses.
110602.Arrest Records 3: Enfer's mother was a much bigger name than Enfer's father in the art world. Out of jealousy and driven to madness by stress, Enfer's father eventually killed his wife to create the sculpture *The Truthful One*. This incident influences Enfer's early works, and is the inspiration behind Enfer's series of horror-themed sculptures.
110602.Arrest Records 4: On the night The Truthful One was created, Enfer was saved by her mother from her father's sculpting knife. She has been haunted by the memory since. This memory has driven her to explore the nature of horror, but what her mother did for her that night has also set the tone for her later creations—love is a theme that she'll turn to in the future.
110602.Performance 1: In the early days of her detention, Enfer is prideful and unsociable. She keeps to herself, spending her free time largely in her room or the reading room, instead of socializing or talking with the others.
110602.Performance 2: Enfer sometimes discusses art with those Sinners interested in it, like Lisa, who once praised Enfer's unique style.
110602.Performance 3: Apart from sculpture and oil painting, Enfer seems to show a keen interest in Kinbaku. She is often found standing in front of a sculpture with a length of rope in her hands, and she sometimes seeks out Sinner Macchiato to ask questions about the subject.
110602.Performance 4: It seems that Enfer has a special attachment to Chief. She makes a sculpture for Chief. It is a sculpture that conveys a sense of warmth and beauty; this is a huge departure from her usual style, which is steeped in morbidity and horror.

110603.Info: A Sinner adept at supporting allies. Cabernet gains 1 [Soul Fragment] for every 8 enemy deaths, can hold up to 3 [Soul Fragments] at the same time.
110603.Name: Cabernet
110603.Incident: Guest Disappearance at Ogygia Villa Banquet
110603.Criminal Record 1:
The lady of the Franc family in Eastside, who enjoys wealth and status, has been pampered since childhood and is extremely picky about the things she eats. In order to satisfy her, the family spared no expense in finding all the ingredients she wanted...
Several chefs and other people have disappeared in the subject's mansion. She admitted to this, acknowledging that she restricted their freedom, but claimed that she was only "cultivating" them.
110603.Criminal Record 2: After being detained for several months, the subject's abnormal desires are basically under control, and she has never extracted others' consciousness and soul ever since. Chief is currently able to control the subject and soothe her mind, allowing her to maintain a peaceful and harmless state.
110603.Ability Summary: The subject can extract human souls, transforming them into ingredients she desires. The more honorable and perfect the soul, the more exquisite the ingredient it becomes. However, if over-extracted, the person being extracted will lose consciousness and become a walking corpse.
110603.Awakening Signs: After being reprimanded for her behavior and ideas following a picky meal, The subject realized where the most delicious food in the world comes from and awakened the ability to eat such food.
110603.Corruption State: No signs of corruption on her body, but her mental state is severely corrupted, resulting in excessive obsession and possessiveness towards certain people.
110603.Arrest Records 1: After the Insatiable Fiesta, the subject used her special power to restrain Chief and left the scene. However, the subject did not avoid the MBCC's tracking. After Chief's power was restored, the MBCC pursued and detained the subject.
110603.Arrest Records 2: Due to her pickiness towards ingredients and her noble status, the subject has become a major figure in Eastside who can alter the trend of the dining world. This has led to an unwritten rule in Eastside—only chefs who have the subject's approval can establish themselves there. As a result, many people are willing to risk their lives to present rare ingredients to the subject, in hopes of gaining her approval.
110603.Arrest Records 3: After investigating the subject, it was found that there was a room in her mansion that could accommodate ten people to store her "ingredients," including but not limited to the two who caused the Insatiable Fiesta. Among these victims, Carley and Greg were the most seriously affected. After being medically examined, the rest of the victims were not in fatal condition and were escorted home. However, due to the subject's power and her status as a Sinner, no news of this event has leaked out.
110603.Arrest Records 4: The subject noticed that when humans get angry and reproach others to protect what they love, their souls are likely to glow and taste delicious. Therefore, the subject admitted that for a while after her awakening, she would deliberately design events to provoke the anger of her target to "cultivate" their soul.
110603.Performance 1: After being detained at the MBCC, the subject still maintained her former lifestyle, her attitude towards everything was extremely elegant, and she still had high demands for dining. The MBCC cafeteria couldn't meet the subject's standard.
110603.Performance 2: After trying to get along with the Bureau's cafeteria for half a month, the subject reached an agreement with the cafeteria: high-quality purple grapes must be added to the daily fruits for the subject. The funds for the purchase will be provided by the subject's family.
110603.Performance 3: Even though the subject holds a prominent status, she gets along well with others and even overly indulges the people she likes. But due to the subject's excessive indulgence, many Sinners stop liking the things they once loved.
110603.Performance 4: The subject once insisted that Chief must accompany her during meals, otherwise she would refuse to eat. However, thanks to the efforts of Chief and the Bureau, the subject has now learned to dine without Chief's presence.

110604.Info: A Sinner adept at using allied units for output. Enters the battle with a full charge of energy for the Ultimate.
110604.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
110604.Name: Coquelic
110604.Criminal Record 1: The Garden's Mentor, currently the sole leader of the organization. She is suspected to have orchestrated countless attacks against the elite, and also to have deep ties with the Underground. She exposed her tracks during a mission against Paradeisos officials, and is listed as a priority for detainment due to the highly destabilizing impact of her actions.
110604.Criminal Record 2: The Garden exists in name only, as the subject ceased her activities as an assassin after being detained. Currently, she is committed to the MBCC, working with the Bureau in detaining Sinners. Moreover, investigations revealed that the Garden's catalyst in creating Sinners was the doing of the previous Mentor, not Coquelic. According to performance records, the subject's emotions are stable, and she rarely uses her power.
110604.Ability Summary: The subject can turn her mental energy into a Mania Flower and attach it to a target to control, attack, or heal. She can also gift this red flower to others, allowing them to gain the mental energy of the flower's attached target.
110604.Awakening Signs: The subject voluntarily formed a pact with the Mania inside her, exchanging her mental energy for her special power. After joining the Garden, she began to use a sword-shaped staff as her weapon of choice.
110604.Corruption State: No obvious signs of corruption are visible on her body, and her mental state is good. Her actual age is unknown, but her eternally youthful body has been completely consumed by Mania, leaving her in very poor health.
110604.Arrest Records 1: She was commissioned to launch targeted attacks on Paradeisos officials and the FAC. After the attack failed, she faked the destruction of the organization, led the remnants of the Garden to hide their identities, and took refuge in Syndicate. Later, due to the abnormal M-value caused by the gathering of Sinners, she was discovered and detained by the MBCC. She fiercely resisted during the detainment process.
110604.Arrest Records 2: The subject's parents were both FAC members. Due to their work, she was constantly moving from place to place with them. After her parents were killed on duty, she rejected all offers of care and condolences.
110604.Arrest Records 3: Years later, the subject began to be active as a Sinner of the Garden. During this time, she was personally involved in dozens of Eastside officials' deaths, including the commander in the incident where her parents were killed.
110604.Arrest Records 4: According to the subject, she seized the position of "Mentor" because she could not agree with the Garden's ethos. Under Coquelic's leadership, the Garden became a neutral organization independent from the Underground, and took on various deals while adopting a laissez-faire attitude towards the Sinners under its control.
110604.Performance 1: The subject claims to be physically weak and requires assistance with everything in life, including but not limited to eating, bathing, and going out. In particular, she has stringent requirements for the temperature of her baths and the type of petal shampoo to be used on specific days. Most of these requests have been rejected by the Bureau.
110604.Performance 2: She likes to "moonbathe," claiming that the night makes her more alert, and that her face looks better under the moonlight. Before "moonbathing," she usually spends a long time selecting her nightgown and completing a long, complicated skincare routine.
110604.Performance 3: She has a green thumb and is more than happy to give expert gardening advice to staff and Sinners. With her guidance, even beginners can grow beautiful flowers. However, when asked about her own gardening achievements, she simply gazes towards the Sinners from the Garden.
110604.Performance 4: She often refers to the members of the Garden as "little flowers," and recently, has also begun to refer to the Chief that way. She's also carefully selecting flowers that could symbolize the Chief, planning to plant them in her own flower bed.

110605.Info: A Sinner adept at assisting in combat. Enters the battle with Energy fully charged.
110605.Mania Intensify Text: Damage dealt by summoned creatures increases by <color=#63b4c3>15%</color>.
110605.Name: Eve
110605.Criminal Record 1:
Current owner of the Buonanotte Toy Factory, Eve was the instigator of the toy transformation incident. She turned all living creatures in the factory into toys out of personal motives and forced them to move.
Her power affected many innocent passersby around the factory and nearly caused a greater disaster at the border of the Rust.
110605.Criminal Record 2: Eve has cooperated with treatment and interrogation and volunteered all the details of her contact with the Underground. With Chief's guidance, she hasn't made any pessimistic remarks in a long time, and her insomnia and sleep-talking are mostly under control.
110605.Ability Summary: She can extract mental energy from herself or others and transform it into clockwork, which she uses to drive the toys and grant them partial consciousness and mobility, making the toys seem alive.
110605.Awakening Signs: According to Eve, she came into touch with contamination during an accident caused by Mania weapons. Witnessing the death of someone important triggered a massive emotional shock and awakened her as a Sinner.
110605.Corruption State: Her physical disability was caused by a childhood traffic accident unrelated to Mania, but it left her frail and with a low resistance to Mania. Extremely mentally unstable, sensitive, and pessimistic, she suffers from insomnia, frequent dreams, and sleep-talking.
110605.Arrest Records 1: During the aftermath of the toy factory incident, the rescue team discovered her traces in the contaminated ruins. After confirming that her mental and physical health were generally unharmed, the MBCC officially detained her for investigation.
110605.Arrest Records 2: Eve is the child of the Buonanotte Toy Factory's owners. She lost her legs in a childhood accident and has been living in a wheelchair ever since. The same year, the factory's business suffered a blow and Eve's medical expenses became a burden as the factory kept losing money. Busy saving their business, the factory owners gradually lost touch with their daughter.
110605.Arrest Records 3: She voluntarily recruited many people in difficult circumstances as factory workers. Even at the factory's rock bottom, these workers held on to their duties. According to Eve, she spent most of her time with her employees.
110605.Arrest Records 4: Pressured by deficits and violent debt collectors, the factory eventually became a testing field for Mania weapons where an explosion of contamination occurred. As the sole survivor, Eve couldn't let go of the memories. She was talked into staying in the factory and constructed a toy ward with her special power.
110605.Performance 1: When there are no field tasks, Eve is a night owl who only begins her activities after midnight. She likes to space out alone on the rooftop in the middle of the night, hugging her toys.
110605.Performance 2: She was initially reclusive and introverted, seldom communicating with others. But going to counseling and rehabilitation for her prosthetics has allowed her to interact with more Sinners and staff members. She has gradually overcome her social anxiety and is willing to engage in simple exchanges.
110605.Performance 3: She has a knack for mechanical devices and a good artistic sense. But as she has said herself, she no longer makes new toys and doesn't regret the waste of these talents.
110605.Performance 4: When Chief is present, Eve's treatment and therapy are significantly more effective. There is currently no scientific explanation for this change. It is speculated that Chief's presence reassures Eve, greatly boosting her motivation.

110606.Info: A Sinner adept at supporting allies. Enters the battle with Ultimate energy fully charged.
110606.Name: Du Ruo
110606.Incident: Tide of Ashes - Ten Scorching Suns
110606.Criminal Record 1: The Apostle of Ashes has intruded into DisSea. The subject arrives in DisCity as a member of the delegation from the Eastian Alliance, offering her expertise from experience.
110606.Criminal Record 2: The subject has never given up on her quest for the truth behind the calamity, but she now regards Chief as a fellow companion on her long journey.
110606.Ability Summary: A ritual is performed to recall the diffused vitality in the world and reinfuse it into a designated *container*, bringing about a *revival* of sorts.
110606.Awakening Signs: The subject claims to have sustained a disaster in an Eastian city, which awakened her ability. Further investigation is required to obtain the specifics.
110606.Corruption State: According to inspection records at the border control, the subject shows no physical signs of corruption and her mental state has been regularly stable.
110606.Arrest Records 1: During the confrontation with the Apostle of Ashes, the subject maintained a peaceful and calm demeanor, mediating between DisCity and the Eastian Alliance, ultimately facilitating a successful resolution to the ten-sun disaster.
110606.Arrest Records 2: Born into a family of scholars in Eastia, she was exposed to the mythology of the Sun Crow at a young age in school and questioned the content of the myths. With the support of her parents, she devoted herself to the study of mythology.
110606.Arrest Records 3: During her research, she became acquainted with the Sun Crow seer. Despite repeatedly exposing the seer's lies to the public, she was always met with the people's disbelief. Later, when the ten-sun calamity struck Eastia, she discovered the true nature of the disaster hidden behind the myths.
110606.Arrest Records 4: The ten-sun disaster led the subject to believe in myths written by humans. After finishing writing the myth, she left her homeland to track down the Sun Crow Apostle, eventually arriving in DisCity.
110606.Performance 1: During her stay in the Bureau, the subject received multiple heavy packages from Eastia. The packages contained ancient Eastian books, gaining the attention of a crowd of Sinners and sparking a brief reading craze among them.
110606.Performance 2: White smoke emerges from the subject's room occasionally. When inquired, she revealed that she was practicing an Eastern art called incense molding.
110606.Performance 3: When approached by other Sinners, the subject often improvises various Eastian myths. Younger Sinners are particularly keen on conversing with her.
110606.Performance 4: Before returning to Eastia, the subject gifted Chief an unfinished copy of *DisCity Mythical Notes*. She claimed that she would continue writing the book when she was reunited with Chief and that it would be a never-ending story.

110607.Info: A Sinner adept at supporting allies. Enters battle with a [Manty].
110607.Mania Intensify Text: Sinners with [Manty] receive an (L.L.'s Attack *<color=#63b4c3>10%</color> ) Attack boost, lasting until [Manty] leaves.
110607.Name: L.L.
110607.Criminal Record 1: The *island owner* of the famous dark web forum Elysiland. The subject has turned the site into a virtual world where everything is allowed, stimulating and trapping people's consciousness with the light and digital particles of the internet.
110607.Criminal Record 2: The subject's extreme behavior can largely be attributed to her inability to connect with the outside world, which can in turn be attributed to her illness and the impact of being abandoned by her parents at an early age. The subject's actions are not malicious, but stem from a deep-seated longing for stable connections with others and a yearning for freedom. She is currently being guided by Chief to engage with the real world and improve her understanding of it, and she has started making friends offline.
110607.Ability Summary: The subject's awakened ability resembles a computer worm, contaminating data through her digital pet that follows her everywhere. Guided by her will, it duplicates and sends different electronic symbols to different targets, interfering with their central nervous systems. Investigations reveal that these data signals range from high-quality to junk in quality.
110607.Awakening Signs: Due to the stress and despair brought by her condition, the subject lost all hope in life and initially intended to take her own life in the bathtub. At the brink of death, her virtual relationships saved her, simultaneously awakening her power.
110607.Corruption State: The subject's corruption is severe but mostly affects only her mind, so she shows no obvious crystallization or marks on her body.
110607.Arrest Records 1: The subject was the mastermind behind the sensational Elysiland mental contamination incident. With the Bureau's technical support, Chief infiltrated Elysiland and successfully arrested her, resolving the Elysiland incident.
110607.Arrest Records 2: The subject suffers from an extremely rare case of congenital hydrophilia. This genetic disease causes full-body muscle pain and weakness which can only be alleviated by soaking constantly in water. With Chief's shackles, she can come out of the water and walk freely for a short time, though her skin must be kept moist. Research indicates that a complete cure is impossible.
110607.Arrest Records 3: Since her earliest memory, the subject has never left the bathtub at home. Her early understanding of the outside world came entirely from her parents. Initially attentive, the subject's parents grew weary over time and bought her a computer to keep her occupied and avoid conversations with her.
110607.Arrest Records 4: Upon acquiring the computer, the subject became addicted to the online world. However, her condition prevented her from forming lasting connections with people. The dark side of the internet began to affect her, making her irritable. The subject's parents eventually abandoned her, leaving only an online bank account through which they regularly sent her money, never to be seen again.
110607.Performance 1: Upon arriving at the Bureau, contrary to the subject's lively and talkative online persona, she displayed rather severe social anxiety and avoided eye contact and face-to-face conversations. If an interaction was inevitable, she might even bring the person to the computer to conduct the chat online.
110607.Performance 2: The subject is addicted to online shopping and lacks self-control. She once accumulated so many packages that they overflowed from her room into the Bureau's corridor.
110607.Performance 3: In the subject's early days at the Bureau, her inability to converse directly with other Sinners and her dependence on her computer brought her great inconvenience. Later, Sinner Eleven lent her an old personal device so the subject could communicate through typing, which got her through the transition period.
110607.Performance 4: Perhaps because Chief's shackles allow her to come out of water, the subject frequently visits Chief's office for a chat or asks the Chief to take her out. Her behavior disrupts Chief's daily work to a certain extent.

110608.Info: A Sinner adept at domination. For Sinners with [Raindrop], lifesteal increases by <color=#63b4c3>4%</color>.
110608.Mania Intensify Text: Energy Recovery Speed is increased by <color=#63b4c3>15%</color>.
110608.Name: Jelena
110608.Incident: Cases on the Former Prime Minister
110608.Criminal Record 1: The subject is the personal butler and caretaker of Elvira Stewart, daughter of former Eastside councilor Stewart. Following Stewart's death, the subject moved into the Minos Bureau of Crisis Control with Elvira for protection, along with bodyguard S9.
110608.Ability Summary: The subject's special power, Mania Rain, utilizes resonance from the Mania Crystals in her hand chain to manipulate a special metal. Her power is relatively weak and has only one effect. Her power seems underdeveloped at the moment, but not excluding the potential for greater capabilities.
110608.Awakening Signs: The subject claims that her power awakened during a Mania attack in Eastside. Since then, her M-value has consistently remained at low levels, and she demonstrates no other abnormalities than her ability to manipulate the special metal.
110608.Corruption State: The subject has no visible signs of corruption present on her body and her mental state appears stable. However, her emotional responses have been found unusually subdued compared to the average person.
110608.Arrest Records 1: During the Eastside election, while escorting Elvira Stewart to seek protection at the Minos Bureau of Crisis Control, Jelena was identified as an awakened Sinner. The Bureau has since detained Jelena while allowing her to attend to Elvira's daily needs.
110608.Performance 1: Despite the change in her living environment, the subject is able to keep her young lady's and her own daily lives highly organized. Her luggage is stuffed with Elvira's belongings, including but not limited to candlesticks, silver spoons, incense burners, and her preferred pillow.
110608.Performance 2: The subject likes reading news from foreign sources, believing this can provide a more comprehensive understanding of current events. However, due to her sensitive identity, the Bureau's supervisory department has deemed it necessary to implement certain restrictions on her.
110608.Performance 3: The subject has become quite popular within the Bureau, as everyone can receive care as gentle as that of a mother's around her. During lunch breaks, her storytelling sessions have attracted not only children, but also adult listeners.
110608.Performance 4: The subject is also particularly attentive to Chief's daily needs, believing Chief requires the same level of personal care as Elvira does. Chief doesn't really need that kind of special assistance, so the subject's offer will usually be declined.
110608.True Ability Summary: The subject's special power, Mania Rain, utilizes the Mania Crystals in her hand chain to manipulate mist, creating a rain-like phenomenon. Those affected by it will receive an enhancement of their special powers, but in return, both their bodies and minds will fall under the subject's control.
110608.True Awakening Signs: During the encounter with an Apostle of Ashes in her Outland hometown as a child, the subject became infected with Mania and awakened as a Sinner. Later, under ■■■■'s guidance, she further enhanced her power with Ash Crystals and evolved into an S-Class Sinner.
110608.True Criminal Record 1: Born in a remote town in the Outlands, the subject was rescued by ■■■■ following a disaster in her hometown and taken to Fraser City. She subsequently joined their side and was dispatched to Eastside as an undercover operative to gather intelligence. She successfully infiltrated the Stewart household, securing a position as Elvira Stewart's personal butler.

110609.Info: At the start of the battle, for each allied Umbra Sinner present, Parfait will convert 1 enemy core into an [Umbra Core] when enemies expose their cores, up to a maximum of 3 conversions.
110609.Mania Intensify Text: When allied Sinners break an [Umbra Core], it counts as breaking <color=#63b4c3>1</color> additional core.
110609.Name: Parfait
110609.Criminal Record 1:
The subject identifies herself as "Parfait Medici" and holds the positions of Executive Director and Investment Advisor at Tulip Holdings, an Eastside-based investment firm. Renowned for her consistently accurate predictions of financial market trends, she earned the moniker "Investment Guru" within Eastside's investment circles.
Beginning in mid-N.F. 115, doubts emerged regarding the legitimacy of her identity. She has since faced allegations of involvement in multiple economic crimes, including the fabrication of an Outland Hypercube mine that has led to substantial economic losses and widespread social repercussions.
110609.Criminal Record 2: The subject has not utilized her Sinner abilities for a considerable time. Upon investigation, no significant fraudulent activities were uncovered within her venture capital firm. The counterfeiting case from her past has been resolved. Given the minor sum involved and her early provision of substantial compensation to the affected parties, no additional charges were pursued. Presently, the subject remains active in Eastside's financial industry and continues to be in high demand among financial professionals and affluent business figures.
110609.Ability Summary: The subject has the ability to manifest others' trust in physical form. Once she earns their confidence, she can convert that belief into tangible objects, including but not limited to currency and goods. However, should this trust be lost, the materialized items will vanish accordingly.
110609.Awakening Signs: During the years the subject has been active in Eastside, she has never publicly used her abilities. However, investigations indicate that her powers had already awakened by the time she first appeared at Eastside social events under the "Parfait Medici" identity.
110609.Corruption State: The subject's Mania corruption level is relatively mild, showing no obvious surface infection symptoms and retaining clear mental faculties. However, the subject exhibits abnormally high levels of social activity in daily life, which is suspected to be a side effect of her Sinner abilities.
110609.Arrest Records 1: The subject experienced a credibility crisis following a series of events in May N.F. 115 and subsequently avoided public appearances in Eastside for the next six months. As her reputation deteriorated, she was revealed to be under suspicion for involvement in a counterfeiting case that had taken place years earlier in Eastside. As a result, she became a wanted individual by both Nirvana and the Financial Inspection Team, leading to her eventual detention by the Chief personally during a field operation.
110609.Arrest Records 2: The subject claimed to be an "orphan of the Medici family" who had been living abroad for years. Her debut at Eastside social events instantly attracted widespread attention. Through a series of high-risk financial ventures, she secured substantial profits for numerous investors. After amassing significant wealth, the subject became a frequent presence at art exhibitions, earning acclaim for her discerning taste and generous patronage of artists, eventually being hailed as a "model aristocrat."
110609.Arrest Records 3: According to investigations, the subject actually originated from Syndicate and possesses no noble bloodline whatsoever. Her startup capital consisted of counterfeit money created using her Sinner abilities. Because it was completely identical to genuine currency, it temporarily caused market panic. However, the actual amount of counterfeit money she produced was only around 110,000 DisCoins.
110609.Arrest Records 4: At the N.F. 115-116 Spring Concert, the Eastside investment community became convinced that the subject had secured a partnership with the West District Hypercube mine. Overnight, her venture capital firm, Tulip Holdings, surged to the top of the market, with stock and corporate bond prices maintaining an unprecedented high. This unexpected windfall not only restored her standing in Eastside society but also rendered the charges brought by the Financial Inspection Team and Nirvana effectively moot.
110609.Performance 1: The subject had no permanent residence in Eastside and primarily stayed at various high-end hotels. This arrangement persisted until her detention by the Chief. Although she has since been granted an exemption and is no longer subject to long-term confinement, she continues to frequent the Bureau under the guise of "visiting friends."
110609.Performance 2: The subject's "Parfait's Dinner Party" was once the most exclusive and coveted private event in Eastside. On the surface, they promised little more than "the chance to dine with Parfait." Yet financiers and investors clamored for invitations, pouring fortunes into securing a seat and pulling every string imaginable, all for a shot at winning the favor of the so-called "investment guru."
110609.Performance 3: The subject cultivates a vast social network, with connections spanning every sector of DisCity. Her associates range from affluent merchants and financial elites in Eastside to childhood friends from Syndicate. Following the N.F. 115-116 Spring Concert, she no longer concealed her ties to Syndicate and has since openly accompanied her Syndicate friends to high-profile venues across Eastside.
110609.Performance 4: The subject holds the Chief in high esteem, often publicly commending the Chief's artistic taste and sophisticated conversation, while also emphasizing their "close relationship." Some speculate that her actions are strategically designed to align herself more closely with the Chief, thereby bolstering the investment community's confidence in her ability to contribute to the West District Hypercube mining project. However, she dismisses this interpretation, insisting that her admiration stems solely from "genuine personal appreciation."

110610.Info: A Sinner highly contaminated by DisSea. Gains <color=#63b4c3>1</color> M-Value each time she heals allied Sinners, up to <color=#63b4c3>6</color> M-Value per second. Enters [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>60</color>, gaining an <color=#63b4c3>8%</color> Attack increase. Leaves [Corruption State] when M-Value reaches <color=#63b4c3>0</color>.
110610.Mania Intensify Text: The effect of [Abyssal Blessing] increases by <color=#63b4c3>30%</color> for [Immortal] Sinners.
110610.Name: Shin
110610.Criminal Record 1:
The subject was an oceanographer in the Black Ring Expedition's Deep Dive unit, as well as the de facto leader of this unit. Besides her scientific work, due to her extensive maritime experience, she also served as the naval surgeon and handled other responsibilities.
According to reports, the subject was one of the original initiators of the Black Ring Expedition, and the entire Deep Dive unit consisted almost only of her followers she had met during her earlier scientific explorations and academic career.
110610.Criminal Record 2: Currently detained by the MBCC. No significant abnormalities or harmful incidents have been observed to date. The subject remains within the control of the MBCC.
110610.Ability Summary: When the tentacles controlled by the subject come into contact with an organic life form, its Mania level will surge explosively and all special powers will be enhanced. But at the same time, the body of the organism in contact will undergo rapid decay and soon lose its own consciousness, becoming an abyssal creature.
110610.Awakening Signs: The subject appeared on the day of the full Illusory Moon, causing an abnormally high tide in the DisSea area. She was personally detained by the MBCC's Chief. Her body was wrapped in numerous fleshy tentacles and severely corrupted by contamination, but she was still capable of communication.
110610.Corruption State: The level of corruption is extremely high, with her body structure now almost completely different from that of a human, but the degree of visible mutation on the surface is not severe. Her rationality is still intact, and her communication abilities even exceed the average person.
110610.Arrest Records 1: After being detained during the Illusory Moon operation in DisSea, the subject has been placed in solitary confinement for observation and treatment. Due to the special nature of the Sinner, the MBCC has received the order for Chief to personally conduct dream dives with the subject.
110610.Arrest Records 2: The subject was born into an academic family before Nightfall. Both of her parents were university lecturers and many of her relatives were well-known oceanographers. Under her family's *nurture*, she quickly grew to become a *rising star* in the field of oceanography. She was assigned to conduct research on exploration vessels before she was even an adult.
110610.Arrest Records 3: During an oceanographic expedition, the crew fell victim to natural disasters and extreme environmental conditions. This led to panic and conflict within the expedition team, ultimately resulting in a horrifying tragedy. The subject was the only survivor of this expedition.
110610.Arrest Records 4: As the sole survivor of the expedition, the subject received attention from academic circles upon her return to society. She was quickly appointed as a professor at a prestigious institute. In the following years, she began preparing for expeditions into restricted deep-sea areas, eventually becoming one of the initial founders of the Black Ring Expedition.
110610.Performance 1: Shin. Female. Approximately 170cm tall in her infected state, with her body surface wrapped in numerous fleshy tentacles. Beneath them, her body appears indistinguishable from a normal human, but her internal structure has undergone massive changes.
110610.Performance 2: After completing the psychic diving, the subject will remain in confinement for observation. According to the log, the subject displays cognitive abilities and communication skills indistinguishable from those of a normal human. However, due to her highly dangerous nature, no one except Chief is permitted to approach her.
110610.Performance 3: The tentacles attached to the subject are part of her body and are controlled by her mind. Unlike any known organic structure, the composition and origin of these tentacles are unknown, and they constantly emit strong Mania contamination.
110610.Performance 4: The subject is permanently kept in isolation in a special Mania-proof room. The Hypercubes in the shielding device must be replaced every 48 hours to prevent contamination leakage. Chief personally conducts regular inspections and reinforces the shackle connections to ensure long-term, stable containment and control.

111101.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Increases Max HP by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color>.
111101.Name: Countess Chelsea
111101.Criminal Record 1:
A famous Eastside upstart who has a fickle temper and an extravagant spending habit and often shows absurd behaviors.
The top suspect for the mass disappearance in the Count's mansion a few years ago. The legitimacy of the subject's peerage inheritance is still largely controversial. There has been multiple charges against her, such as abusing her special power to produce gems while hiding her Sinner identity and intentionally disturbing market balance, posing a serious threat to Eastside's economic development.
111101.Criminal Record 2:
Interrogation reveals that the primary motives behind the subject's crime were her confinement and her pet cat Sitri's murder by the old count. The subject is emotionally stable in her detention and never hesitates to donate to charity events supporting causes such as stray animal adoption and human rights protection.
The subject's power allows her to produce gems, but under the Bureau's strict supervision, she no longer poses a threat to Eastside's economy and market equilibrium.
111101.Ability Summary: Using her special power, the subject is able to convert organic matters into hard crystal gems and turn minerals into a leopard named *Sitri* at will, commanding it to execute simple attack and defense orders during battles.
111101.Awakening Signs: Judging from the timing the subject began squandering gems, the awakening happened about five to ten years ago. The precise context is to be investigated, but the awakening is suspected to have to do with intense emotional fluctuations.
111101.Corruption State: Although no physical health issues have been detected, gem production consumes a lot of energy and the use of special power can wear out the subject. The subject's eccentric behavior is however unrelated to corruption but only due to the subject's character.
111101.Arrest Records 1: Wanted and arrested by the Public Security Bureau for being involved in multiple emotional harassment cases and financial disputes. When law enforcement discovered the subject could produce gems out of thin air, they escorted her to the MBCC for further investigation.
111101.Arrest Records 2: Used to be an apprentice lapidary and knew the old Count through her master. The subject admitted she has murdered over ten people in the Count's mansion, inherited the peerage by illegitimate means, and taken over all the property under the old Count's name.
111101.Arrest Records 3: The gem leopard *Sitri* is named after the subject's cat she adopted in her apprentice days, which was very close to Chelsea. According to the subject's account, the old Count had mutilated and killed Sitri for no reason, which became the primary motive for Chelsea's crime.
111101.Arrest Records 4: The victims in the Count's mansion were all turned into gem sculptures and hidden in the underground collection room. The method successfully deceived the sheriffs, so the Count's disappearance remained an unsolved case for years.
111101.Performance 1: Chelsea appears to have adapted to life in the detention room very well and has never attempted to escape. Although, surveillance footage shows that several people within the Bureau seem to be supplying her with expensive everyday products and entertainment items, and some are even hired to provide services such as massage and manicure to her.
111101.Performance 2: The subject has strained her eyes by doing long hours of lapidary work in the past and suffers from severe myopia, so she wears contact lenses all the time. When asked why she didn't get surgery to fix her eyesight, she answered that she couldn't trust those surgeries.
111101.Performance 3: Asking people whom she likes to be her sugar babies has become her signature behavior. Since most staff and Sinners have received expensive gifts from the subject, everyone tends to just ignore her strange behaviors.
111101.Performance 4: Due to her poor eyesight, the subject has not been doing lapidary work for years. But she has picked up her tools and begun practicing again for Chief. She's made a pair of exquisite smoky quartz handcuffs as a gift for Chief and claimed that Chief is *her property*.

111102.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Shield Efficiency by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color>.
111102.Mania Intensify Text: The generated shield gains an additional effect: While the shield lasts, damage dealt to the shielded unit is reduced by <color=#63b4c3>5%</color>.
111102.Name: Cinnabar
111102.Criminal Record 1:
Used to work as a security supervisor in the renowned security company *Serpent Eye*, the subject betrayed others' trust in her and left her duties without permission, exposing important officials to danger and leading to a catastrophic security breach.
While on the run, the subject repeatedly resisted arrest by the Public Security Bureau with the help of several accomplices and was included on the most wanted list.
111102.Criminal Record 2: In her detention, the subject demonstrates a strong conscience and protective instinct, contrary to previous records. Interrogation and investigation reveal that although the subject indeed left her duties without permission on the day her power awakened, she did that to protect innocent citizens from the terrorist attack. It's believed that her protective instinct possibly awakened her power. On her MBCC missions, the subject has shown undeniable professionalism in the security domain and a strong sense of responsibility.
111102.Ability Summary: Able to charge the portable customized barrier generator at will. The special power shield it releases can ward off most physical or energy attacks.
111102.Awakening Signs: The subject has taken Serpent Eye's strict onboarding physical examination before and no latent infection symptoms have been detected. It can be confirmed that the subject had the first awakening when fighting terrorists on a mission to protect officials.
111102.Corruption State: No signs of Mania corruption detected. Possesses excellent fighting, shooting, and counter-surveillance skills. The inborn high intelligence and physical strength give the subject higher resistance to corruption than normal people.
111102.Arrest Records 1: During the period the subject was wanted, she used an alias and hid in Syndicate, working as a mercenary. After her Sinner identity was exposed, to avoid affecting her comrades, the subject let herself be arrested by the MBCC.
111102.Arrest Records 2: According to the résumé provided by *Serpent Eye*, during the subject's tenure, she successfully prevented multiple attacks, made impressive achievements, and received excellent comments.
111102.Arrest Records 3: At the scene of the officials' attack, the subject didn't merely leave the clients unprotected, but had instead made careful escorting arrangements before going back alone to fight the terrorists in an attempt to save the civilians. The truth behind the crime of AWOL has to be further determined.
111102.Arrest Records 4: Cinnabar's father was one of the founding members of *Serpent Eye*. After her father died on a mission, the subject was raised with the financial support and care from her father's former comrades. Having graduated with distinction from the police academy, the subject chose to join *Serpent Eye*.
111102.Performance 1: Having grown up around mercenaries, the subject knows nothing about the common topics among girls. But she's never been pushed aside for this, or rather, she's extremely popular among female Sinners because of her handsome appearance.
111102.Performance 2: The subject has a regular schedule, a healthy diet and no bad habits; and she has few other activities other than daily training and maintanance of her weapons and equipments. Other Sinners have made such comments about her: "So normal that she's a bit uninteresting."
111102.Performance 3: *Protecting others* has been an unconscious occupational habit of the subject's, but as the women in the Bureau begin to purposely fall down before her more and more often, the situation is becoming quite a headache for the subject.
111102.Performance 4: The subject spent a month on mental preparation in order to address Chief by name. One week before the scheduled date, the subject even submitted a written application with a copy to Chief's office.

111103.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Blocks 2 enemies at the same time and increases Magic Resistance by <color=#63b4c3>5%</color>.
111103.Name: Kawa-kawa
111103.Criminal Record 1: A guide of a border town of WhiteSands, he was arrested on suspicion of trespassing and destroying the WhiteSands trade channel. According to the investigation, the subject had also helped many WhiteSands bandits and exhibited many strange behaviors. His presence had also seriously affected the management practices around DIS, obstructing the regular flow of Hypercubes.
111103.Criminal Record 2:
Records show that since childhood, the subject lived a secluded life with his father who's also a cartographer. His ignorance of basic societal values can explain why he mistakenly took the supplies from the base station and aided the bandits. The subject is otherwise very knowledgeable in his professional area and is a very bright student.
After some basic education, the subject can now fully comprehend how society works and is unlikely to suffer the same accusations again in the future.
111103.Ability Summary: Kawa-kawa's power can influence the beacon that he carries. When unfolded, it will form a small shelter that provides protection for those in it.
111103.Awakening Signs: While surveying alone, he encountered a sandstorm in the WhiteSands and awakened his power in the face of despair. In the end, he was able to make it through the crisis with his special powers and his remarkable survival skills.
111103.Corruption State: He has recently awakened with a low level of corruption. He has a clear mind and a strong will. There is some stubborn behavior unrelated to corruption. No serious negative effects were detected due to Mania for the time being.
111103.Arrest Records 1: He was put on the watch list by the FAC for repeatedly helping the bandits in the WhiteSands. The MBCC encountered him in the WhiteSands while on a mission and took him into custody the moment he was discovered to be a Sinner.
111103.Arrest Records 2: Having always lived a secluded life, the subject struggles to blend into human society due to the lack of common sense, and has a unique yet incorrect understanding of social intercourse. The subject will help anyone who asks for help without hesitation.
111103.Arrest Records 3: Vigorous and resilient, the subject has both the abilities and the experience to survive in the wild. It's like a walk in the park that the subject can even spare some attention to help those who are in danger.
111103.Arrest Records 4: Born in the borderland of The DisCity in a town near the WhiteSands, the subject lost his mother when he was little, and he rarely saw his father. The townsfolk laughed at him, calling him the son of a fool. When he turned eight, he received valuable research data from his father. Since then, he has carried on the legacy of his father and the father before him and taken up the mantle of drawing a map of the WhiteSands.
111103.Performance 1: His luggage weighs 20 kg and is something he will not abandon under any circumstances. Inside are the necessities of survival in the wilderness and hundreds of surveying maps, which Kawa-kawa considers "life dependent."
111103.Performance 2: As a result of reading books left by his grandfather and father since childhood, Kawa-kawa is far more knowledgeable than his peers. This is especially true in wilderness survival, where he has reached the expert level with strong theoretical knowledge and extensive first-hand experience.
111103.Performance 3: He easily believes the lies of others and have been deceived many times by other Sinners to perform dangerous work on their behalf. However, Kawa-kawa has no complaints about this and is even happy to do it. He sees it as a necessity to reach his ideals.
111103.Performance 4: Kawa-kawa cherishes the surveying manuscripts of his father and grandfather very much. But he made an exception and presented a copy of a map to Chief. He invited Chief to survey with him so as not to disappoint his father's ideals.

111104.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Max HP by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color>.
111104.Mania Intensify Text: When [Contract Request] hits an enemy, for each [Life Loss] state carried by the enemy, Levy recovers <color=#63b4c3>1%</color> of his Max HP.
111104.Name: Levy
111104.Criminal Record 1: Levy is the owner of several small businesses in Eastside; he likes to present himself as a fop. Levy is suspected of involvement in dozens of cases of business fraud or unfair competition, indirectly causing the death of a dozen people, who have committed suicide after going bankrupt, seeing their families fall apart, or some other tragedy.
111104.Criminal Record 2: As a famous rich heir in Eastside, the subject still keeps his high-profile, absurd style after his arrest. He often describes the Sinners in the Bureau as *boring* during his consultation with the psychologist. Although his nature is impossible to change and he still occasionally harasses staff and advertises products without permission, the MBCC's strictly supervised environment has made it difficult for him to continue his business fraud activity in the Bureau.
111104.Ability Summary: The subject can form a mutual contract with any living being. Once the contract is established, the subject can drain the life and energy from the other party. The subject calls that *reasonable exploitation within the bounds of the contract*.
111104.Awakening Signs: According to Levy himself, he awakened his power and became a Sinner four years ago, when he experienced "indescribable joy and satisfaction" upon revenging himself by every possible means on his relatives who "had abandoned him."
111104.Corruption State: Levy suffers from a low level of Maniac corruption, but no abnormalities have been found on his body. Psychologically speaking, Levy has been found to be a man of low moral standards who is almost entirely devoid of any sense of guilt and has antisocial tendencies.
111104.Arrest Records 1: Levy crosses paths with the MBCC for the first time during Special Operation [Data Deleted], and his identity as a Sinner is exposed in the operation. Two days after the operation, he is arrested by the MBCC's field workers without resistance.
111104.Arrest Records 2: Levy was born into a wealthy family in Eastside. According to those who knew the family, Levy's parents were cold toward each other, and he didn't grow up in a loving household. From age 10 to age 16, Levy goofed around with some of his unemployed relatives, living an extravagant, preposterous lifestyle. And his parents simply turned a blind eye.
111104.Arrest Records 3: In N.F. 104, Levy's parents were killed in a car accident. Since Levy was too young to take care of his parents' assets, a so-called *committee of the bereaved* comprised exclusively of Levy's relatives was established to take charge of these assets, which were then divided up among the members of the committee. When Levy came of age, he received less than 8% of what he was actually entitled to.
111104.Arrest Records 4: In N.F. 106, the cracks in the relationships between Levy's relatives began to show. The rifts among the board members were deepening, often leading to bloodshed. By N.F. 110, all the members of the *committee of the bereaved* had fallen out of the public eye—some had committed suicide, some had been murdered, and some had gone bankrupt. Levy now possesses 69.1% of the company's shares, taking back control over his parents' assets.
111104.Performance 1: As a rule, Levy doesn't turn down the jobs the MBCC asks him to do. But most of the time, he outsources them. Since there's no guarantee that the people Levy outsources the jobs to will complete them satisfactorily, how fast they will be finished, how well, and how completely fluctuate greatly.
111104.Performance 2: Levy harries the MBCC staffers every now and then. According to some of the victims, Levy "strikes up a conversation in an awkward manner," and the conversation always ends in him trying to sell the garbage his companies are making. But strangely, he steers clear of the Sinners whenever possible. "Too many lunatics among them. It's too risky. Not worth it," Levy once allegedly explained.
111104.Performance 3: Levy is fun-loving. He proposes on more than one occasion that he fund the establishment of some recreation center within the MBCC, like a bar with music, a room for playing bridge, an amusement arcade, a zoo, and a flea market. All his proposals are vetoed in the end.
111104.Performance 4: Levy has the habit of launching into farcical hours-long nonsense while sweet-talking his interlocutor into buying his products or signing a business contract full of loopholes. But he takes a completely different attitude when it comes to Chief; in their conversations, Levy sometimes makes risky remarks.

111105.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Defense by <color=#63b4c3>5%</color>.
111105.Name: Uni
111105.Criminal Record 1:
An Eastside plastic surgeon who runs a mysterious underground clinic. According to investigations, the subject secretly works with many different forces, and has helped Eastside's big entertainment companies catapult stars to fame.

The subject once created a type of cosmetic surgery that can completely swap one person's face with another's. However, according to investigations, this popular operation became intertwined with many missing persons cases, and was quickly banned.
111105.Criminal Record 2: According to observations, the subject can indeed use mirrors to cast her power. At present, all mirrors in the operating room have been destroyed. Since getting detained by the MBCC, the subject has gradually calmed down, and her attention has shifted from face-stealing to Chief. The MBCC will continue to monitor the subject's power so as to prevent her from committing further crimes.
111105.Ability Summary: Her power can turn Mania Crystals into mirrors. Crystallized mirror surfaces are extremely hard and can withstand and reflect multiple impacts. These mirrors show people the reflections they desire, which the subject then manipulates to interfere with reality.
111105.Awakening Signs: It is difficult to pinpoint when exactly the subject awakened her power. It may have been during medical school, when she was exposed to contaminants from relevant experiments.
111105.Corruption State: Corrupted to a medium degree, reflected specifically in her mental state. The subject has severe obsessive-compulsive disorder, and tries obsessively to control everything related to her field of work.
111105.Arrest Records 1: The subject has long been engaged in underground cosmetic surgery work in Eastside. Some of her clients disappeared after undergoing surgery. After a tip-off, she was confirmed to be a Sinner and arrested in the operating room.
111105.Arrest Records 2: In all the relevant cases, the missing persons had visited Uni's clinic and underwent cosmetic surgery. The subject denies all accusations, claiming that her mirrors only show people the faces they desire to have, and does not have the capacity for crime.
111105.Arrest Records 3: The subject grew up in an orphanage and harbors strong hostility towards everyone except her sister. She has shown strong learning abilities since childhood, and was admitted to Banyan Medical College as an adult to conduct research on the "physical alteration and clinical recovery of mutants". Her twin sister Luna failed to get into the program.
111105.Arrest Records 4:
Before dropping out, the subject had a fight with her sister over her career, which led to her scratching her sister's face. Not long after, Luna disappeared, and the subject dropped out of school and vanished.

A year later, she reappeared as a cosmetician. Ever since, missing persons cases related to her increased year by year.
111105.Performance 1: The subject has extreme obsessive-compulsive disorder. She insists that everything in her room be arranged symmetrically, and bars anyone else from entering her room. According to observations, the subject shows an equally strong desire to control personal items.
111105.Performance 2: The subject has an insatiable sweet tooth. She accepts almost any food that is sweet and has an enormous appetite. Once, another Sinner pranked her by replacing her usual high-end desserts with cheap pastries, but the subject did not get angry after finding out. It seems that she doesn't care about food quality, just sweetness.
111105.Performance 3: Has an extremely low desire to socialize, and almost never tries to chat with other Sinners and staff. Some Sinners have gone to consult her about plastic surgery out of curiosity, but the staff promptly stopped her from inspecting their faces.
111105.Performance 4: Highly possessive of Chief, she often uses the shackles in a brash manner to confirm Chief's presence. After Chief coaxed her not to do so, she changed her behavior for the better, opting instead to invite Chief to spend time with her.

111106.Info: Each time Nino takes damage, she recovers <color=#63b4c3>2</color> Energy. This effect can be triggered up to once every 5 seconds.
111106.Name: Nino
111106.Criminal Record 1:
Nino Sama, a virtual streamer who's made a name for herself in Eastside, quickly attracted a large fanbase with her superb gaming skills and witty commentary.
She used her abilities to project her live streams to various locations in DisCity several times, causing a significant disruption to public order.
111106.Criminal Record 2: After receiving training, she has not exhibited any manic tendencies, and her level of corruption has significantly decreased. Meanwhile, her social circle in the real world has greatly expanded. Although she continues to livestream, her verbal aggression during the streams has been somewhat mitigated. There have been no instances of "stream hijacking" during her broadcasts. To ensure her combat effectiveness, MBCC staff and Sinners regularly monitor her live stream.
111106.Ability Summary: Her power strength is directly proportional to the number of viewers and the intensity of their emotional feelings. The more viewers and the more intense their emotional feelings, the stronger and wider the range of her power. Similarly, her combat abilities are also enhanced to a certain degree.
111106.Awakening Signs: Based on her corruption and the objective time during which she became a popular streamer, it is inferred that she experienced a strong emotional shock two years ago, which triggered her awakening.
111106.Corruption State: She has a moderate degree of corruption. Studies suggest that this is due to the long-term use of her abilities. If she continues to use her abilities for an extended period, there is a risk of further spread of Mania.
111106.Arrest Records 1: She was once involved in a Mania incident with the MBCC Chief. After the incident, she escaped from the scene but was later caught and detained by the MBCC Chief when she resumed live streaming a few days later.
111106.Arrest Records 2: She once gained a lot of fame from a stream in which she was attacked by a Corruptor. According to her own account, this was a livestream she had meticulously planned, with the aim of attracting public attention.
111106.Arrest Records 3: She has lived alone for a long time, with few interpersonal relationships. She spends the majority of her income on purchasing live-streaming equipment and materials.
111106.Arrest Records 4: During her long-term solitary life, she developed a serious dependency on the internet due to her inability to interact normally with others. This led to her strong interest in video games and online forums. To attract attention from others, she repeatedly made radical statements during her live streams. She has been warned and educated by the MBCC Chief.
111106.Performance 1: She has a strong interest in puffed food, fried food, and carbonated drinks. At the time of her detention, she had a cavity. After treatment, her daily diet is now fully managed by MBCC.
111106.Performance 2: She is a loyal user of a forum named DisMyth, often frequenting its gaming threads. To draw attention, she often makes provocative or trolling comments. She has had 53 of her accounts banned to date.
111106.Performance 3: Her weapons, Lævateinn and Svalin, are modeled after the rare hidden sword-shield with a drop rate of less than 0.1% from a once-popular online game called Legion of Warcraft in DisCity. She is currently a hardcore player of Codename: Dark, playing it for more than two hours daily.
111106.Performance 4: The MBCC Chief finally agreed to her request to livestream, on the condition that she refrains from using her abilities for extended periods and learns to control them. She is currently receiving training at the MBCC.

111107.Info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Max HP by 10%.
111107.Mania Intensify Text: When an enemy receives a [Weakspot] mark, Golan recovers <color=#63b4c3>2.5%</color> of her Max HP.
111107.Name: Golan
111107.Criminal Record 1: The heir to a Syndican gang involved in numerous shootouts there and entangled with various gang factions. The subject's suspected of dabbling in the underground circulation of Mania weapons and hence poses a significant threat. Immediate detention is recommended.
111107.Criminal Record 2: It has now been confirmed that the subject's gang was not involved in the circulation of Mania weapons. Her awakening was triggered by forced contact with Mania due to an attack, not out of her own volition. Kind and innocent in nature, the subject got involved in street brawls to protect her family. Under the Bureau's rehabilitation and supervision, she is confirmed to no longer be a threat.
111107.Ability Summary: Capable of transmuting an object by touch, the subject can convert a parasol into a tough weapon by turning its cover into the alloy constituting its handle, as well as harden various materials and fire them as bullets.
111107.Awakening Signs: When the subject witnessed her first ever Syndican gang fight, she was attacked by a Mania weapon and got infected with Mania. During the subsequent clash, the subject's strong desire to protect her family and resistance to the unfolding events triggered the awakening of her power.
111107.Corruption State: The subject's level of corruption is low and her physical features are no different from that of a normal person. However, her mental state is unstable, often showing abnormal tendencies such as impulsiveness and overreaction.
111107.Arrest Records 1: While hiding in a residential home in Syndicate, the subject issued a bounty on the dark web for an intel-gathering job. Her identity as a Sinner was exposed following her contact with Chief. The subject was then detained by Chief after the *MBCC Chief Kidnapping Case*.
111107.Arrest Records 2: The subject was born into the Iron Gang, a medium-sized Syndican gang led by her mother. Kept isolated deliberately by her parents, she's only acquired basic self-defense skills as the heir and is still unaware of the dangerous situation she's in.
111107.Arrest Records 3: The subject's special power is coveted by all the gangs and the Iron Gang is often besieged by massive attacks consequentially. To avoid burdening her family, the subject has left the gang of her own accord and strives to present herself as a *lady* to dissociate herself from the underworld and sever ties with her past.
111107.Arrest Records 4: The Iron Gang was initially established around debt collection businesses. The subject once openly surrendered during a gang clash, which led to the MBCC being mistakenly regarded as her backing force. The other gangs' wariness has since favored the Iron Gang's development.
111107.Performance 1: The subject has a deep bond with her family. When she missed home during her early days of detention, she would call her family discreetly and hang up quietly as soon as they answered just to confirm their safety.
111107.Performance 2: The subject is a loyal fan of DeadLover Radio and enjoys listening to sensational stories. She takes the host's exaggerated remarks a little too seriously and even imitates her.
111107.Performance 3: With her poor acting skills, the subject can't maintain her *ladylike* image for more than a few hours, often becoming irritated after repeatedly having to hold back on swearing and eventually revealing her true nature. Many Syndican Sinners get along with the subject and commend her for taking the blame after collaborative mischief.
111107.Performance 4: The subject is keen on studying *ladylike* looks in TV dramas, often seeking Chief's opinions on outfit ideas. If an outfit receives praise from Chief, the subject will wear it without hesitation and refuses to take it off even when her taste gets questioned by the artistic Sinners.

111108.Info: A Sinner adept at dealing with Magic Damage and can block up to <color=#63b4c3>2</color> enemies at a time. During battle, Dove continues to collect and deliver [Letters]. Each Sinner can carry up to <color=#63b4c3>5</color> [Letters], and each of them increases the carrier's Magic Resistance by <color=#63b4c3>4%</color>. When the battle starts, Dove carries <color=#63b4c3>3</color> [Letters] and gains <color=#63b4c3>1</color> additional [Letter] every <color=#63b4c3>3</color> seconds.
