If the number of [Letters] carried by Dove reaches the limit, the newly acquired [Letters] will first be delivered to allied Sinners with the highest Attack who haven't reached their letter limit.
111108.Name: Dove
111108.Criminal Record 1:
A resident of Désir outside DisCity, the subject served as the town's mail carrier, a vital link of the social and information network. Hence she was suspected of ties to the de facto governor of the town.
Further investigation reveals no direct connection to the leader Vautour Bleu or her group. However, the subject's special power and trusted position allowed her to indirectly empower the said group's illicit activities while spreading Mania throughout the town. Immediate detention is recommended.
111108.Criminal Record 2: Interrogation reveals the subject's tragic past filled with traumatic events. Betrayed by fellow villagers and devastated by the loss of her parents, the subject became disillusioned with their ideal of "a messenger's sacred duty to foster genuine connections." She used her special power to forge letters to retaliate against the townspeople she viewed as "driven by desire" and insincere. Nonetheless, under Chief's guidance, she recognized her own lingering doubts as well as hopes, began to confront her past, and rediscovered her aspirations, finding her path anew.
111108.Ability Summary: Using envelopes as vessels, the subject can access memories of the addressers and manipulate their soul fragments to forge reply letters. In combat, she transforms accumulated letters into defensive barriers, cutting projectiles, or fiery attacks.
111108.Awakening Signs: The subject awakened her power during an encounter with a Corruptor and became infected with Mania. During the incident, she discovered that her parents had long deceased and all the letters she'd received had been fake. The severe emotional trauma triggered her descent into vengeance.
111108.Corruption State: The subject displays mild corruption with no visible mutations. Though lucid most of the time, she often develops radical ideas.
111108.Arrest Records 1: The subject was exposed as a Sinner during Chief's undercover operation in Désir and was confirmed to be abusing her special power. After Désir collapsed, she was apprehended by Chief and transferred to the Bureau for detention and investigation. The subject has been cooperative and on her best behavior since then.
111108.Arrest Records 2: The subject was born in an impoverished Outland village. A fragile child remaining homebound due to health conditions, she learns things only from the books and letters brought back by her parents, who were both mail carriers. She inherited their ideals of delivering genuine feelings and fostering human connections as a sacred duty.
111108.Arrest Records 3: Not seeing parents for long since their last delivery, the subject ventured out to search for them, only to discover they had long died. The letters she had been receiving were forged by the villagers lusting after the inheritance, even their names stained and dishonored all this time. The revelation caused her severe emotional trauma, devastating her beliefs.
111108.Arrest Records 4: Following her awakening of power, the subject began composing and delivering forged mail as her revenge against humanity, completely abandoning her previous code of ethics. Evidence indicates that her and her fellow villagers' coming to Désir was also driven by a forged invitation letter, possibly part of her broader revenge scheme.
111108.Performance 1: After arriving at the Bureau with her cherished bicycle, the subject was warmly invited to join the Cycling Club. Unaware that the club focused on competitive cycling, she participated in her first event with her slow and wobbly riding style, finishing last. Other members later collectively gifted her an indoor electric bicycle for use within the Bureau.
111108.Performance 2: Though the subject has always cherished reading, her isolated upbringing limited her access to books. At the Bureau, she has thrived in the new environment and become a regular visitor to the library. She soon discovered that the "DisCity Classics" series she had read in the past were in fact bootleg editions with significantly altered content, much to her shock.
111108.Performance 3: During her early days at the Bureau, the subject sought to build trust by delivering forged letters, inadvertently fostering numerous but shallow relationships. Only after rediscovering her true purpose and no longer relying on forged letters for emotional comfort did she begin forming true and genuine friendships.
111108.Performance 4: The subject handpicked a set of decorative stationery along with a fountain pen, ink, envelopes, handmade wax seals, and postal stamps as a gift, inviting Chief to share thoughts and book reviews through written letters. Likening it to keeping a shared diary more than making pen pals, Chief has gladly accepted her proposal.

111110.Info: A Sinner adept at distracting enemies. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Defense by <color=#63b4c3>5%</color>.
111110.Mania Intensify Text: When blocking 2 or more enemies, Energy Recovery Speed increases by <color=#63b4c3>20%</color>.
111110.Name: Luminita
111110.Criminal Record 1:
A young, streetwise real estate agent with extensive professional experience who has built a reputation in Eastside for specializing in selling cheap haunted properties.
Investigation confirms that all residential properties handled by the subject have been deliberately cleaned up and contain unusual residue of Mania, suggesting extended presence of Corruptors. Currently, the subject stands accused of harboring Corruptors and is under serious suspicion of spreading Mania. Immediate detention and thorough investigation are recommended.
111110.Criminal Record 2: Further investigation confirms that the suspect harbored Corruptors solely to fabricate supernatural phenomena in these haunted properties, with no intention of harming others. During her detention, under Chief's guidance, she has gradually let go of her obsession with houses and the concept of home, reflected on her past actions, and is now willing to consider the Bureau as somewhere she could return to. Following a risk reassessment, she has been granted parole and routinely returns to the Bureau for a short stay to report her updates.
111110.Ability Summary: The subject can imprison specific targets with her weapon, forbidding them from moving or attacking, causing them to gradually lose their strength.
111110.Awakening Signs: On a stormy night, wandering Corruptors accidentally invaded the subject's dilapidated dwelling. Under attack and on the verge of dying, her resolve to defend her home triggered the awakening of her ability, allowing her to imprison Corruptors.
111110.Corruption State: The subject displays only mild corruption with no visible physical abnormalities. She remains lucid most of the time and acts with clear purposes.
111110.Arrest Records 1: Following the Morveth Castle incident, after her identity as a Sinner was exposed, the subject followed Chief back to the Bureau to register her credentials and undergo relevant investigation. Throughout the process, she showed no resistance and remained compliant, but responded evasively when questioned about certain key information.
111110.Arrest Records 2: The subject is from Eastside. Her family struggled financially when she was young and she had to lie about her age to support herself, thus accumulating extensive experience in agency work from an early age. She claims that selling haunted properties is a way to make money, and in doing so she gets to fulfill the demand of a niche market while attracting thrill-seeking customers interested in touring such locations.
111110.Arrest Records 3: The subject lost both parents at an early age and was raised by her grandmother. Their only home was fraudulently seized and demolished by an unscrupulous real estate developer without any compensation, leaving her family homeless. Unable to afford Eastside's rising housing costs, she was forced to relocate frequently, constantly moving homes. The nomadic lifestyle proved too burdensome for her elderly grandmother, who eventually fell ill from exhaustion and passed away.
111110.Arrest Records 4: The experience of losing her childhood home and the death of her only family induced in the subject an unusual obsession with houses. In order to help others in Eastside in similar situations buy their own homes, she exploits the properties of Corruptors to fabricate supernatural phenomena, driving down the prices of these artificial *haunted houses*. When necessary, she would even go as far as harming herself to reach her goal.
111110.Performance 1: The subject eagerly expands her real estate business within the Bureau by tailoring sales pitches to fit her potential clients' specific circumstances. Rumor has it that she carries over a hundred keys in her trench coat and can match each to its corresponding property perfectly.
111110.Performance 2: Demonstrating remarkable talent and dedication in product marketing, the subject frequently helps out at the Supply Office and shares her experience with Faye. Through their collaborative efforts, sales figures of various products in the Bureau have seen substantial growth within a short period.
111110.Performance 3: As required by her job, the subject has consumed numerous horror books and films and is an excellent ghost story teller. She often gives certain squeamish Sinners nightmares with her tales, then proceeds to sell them her DIY protective talismans.
111110.Performance 4: Besides her *Eastside AAA-Tier Top Real Estate Agent* work social media account, the subject has even added Chief with her private account, which she uses to report every trivial matter and even sends promotional mass mails. After Chief threatened to block her, she finally held back her chat messages reluctantly for two days.

111201.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Increases lifesteal by <color=#63b4c3>5%</color>.
111201.Name: Ninety-Nine
111201.Criminal Record 1:
A well-known fighting fanatic in Syndicate who had long engaged in violent activities. When being hunted down, the subject resisted the MBCC by attempting assassination, kidnap, and assault, and is extremely dangerous.
Suspected to have colluded with an illegal Mania research institute in the past. The subject's special power and mental state are extremely unstable and may lead to catastrophic consequences if not strictly supervised.
111201.Criminal Record 2:
After the vehicle hijack incident, the subject has not displayed any manic tendency and her corruption has mostly stopped. With Chief's help and Hella's company and care, the subject's moods are now stable and she rarely demonstrates violent or dangerous behaviors.
The subject has adjusted to life in detention well. She's cooperative with investigation and is willing to take part in missions assigned by Chief. She often performs impressively in battles.
111201.Ability Summary: Having been exposed to prolonged stimulation by multiple unknown drugs, the subject has an abnormally high blood temperature as well as boosted destructive power and aggressiveness. After the Legion hired the subject, it equipped the subject with a massive special alloy sword to realize that shocking destructive power.
111201.Awakening Signs: It's been detected that the subject's body was modified and catalyzed by drugs early on. After the artificial awakening, continuous Mania-inducing experiments further accelerated the uncontrollable mutation.
111201.Corruption State: The unnatural awakening has taken a toll on Ninety-Nine, making her highly mentally unstable. Since her special power consumes a lot of energy, the subject has a much bigger appetite than ordinary people. The entire right arm displays physical signs of mutation resembling those found in Corruptors.
111201.Arrest Records 1: The subject used to work as a hired gun in Syndicate and made a series of assassination attempts targeting the Chief of the MBCC. The MBCC failed to capture the subject even after sacrificing a great deal. In the end, the subject turned herself in for some unknown reason.
111201.Arrest Records 2: The subject's early records have been purposely erased and are almost impossible to obtain, so both the subject's real name and origins are unknown. There are no social activity records for the early years of the subject. The subject was detained by the Laboratory of Parma for years to be used in human experiments in which the subject's blood was taken to enhance Mania Weapons.
111201.Arrest Records 3: Experimental subject number ninety-nine in the Laboratory of Parma, the subject escaped from the lab with Hella's help and severely damaged the lab during the process. After gaining freedom, the subject lived with Hella in Syndicate.
111201.Arrest Records 4: Having been separated from Hella, the subject was hired by the Legion in the West District and made a living by engaging in various illegal violent activities. Later, in hope of finding her best friend, the subject actively took part in all sorts of revenge missions in Syndicate targeting the power behind Parma.
111201.Performance 1: Fighting alongside certain powerful Sinners seems to have induced a sense of self-preservation in her, as the subject has begun requesting more intense training. If the requests are turned down, the subject will protest strongly.
111201.Performance 2: The subject lacks basic life skills and is terrible at all daily tasks such as cooking and cleaning. Failing in doing chores may even trigger the subject's quick temper and result in the destruction of surrounding facilities, therefore special supervision is needed.
111201.Performance 3: Surveillance footage shows that the subject is often seen together with Hella and rarely interacts with other Sinners. When Hella is present, the subject is significantly less irritable and may even seem calm and peaceful at times.
111201.Performance 4:
Influenced by Hella, the subject's hostility toward Chief has greatly lessened. Once, the subject even initiated a conversation with Chief to ask for larger food portions.
"I can't fight on an empty stomach."

111202.Info: A Sinner adept at fighting flocks of enemies. Max HP increases by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> and Damage increases by <color=#63b4c3>5%</color>.
111202.Mania Intensify Text: Damage dealt to enemies without Cores is increased by <color=#63b4c3>20%</color>.
111202.Name: Wendy
111202.Criminal Record 1:
The rumored chainsaw-wielding lunatic lingering along the banks of the Rust. The subject often wandered aimlessly with a chainsaw and has committed dozens of assaults. Highly aggressive and almost unable to interact with others. The unpredictable behavior and chilling laughter have incited terror among the DisCity civilians.
Relevant information has clearly been purposefully erased and the identity is highly suspicious.
111202.Criminal Record 2:
It's now been confirmed that a government-owned secret squad in charge of contamination purification existed several years ago. As a member of the squad, the subject accidentally discovered the secret deal between her captain and Syndican government officials. This greatly shook her beliefs and the rage awakened her special power.
The Syndican government later dismissed her and erased records of the squad. Having been exiled to the Rust, the subject still performs her long-lifted cleaning duties and fights against Corruptors and monsters with her chainsaw.
111202.Ability Summary: Able to further enhance the equipped chainsaw with the ability, granting it even more dangerous destructive power. Rumor has it that the subject's special power can convert any weapon in hand into a chainsaw of the same size, but this saying is still to be verified.
111202.Awakening Signs: The source of contamination is deduced to be the large number of Corruptor remains in the Rust. The subject had been in close contact with the contamination in the Rust and a mental shock triggered the awakening after a long incubation period of years.
111202.Corruption State: The corruption level is high. Out of all the symptoms, the mental damage is the most severe. She goes into an uncontrollable frenzy when exposed to certain stimulation.
111202.Arrest Records 1: During the investigation of a Mania Weapon deal, the subject was spotted at the scene of a raw material transaction. The subject was arrested after her Sinner identity was confirmed. Appearing furious and difficult to subdue, the subject was injected with a huge dose of sedative and then successfully captured.
111202.Arrest Records 2: Abandoned as an infant by the Rust. The subject's biological parents' identities can no longer be determined. Survived miraculously amid Corruptor remains. With an unknown infection level, the subject was rejected by all orphanages and taken in by the cleanup unit that had saved the subject.
111202.Arrest Records 3: Lived with the unit since being adopted and is believed to have engaged in high-risk work involving direct contact with Corruptor contamination. Detailed information about the unit has been erased and query access to relevant information is limited.
111202.Arrest Records 4: The subject has been part of the *Undertakers* team and buried dozens of teammates during that period. The former team leader betrayed the team by engaging in Corruptor smuggling and was purged by the subject when the truth was exposed. Afterward, the Undertakers went out of control under the subject's leadership. The team was expelled by the FAC and all of their achievements and records were erased.
111202.Performance 1: The subject has demonstrated impressive skills and experience on several Corruptor cleanup missions, but hasn't been able to calm down after the battles, remaining in a delirious state for a long period and only regaining sanity with the help of psychiatric medication. After taking the medicine, the subject would stare in the direction of the Rust with a blank expression.
111202.Performance 2: Will avoid touching the bloodstains on the blade when maintaining the chainsaw. According to the subject, these old bloodstains have an important meaning, so even though they've made the blade all rusty, the subject refuses to replace it.
111202.Performance 3: The subject has a fragmented and chaotic speech pattern and a capricious mind that are difficult to make sense of. But during a few exchanges, the subject has addressed other Sinners by the names of the late teammates, possibly a way of expressing the subject's trust and sense of belonging for MBCC.
111202.Performance 4: A doodle was found in the subject's room on which a crooked and abstractly shaped double grave is drawn, with the subject and Chief's names written on the headstone.

111203.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal multiple Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111203.Mania Intensify Text: Enemies within a radiation field move <color=#63b4c3>20%</color> slower.
111203.Name: Pacassi
111203.Criminal Record 1: A carrier of new energy from a distant foreign country. Storing an excessive amount of nuclear energy in the body, the subject frequently emits dangerous radiation and has a record of annihilating the entire town of Mayek. The subject feels no sense of belonging for the DisCity and so the risks of the subject leaking classified information and betraying or attacking the DisCity cannot be ruled out. The subject must be isolated and strictly controlled to minimize the destructive threat to society.
111203.Criminal Record 2:
Investigation reveals that the disaster in Mayek was not caused by the subject but an inhabitant who insisted on relaunching the damaged nuclear power plant. The subject has also revealed during interrogation that her only wish is to pass on her memories of Mayek. It's therefore believed that she's highly unlikely to leak the confidential information.
The subject has demonstrated outstanding control over her special power in actual combats. She's now virtually harmless in MBCC's detention.
111203.Ability Summary: With massive nuclear energy stored in the body, the subject can shoot fatal dosages of radioactive substances at will. Powered by nuclear energy, the mechanical right arm can be used as an invincible weapon.
111203.Awakening Signs: During a destructive nuclear reactor disaster two years ago, the subject was exposed to an excessive amount of radiation which awakened her special power.
111203.Corruption State: The subject has only been infected not long ago and no apparent corruption symptoms have been detected. The occasional full-body aches and mucous membrane bleeding are believed to be the side effects of exposure to massive nuclear radiation.
111203.Arrest Records 1: During a search mission in reaction to an abnormal energy reading in the Mayek region, the subject was rescued from under the rubble and transferred to the MBCC for supervision.
111203.Arrest Records 2: Rescued and sheltered in DisCity after a nuclear reactor disaster at thirteen and had previously lived in the town of Mayek. Records show that the subject's parents emigrated years ago, but their exact current location was unknown and the subject appeared to have been adopted by Mayek.
111203.Arrest Records 3: The subject has extensive knowledge of machinery operation and is an expert at repairing and creating various intricate machinery and electrical devices. It's believed that the subject has years of relevant working experience as an assistant.
111203.Arrest Records 4: Assisted the town mayor Longyear in the repairs of Mayek's nuclear power plant. The construction resulted in a total failure due to Longyear's forceful launch of the power plant. The hydrogen explosion caused by the failure was the main factor that led to the nuclear energy build-up in the town and its eventual destruction.
111203.Performance 1: Usually highly cooperative in all physical examinations, will agree to different sorts of investigation requests unconditionally, and able to give objective updates on own radiation sickness. Only shows reluctance to a few specific items such as close examinations and MRI scans.
111203.Performance 2: The mechanical arm is tightly merged with flesh and difficult to replace, thus requiring regular care by a specialist doctor. The subject has requested reference books about mechanical medicine several times and expressed the wish to do self-study on the subject, unwilling to bother others.
111203.Performance 3: Many Sinners are highly interested in the so-called *walking nuclear pollution* and have requested to observe the subject at close range despite the potential danger. The subject is obviously perturbed by this, but no longer objects as strongly as she did during the early days in the shelter.
111203.Performance 4: The subject is an avid reader and learner. Recently, after browsing all the books available in the Bureau, the subject has initiated a creative project in which she continuously notes down the past events and memories from her hometown. The compiled manuscripts are handed to Chief for safekeeping.

111204.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111204.Name: Dolly
111204.Criminal Record 1:
The only suspect who caused the riot at Eastside Baseball League. Permanently banned for competing and boycotted by the entire baseball world due to causing malicious harm to people at the game.
The subject is classified as a dangerous Sinner as the subject is suspected of fabricating identity, hiding special powers, being involved with the dangerous organization "The Homeless," and acting recklessly.
111204.Criminal Record 2:
The subject has not gone manic or out of control since detention. Interrogation reveals that she once competed in matches as a local Syndican baseball team member and attempted to train in Eastside, but was rejected due to the friction between the two cities. The subject thus had to seek aid from the Homeless, but her special power awakened in an accident during her trip to Eastside. She then lost control of her power and hurt someone.
Since her recapture after the escape, her behavior has improved under Chief's supervision. She currently has fairly good control over her power.
111204.Ability Summary: Special powers are triggered by emotional excitement or swinging the bat multiple times, which can greatly enhance Dolly's power and relieves her pain.
111204.Awakening Signs: Awakened when besieged by Corruptors at the Rust under the strong desire and instinct to survive.
111204.Corruption State: Severe erosion and mental state strongly affected by Mania. Mania symptoms are out-of-control emotions and unconscious destructive impulses.
111204.Arrest Records 1: After escaping from the MBCC riot and returning to Syndicate, the subject worked as a fighter in various gangs. Accidentally met the MBCC troops on a mission and was arrested after the identity as a Sinner at large was exposed.
111204.Arrest Records 2: Passionate about baseball since young, but due to the lack of sporting events in Syndicate, the subject did not receive much support for her passion from family and friends. Dreaming for the Eastside and Eastside Baseball League, she fabricated her identity with the help of "the Homeless" and sneaked into Eastside.
111204.Arrest Records 3: Before the Eastside baseball game started, the subject's identity as a Syndican was exposed and received many criticisms, which seriously intensified the Mania symptoms. During the game, the subject's emotions eventually went out of control and seriously injured the opponents. The subject was sent off.
111204.Arrest Records 4: Dolly refused to get off the field and made a scene with her special powers. All the players and referees were injured, and even some innocent spectators. The situation was only under control when the FAC arrived.
111204.Performance 1: Has a strong attachment to bats. Claims to have a wall of baseball bat collections. Each was personally designed and had individual names and stories.
111204.Performance 2: Always chews a piece of bubble gum before each game. The noise when the bubble bursts can relieve Dolly's destructive urge and calm her down. This same habit continues before going into battle.
111204.Performance 3: When practicing her swing, the subject would take off the baseball cap and tie her hair up into a ponytail. Got outraged many times when not recognized by other Sinners. Due to Dolly's height, the concerned Sinners claimed it's understandable that they only remembered the hat.
111204.Performance 4: Always drags Chief along to watch the important Eastside baseball games and often accidentally injures Chief because of the over-excitement. Often claims to "have no idea" about the bruises on Chief.

111205.Info: A Sinner adept at both offense and defense. Increases Max HP by <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> and Ultimates can deal Core Damage.
111205.Name: Horo
111205.Criminal Record 1: One of the most important combatants of Syndicate's largest gang, the West District Legion. She was involved in many violent incidents with Zoya and Earl. She is suspected to be connected with other dangerous and mysterious factions. Irritable and belligerent, she presents a major threat to Syndicate's social stability.
111205.Criminal Record 2:
The subject is naturally combative and often gets into trouble. After the great riot, she became even more violent under the Deus Corpus's control. Fortunately, since the Square Black Ring incident, her moods and character have undergone certain changes. She's become significantly less aggressive and more stable and she has a firmer grasp over her power.
Her leadership has grown more prominent ever since she took part in the mission against the Public Security Bureau remnants' attack on the Legion. The Bureau currently trains her specifically in that aspect.
111205.Ability Summary: Making use of the Battle Mark on her arm to wield her heavy battleaxe, her destructive capabilities are not to be underestimated. The Battle Mark grows in strength given the right circumstances, further enhancing her combat abilities. With such a heavy weapon, her attacks are relatively slow.
111205.Awakening Signs: Horo claims to have overcome the Mania Weapon's corruption through sheer strength of will, awakening as a Sinner. Her claim has been corroborated multiple times, and is considered legitimate.
111205.Corruption State: Issues with her height make her short-tempered, manifesting in changes to her Battle Mark pattern due to her special powers. Her psychological evaluation, however, comes out clean. More observation is required to determine the extent of her corruption.
111205.Arrest Records 1: Fell prey to a scavenger trap and was captured by sheriffs. Caught a lucky escape during the MBCC riot. Whereabouts were unknown for a time. Returned to the Legion, and was recaptured by Chief.
111205.Arrest Records 2: The Public Security Bureau attacked the Legion despite the risk just to find the subject, who overheard the conversation between the Public Security Bureau and Parma when they were trading Mania weapons. According to the subject, her brother Earl has been collecting intel on the Legion's enemies. It is very likely that he has more specific information.
111205.Arrest Records 3: Born in Syndicate and growing up with her brother Earl, she lost her parents shortly after her birth in an accident where gangsters ambushed her parents' convoy. Her brother helped raise her, which created a strong bond between them.
111205.Arrest Records 4: Nirvana Convoy got into a conflict against the gangsters. To protect her, the subject's brother Earl was injured and disabled. It is because of that same event that Earl awakened as a Sinner. In the incident at the Square, Earl sacrificed himself as a Corpseborne to save Zoya.
111205.Performance 1: Only drinks milk, and is obsessed with the idea that "drinking milk can make you grow taller". Since she has missed adolescence by a clear margin, the effects of dairy are negligible.
111205.Performance 2: Window-shops at kawaii-style fashion shops often. Horo claims that the style contradicts the Legion's dress code, and forces herself to walk away. To our knowledge, the Legion does not enforce a dress code.
111205.Performance 3: Whenever the word "Zoya" is spoken in MBCC, Horo will always appear in a 10-meter radius, watching silently. If a Sinner is discovered to be speaking ill of Zoya, she will leap from the shadows and duel for her honor.
111205.Performance 4: Horo has held a grand ceremony in the Bureau, giving Chief a medal engraved with "Zoya & Horo's Best Friend". According to her, the medal can be used to command any member of the Legion, at any time.

111206.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111206.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111206.Name: Mess
111206.Criminal Record 1: One of the top weapon makers and repairers in Eastside, where she owns an independent forge and an independent store. Over the years, she has been inciting her customers to do evil by offering them discounts, indirectly causing many violent attack cases.
111206.Criminal Record 2: Since her admission to the MBCC, the subject has been repeatedly consulting the psychologist in the Bureau. Her file reveals that although her power enables her to forge weapons with human malice, the subject herself has demonstrated a pathological fear of the malice and is often troubled by nightmares. Her previous abnormal behaviors should be attributed to her severe chronic mental illness. She likely requires further consultation and treatment.
111206.Ability Summary: The subject's power allows her to collect malevolent energies and turn them into tangible objects, which she then uses to forge powerful weapons.
111206.Awakening Signs: The subject awakened her power when she was severely traumatized at a young age in the [Data Deleted] Incident. According to the subject herself, what she's been doing all these years is to prepare for forging a "deity slaying weapon" and use it to "cut away my nightmares and fears."
111206.Corruption State: The subject's mental health is on shaky ground, and her moral compass diverges greatly from those of normal people. Her mental status must be monitored closely to preempt any sudden change in her condition.
111206.Arrest Records 1: The subject's identity as a Sinner is exposed in the [Data Deleted] Incident. She is later apprehended by the MBCC in her workshop, but not before she makes a futile attempt to incite the MBCC staffers to fight each other.
111206.Arrest Records 2: The subject originally comes from Syndicate, of unknown parentage. She is now living in Eastside, on a sound financial footing. On a commercial street in central Eastside, she owns an independent forge and an independent store, the two places where she spends most of her time.
111206.Arrest Records 3: Mess adores Eastside's pop culture, splurging on ornaments, cosmetics, clothing, and Phantom Entertainment dolls.
111206.Arrest Records 4: Has been selling weapons she makes to mercenaries, weapon collectors, and others since N.F. 110. She sells a wide range of weapons, from firearms to cold weapons. High-performance and stylish, her weapons are much sought-after, with their prices going higher and higher. Later in her career, Mess also started inciting her customers to cause harm in exchange for a remission of service fees. At the time of her capture, more than twenty people have been injured or died as an indirect result of her actions.
111206.Performance 1: Mess is usually more than willing to take on commissions from the MBCC for weapons. "I'm sure they will be used in battles, so I'm not gonna charge you," Mess once said.
111206.Performance 2: Mess frequently asks the Supply Office to purchase the latest dolls, clothes, and ornaments on her behalf. These purchases soon end up in her furnace when she loses interest in them.
111206.Performance 3: Mess enjoys driving wedges between the other Sinners and encouraging them to fight each other. So far, thirteen fights have taken place as a direct result of her meddling. Contact between Mess and the other Sinners should be prohibited, unless it's absolutely necessary.
111206.Performance 4: Recently, Mess has taken a keen interest in Chief, going to extraordinary lengths to encourage Chief to hurt other people, but to no avail. Mess has also been secretly providing weapons for those Sinners who harbor hatred, saying, "I've got your back. Just go out there and raise hell; I'll provide you with weapons."

111207.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111207.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111207.Name: Corso
111207.Criminal Record 1: A fighting ring favorite who has long been taking part in underground matches. Has a history of disturbing public order, violating rules in combat, and starting brawls. The subject is extremely aggressive and uncontrollable. Immediate detainment recommended.
111207.Criminal Record 2: The subject had been a competitive fighter in the underground fighting world. Boasting a fierce and cut-throat personality, she exhibits an usually strong thirst for combat, and has a history of arrest for inciting unrest while fighting in the ring. Thanks to Chief's patient efforts, her impulsive personality has changed for the better. Now, she is willing to follow the MBCC's orders and actively complete dispatch missions. By channeling her power and energy to positive things, she is gradually getting on the right track.
111207.Ability Summary: She can radically increase the power of any physical substance at hand. When used well in battle, her power can deal huge damage at a tiny cost.
111207.Awakening Signs: The subject got infected after coming into contact with large amounts of Mania weapons in the underground fighting ring. Her power awakened during a critical moment in a fighting match, saving her life.
111207.Corruption State: There are currently no traces of bodily corruption. However, from our observations, the subject exhibits an abnormally strong desire to fight as well as mental instability, which are all symptoms typical of Mania.
111207.Arrest Records 1: The subject had been active in Syndicate's various fighting arenas. She openly flaunts her Sinner identity, impacting competition fairness and triggering unrest. The subject was eventually subdued by local sheriffs and handed over to the MBCC.
111207.Arrest Records 2: As a child, the subject was homeless and roamed Syndicate before getting taken in by a dog pound, where she ate and lived with the dogs. She was later expelled from the pound after getting into a fight with some competitive fighters. This spurred her to join the underground fighting industry.
111207.Arrest Records 3: Small in stature, the subject lacks the strength of other fighters, so she wins her fights with clever tricks. However, her tricksy fighting style is widely despised. Many think it goes against the long-held Syndicate tradition of valuing sheer strength, and thus reject her.
111207.Arrest Records 4: The subject skyrocketed to fame after using her Sinner power to win a major competition, becoming a fan favorite in the underground fighting world. However, many arenas shut down after Zoya destroyed the gangs. The subject went back to living in the streets, and later joined Rustfire.
111207.Performance 1: The subject is passionate about any combat mission, and will even request extra tasks. When she fails to exhaust her energy, she'll challenge other Sinners to fight, but there is rarely anyone willing to accept her challenge. Everyone basically responds by giving her their own assignment.
111207.Performance 2: The subject regards make-up as "combat gear" and asks the Supply Office to procure all kinds of make-up for her. According to her, flamboyant makeup is a must-have in battle, as it is an effective way to intimidate and deter opponents.
111207.Performance 3: The subject loves to craft weapons and props. She sometimes takes her creations to chat with Sinner Mess, whom she praises as "very insightful." The subject likes to use garbage found around the Bureau as crafting materials, and sometimes even goes out scavenging with Sinner Demolia.
111207.Performance 4: The subject once handed Chief a huge sum of money and explained it was prize money earned from a fighting match she joined while out on dispatch. She generously declared that she'll hand over all future prize money if the Bureau turned a blind eye to such disciplinary violations. After accepting the money, Chief tightened disciplinary measures for Sinners out on dispatch.

111208.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111208.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111208.Name: Christina
111208.Criminal Record 1:
Currently the Acting Inspector of the Eastside Public Security Bureau, she is also the most troublesome staff member there. She applied four times but was rejected each time, and was finally admitted with her uncle's recommendation.
She has an almost obsessive desire for "justice" and her mental state is unstable. She frequently resorts to violence to solve cases. Her behavior is quite unpredictable. Detainment is advised.
111208.Criminal Record 2: Naturally cheerful and optimistic, the subject's unstable mental condition stems from two major incidents: her parents' deaths and the discovery of Shalom's true identity. After being detained by the MBCC, she demonstrated good and helpful behavior without any violations, earning unanimous praise from the Bureau. Under the guidance and company of Chief, she still firmly believes in and pursues justice, but her stubbornness has softened, and she rarely experiences emotional breakdowns or loss of control.
111208.Ability Summary: When she knows she's carrying out "justice," her combat power increases proportionally to the degree of justice. Moreover, she must firmly believe in her own sense of justice, otherwise she will suffer a backlash from her power and fall into depression. Her preferred weapons include a special Detective File reinforced with metal, and a special cane embedded with a small amount of Hypercubes and rare metals. These weapons are highly destructive when used alongside her power.
111208.Awakening Signs: The subject's emotions became extremely unstable after learning of her parents' death. She obsessively compiled relevant evidence and events to uncover the truth and avenge them. After discovering part of what she believed to be the truth, she lost control of her emotions and her power awakened.
111208.Corruption State: Her degree of corruption is mild, and there are no visible lesions on her body. Though she usually appears lively and cheerful, her mental state is unstable. She breaks down and succumbs to self-blame when she cannot achieve justice or is not needed by others.
111208.Arrest Records 1: The subject voluntarily came to the MBCC's doorstep and revealed her identity as a Sinner to Chief. She let the Bureau detain her and actively cooperated with the investigation.
111208.Arrest Records 2: The subject hails from a military family in Eastside. Both her parents served in the FAC and were killed on duty in N.F. 103. She was later adopted by her aunt's family, who also worked for the FAC. However, her inner turmoil never settled, leading her to obsessively compile relevant evidence and events to uncover the truth behind her parents' deaths and avenge them.
111208.Arrest Records 3: The subject has known her younger cousin Mireya since childhood, but they often clashed and didn't have a smooth relationship. It wasn't until the Garden assassination case in N.F. 112, when her uncle was killed, that Mireya truly understood and acknowledged her. Their relationship greatly improved afterwards.
111208.Arrest Records 4: At the lowest point in her life, the subject learned how to use her power. With the help and encouragement of HUSH (Shalom), she embarked on a path of seeking justice. However, she was then traumatized by discovering Shalom's true identity, and became determined to prove her sense of justice to her.
111208.Performance 1: The luggage she brought with her when she joined the MBCC included a large collection of detective novels, which she continues to add to. The subject is intimately familiar with crime fiction, and has offered many valuable suggestions for mystery-themed films for the Recreation Area's movie nights.
111208.Performance 2: The subject maintains a positive attitude towards life, taking her daily training and dispatch assignments seriously and always striving to complete them to the best of her ability. Although she often causes equipment wear and tear due to poor control of her strength, she still sets a good example for the other Sinners.
111208.Performance 3: The subject is outgoing and can strike up a pleasant conversation with anyone. She's well-liked within the Bureau, and her positive influence has impacted many Sinners who were originally introverted and melancholic. Additionally, she's known for being always ready to help, and is enthusiastic in helping both Sinners and Bureau staff with life and work problems without expecting anything in return.
111208.Performance 4: Despite being at the MBCC, the subject has never slackened in her duties and work as the Acting Inspector. She voluntarily uses her downtime to read and organize case files sent by the Public Security Bureau, dragging along Chief, whom she refers to as her "assistant," to work on cases outside.

111209.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111209.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111209.Name: Rise
111209.Criminal Record 1: The subject studied at a prestigious Eastside academy and later interned at Nirvana. She is the sole survivor of the mysterious attack on Nirvana. Investigations reveal that during her internship, she had many conflicts with the victims and also exhibited violent tendencies, making her a suspect in this case. Given the case's severe social impact, she should be immediately detained and investigated.
111209.Criminal Record 2: Investigations show that the subject accumulated excessive stress from longtime workplace bullying, leading to her destructive outburst and awakening as a Sinner. Since being detained by the MBCC, various indicators show that her stress levels have gone down. She is currently behaving well and promoting reforms to the Bureau's work environment with the Chief's backing.
111209.Ability Summary: The subject can extract data from herself or the internet to create weapons. The lightsaber is her most frequently used weapon, and can cause significant physical damage in a short period of time.
111209.Awakening Signs: After repeatedly witnessing and experiencing workplace bullying, the subject lost control of her emotions from the accumulated stress and awakened her Sinner power in a fit of rage.
111209.Corruption State: Her corruption level is mild, but when the subject experiences intense emotional fluctuations or activates her power, digitalized mutations appear on her skin.
111209.Arrest Records 1: After leaving Nirvana, the subject was invited by the Chief to join the MBCC. During her interview, she revealed her identity as a Sinner and was detained.
111209.Arrest Records 2: While interning at Nirvana, the subject demonstrated excellent work abilities. However, due to her pursuit of efficiency and unfiltered communication style, she often openly pointed out her superiors' mistakes, leading them to treat her badly in return.
111209.Arrest Records 3: The subject is exceptionally averse to exploitation and injustice at the workplace, leading to a buildup of unresolved pressure. She can only rely on playing squash to vent her anger and frustrations.
111209.Arrest Records 4: The sci-fi novel "Legend of the Star Realm" was the subject's favorite during her youth, and its protagonist Anniken greatly influenced her worldview. The image of Anniken wielding a lightsaber to fight evil and uphold justice left a profound impression on her. Thus, her power also manifests in the form of a "lightsaber."
111209.Performance 1: After joining the MBCC, the subject demonstrated outstanding efficiency at work, completing tasks with astonishing speed and execution. However, she burns through the Bureau's budget by causing additional public damage from time to time. She says that she will try to avoid this in the future.
111209.Performance 2: The subject has a strong sense of time and strictly adheres to her daily schedule. When the Bureau's time-reporting system was seven seconds out of sync, it was the ever-punctual Rise who was the first to notice.
111209.Performance 3: The subject draws a clear line between her work and private life. While maintaining collegial relationships with most Sinners, she does not pursue excessive socialization outside of work. However, she does befriend Sinners sharing similar interests. For example, someone once saw her discussing the implementation of the "DisCity Labor Ordinance" with Mr. Fox.
111209.Performance 4: The subject is dedicated to ensuring normal working hours for MBCC employees, and demands a corresponding increase in overtime pay. She has repeatedly suggested submitting a joint letter of protest to uphold everyone's legal rights. Rumor has it that the Chief was the first to sign this letter.

111210.Info: A Sinner adept at counterattacking. Upon entry into the battle, Mira gains Taunt and takes <color=#63b4c3>15%</color> less damage.
111210.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111210.Name: Mira
111210.Criminal Record 1:
The subject is a resident of the WhiteSands town of Tuco and runs a motel that serves traveling merchants and caravans.
While her motel appears to be a normal operating business, it has been linked to multiple merchant disappearances in WhiteSands. Immediate intervention and detention of the subject are recommended.
111210.Criminal Record 2:
The harsh desert environment and limited resources meant the subject's "cons" were often more of a means of survival than an intended crime. While she prioritizes her interests, she still abides by her own moral compass.
Under Chief's supervision, the subject now lives in harmony with other Sinners and staff at the MBCC, strictly adhering to the Bureau's regulations so far.
111210.Ability Summary:
When her special power is activated, the subject's strength, reflexes, attack speed, and attack frequency are greatly enhanced.
Her weapon is a pair of elegant custom brass knuckles she wears constantly, disguised as jewelry.
111210.Awakening Signs: When the subject was young, her family fell victim to desert bandits' robbery. While trapped at the bandits' hideout, she managed to escape with her parents' help. During the escape, the subject collapsed from exhaustion, and in her dying moments, she awakened her ability and survived narrowly.
111210.Corruption State: Her corruption level is mild, with no visible physical abnormalities. Her mental state remains stable most of the time.
111210.Arrest Records 1: During the investigation into a Hypercube smuggling case, Chief came to Tuco while tracing suspects and met the motel owner Mira, who is the subject in question.
111210.Arrest Records 2:
The subject's motel operates as both a diner and a tavern, and the only rule there is that no fighting is allowed within her territory.
Despite her youth, she handles matters with remarkable thoroughness, effortlessly managing various emergencies. Such competence is one reason why visitors lower their guard.
111210.Arrest Records 3:
When the subject was young, her parents attempted to smuggle their whole family into DisCity to escape the desert bandits, but were deceived by a bandit gang and lured to their hideout to be robbed. The subject escaped with her parents' help and returned to Tuco.
Later, she led the townspeople to rescue her parents from the bandits' hideout, only to find the gang had fled. Having missed prompt medical attention, her severely injured parents eventually fell into a vegetative state.
111210.Arrest Records 4:
After the incident with her parents, the subject renovated her family motel, adding secret passages and traps. She began collaborating with the townspeople to tackle the trouble-seeking bandits, meanwhile getting ready for her own revenge.
Two years later, when the bandit gang that had injured her parents returned to raid the town, the subject finally executed her plan, capturing the entire gang and getting her revenge.
111210.Performance 1: Despite her desert origins, the subject has adapted well to life at the MBCC. A natural in handling interpersonal relationships, she's quickly become a highly popular figure in the Bureau who's adored by almost everyone.
111210.Performance 2: The subject's room has a distinct charm, decorated with numerous ornaments and trinkets rarely seen in DisCity. While the room is always kept immaculately clean and tidy, harmless but tricky traps are sometimes hidden there, so entering unaccompanied by the subject could result in minor accidents.
111210.Performance 3: The subject is an accomplished cook, with her signature cactus pick-me-up and desert lamb chops being the MBCC's favorites. Now exposed to many previously unknown ingredients in DisCity, she is experimenting with fusion cuisine.
111210.Performance 4: Since joining the MBCC, the subject has talked about her hometown's traditional bonfire festivities and invited Chief many times. Chief appears quite interested in this proposal and has begun planning a vacation.

111212.Info: A Sinner adept at repair. Attack <color=#63b4c3>+5%</color>.
111212.Mania Intensify Text: Core Damage from Ultimate increased by <color=#63b4c3>1</color>
111212.Name: Lysandra
111212.Criminal Record 1:
A tomb raider who primarily operates in the WhiteSands region, frequenting caves and burial chambers in the area.
Investigation units have discovered Mania-contaminated artifacts circulating in the market. All such items have been found to be linked to the subject. The subject is suspected of spreading Mania and causing significant harm to society. Detention and supervision are thus recommended.
111212.Criminal Record 2: Investigation confirms that the subject began her illegal activities after being coerced into theft as a child. She has no attachment to her past and does not intend to go back to that life since entering the Bureau. She has adapted well to the Bureau's rules, keeps a healthy daily routine, and has shown significant improvement in her social abilities.
111212.Ability Summary: She can enhance both her own and others' weapons, increasing their power and durability. Additionally, weapons enhanced by her manifest special properties.
111212.Awakening Signs: She once served as a scout for a bandit gang and frequently ventured into tombs. She became infected with residual Mania within the ruins and awakened her abilities.
111212.Corruption State: She displays mild corruption with no physical abnormalities. She remains lucid most of the time.
111212.Arrest Records 1: She encountered MBCC operatives by accident while exploring a tomb alone in WhiteSands. Her identity as a Sinner was exposed, leading to her immediate arrest.
111212.Arrest Records 2: She was born on the outskirts of DisCity. As an orphan, she was taken in by a bandit gang and forced to enter tombs as an expendable scout from an early age. During this period, she was repeatedly betrayed by her playmates, gradually losing her ability to trust others.
111212.Arrest Records 3: Her special power awakened during an operation, after which all members of her bandit gang disappeared. This incident is suspected to be linked to the subject. Ever since then, she began living and traveling in WhiteSands alone. Although she occasionally assembled teams for tomb explorations, her lack of trust in others prevented her from having any fixed crews.
111212.Arrest Records 4: Due to her past experiences and prolonged isolation from society, she is emotionally detached and extremely rational. She is unable to comprehend others' emotions, beliefs, or faiths. She harbors intense distrust toward others, accompanied by a strong need for control and extreme aversion to accidents and variable factors.
111212.Performance 1: She is passionate about extreme sports. The regular exercise equipment at the Bureau fails to satisfy her adrenaline addiction. Following her request, the logistics staff have installed rock climbing and small parkour facilities in the exercise area for her use.
111212.Performance 2: Her interest in repairing and modifying mechanical devices has led to friendships with certain Sinners such as Summer and Eureka. Their group frequently gathers to tamper with facilities within the Bureau, occasionally causing damage. They have been reprimanded and forbidden from making further *enhancement* to public facilities.
111212.Performance 3: She rarely initiates interactions with others at the Bureau, and consequently seldom enters into conflicts. However, tensions may arise when she works with Sinners who hold strong beliefs or display more capricious thinking patterns. The subject's poor communication skills occasionally cause these tensions to escalate.
111212.Performance 4: After living at the Bureau for some time, she has inevitably engaged in numerous interactions with other Sinners. During this process, she frequently has trouble communicating with them and often turns to Chief for assistance. Although she struggles to express her true thoughts, Chief always seems able to understand her intentions and express them on her behalf.

111301.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111301.Mania Intensify Text: Upon dealing Core Damage, all allied Sinners gain <color=#63b4c3>15%</color> Physical Penetration for <color=#63b4c3>10</color> seconds.
111301.Name: Iron
111301.Criminal Record 1: The SALVA Hospital is the only shelter and medical help provider in Syndicate, but it is also feared because of the rumors of its unauthorized neuromodulation. The subject is found to abuse special power to harbor, gather Mania patients, hide the identity of a Sinner, which disregards the MBCC laws and regulations and bring Syndicate high contamination risk. Immediate arrest and confinement is recommended.
111301.Criminal Record 2:
When she ran her own clinic, the subject applied radical treatments on Mania patients. The treatments did not receive a medical ethic rating but have indeed proved considerably effective.
After joining the MBCC, the subject seems to have become less obsessed with such high-risk treatments and now focuses on treating injured patients with her excellent surgical skills instead. With her reliable and highly effective medical expertise, she receives unanimous praise from all staff and Sinners for her services in the Bureau.
111301.Ability Summary: Able to control the neuro currents precisely and integrates the mechanical arm with the nerves to achieve sophisticated and powerful combat effects.
111301.Awakening Signs: Awakened at the late Mania stage. Speculated to have taken extreme measures to suppress the spread of contamination and became a Sinner after successfully stopped any further increase in the M value.
111301.Corruption State: Examination found severe erosion and a small skin patch of Corrupt-like mutation spots. But the subject's mental state is found normal and even more rational than normal people. The reason for the contradiction in the test results is unknown.
111301.Arrest Records 1: The MBCC sent troops to SALVA after suppressing the Syndicate incident. The arrest was difficult and only succeeded after a bloody battle. Fortunately, the subject was merciful, and no one was sacrificed.
111301.Arrest Records 2: Born in a prestigious family of healthcare professionals in Eastside, the subject has a father who is a famous doctor. As a "genius neurosurgeon" who graduated from Banyan Medical College, the subject refused the invitations from all the major hospitals in Eastside and insisted on going to Syndicate to heal Mania.
111301.Arrest Records 3: When the subject first arrived at Syndicate, Zoya extended a lucrative offer and invited the subject to join the Legion. Yet, the subject didn't identify with Zoya's idea of fighting violence with violence, and turned down the offer. The subject then founded SALVA, the only neutral organization, and handpicked talents to fight alongside for the same cause.
111301.Arrest Records 4: Affected and tortured by Mania, Iron ran into Anne, a nurse in Eastside who had come to ask for help. To remain calm and heal the patient Anne had brought to her, Iron decided to chop off her own left arm to prevent the marking from spreading to her heart, and to use the pain to keep her awake. After that event, the subject became a Sinner.
111301.Performance 1: Despite frequently nagging patients to have a healthy diet and lifestyle, Iron lives a very unhealthy lifestyle and often stays up late and even all night to study new medical treatments. Her diet is often time-saving fast food.
111301.Performance 2: The experience in stitching wounds makes Iron excellent at embroidery, which is the only household skill she is good at. She can "just about look after herself" in life outside the operating room.
111301.Performance 3: In the face of the worsening Mania crisis in DisCity, the subject cannot bear to see any idlers in the MBCC. Any slackers would be severely reprimanded and dragged to help with the medical department.
111301.Performance 4: Teaches Chief Mania-related medical knowledge with almost coercion. Often sulks at night when Chief fails to answer her questions correctly.

111302.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111302.Mania Intensify Text: Upon breaking enemies' cores, all allied Sinners gain <color=#63b4c3>20%</color> CRIT rate for <color=#63b4c3>10</color> seconds.
111302.Name: Tetra
111302.Criminal Record 1:
One half of the phantom robber duo Fox and Rabbit, the subject goes by the code name *Fox*. Ignoring her own duties and obligations as an elite in society, the subject imitated another thief's method and colluded with the thief to commit theft using advanced technology.
The subject mostly stole from the residences of major officials and corporate leaders in Eastside, posing a great threat to the upper class's interests. The subject even allegedly stole classified documents from the EDGE, resulting in leaks of top-secret information and obstructing the city's development.
111302.Criminal Record 2:
Like her partner Pricilla, the subject never kept the loot from the Fox and Rabbit theft cases for her own use, but instead returned the property the victims had illegally acquired to the original owners.
Moreover, the confidential documents the subject stole from Eastside politicians were mostly related to her own family's enterprise. While such behaviors should not be encouraged, they haven't caused serious harm to society. Most of the innocent parties affected by these cases have received compensatory aid from the subject under Chief's supervision.
111302.Ability Summary: Able to stop time for a subjective duration of several seconds. The subject can move freely during this period. Extremely high battle effectiveness can be achieved when equipped with her specifically designed iron claw weapon.
111302.Awakening Signs: Had an awakening at the *Robber Rabbit*'s theft crime scene. Examination showed that the awakening was triggered by overzealous emotions. As awakening cases caused by positive emotions are rare, details are still to be further confirmed.
111302.Corruption State: The corruption level is low with no apparent physical signs of corruption and a fairly stable mental state. But the time-stopping duration record continues to be broken and the harmful effects of consistent enhancement through special powers to the body remain unknown at the moment.
111302.Arrest Records 1: Snuck into the MBCC with accomplices and intended to steal property information from Chief's office using their special power. Security discovered the subject's escape trail in time and a close investigation resulted in the subject's detainment.
111302.Performance 1: The subject has provided the Bureau with a lot of effective legal, financial, and managerial assistance, though only in the form of consultation. Due to the subject's family background, the subject has no real-life work experience and is not fully confident in the practical execution of orders.
111302.Performance 2: Out of habit, the subject follows the DisCity's change of regulations closely and can even accurately predict the government's actions. But with high awareness of confidentiality, unless something threatens the safety of innocent civilians, the subject will not easily reveal personal political opinions to the MBCC.
111302.Performance 3: Most Sinners find Tetra *friendly, talkative, and well-mannered*. But the MBCC observes that the subject never has deep conversations with any Sinners and will leave immediately after interacting with every Sinner for 30 seconds at group social events.
111302.Performance 4:
The subject once gave Chief a specifically designed hourglass whose sand flows extremely slowly and does not change direction when flipped. The subject has never explained the true meaning of the hourglass to Chief.
"When the countdown ends, I hope you'll be well prepared..."

111303.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate. Does not gain Energy over time, but will instead recover 1 point of Energy per Normal Attack.
111303.Mania Intensify Text: For each [Life Loss] state carried by the enemy, Sumire gains a <color=#63b4c3>6%</color> Damage increase against them.
111303.Name: Sumire
111303.Criminal Record 1: Top assassin of the *Garden* who disguised as an ikebana artist and frequently appeared in high society circles. Assassinated multiple important politicians, entrepreneurs, and gang leaders. Involved in over a hundred murders in which all targets were killed by one critical attack. No clues about the subject's identity and whereabouts were ever exposed and the subject posed an immense threat to the safety of big shots in different domains.
111303.Criminal Record 2: The subject seems to have developed a strong infatuation with Chief. She obeys all orders by Chief unconditionally and is extremely stable in her detention. The subject has long quit *the Garden* and claims to have left all her illegal businesses behind. She plans to spend the rest of her life with Chief. Though her statement is hard to verify, judging from her behavior, she seems to mean it genuinely.
111303.Ability Summary: Able to grant regular cold weapons range and power that defy all laws of physics with the stimulation of blood. Paired with her assassination skills gained from years of training and the *Garden*'s special umbrella blade, the subject can catch enemies off guard in battles.
111303.Awakening Signs: Awakened during the relentless training in the *Garden* in childhood and gained the Sinner power. The power was continuously enhanced during the subsequent years of assassination training and the subject is skilled in executing her special power.
111303.Corruption State: The subject has suffered close to ten years of prolonged corruption. Though no visible signs of mutation are observed, symptoms such as auditory hallucinations, headaches, and nightmares are frequent, suggesting rather severe corruption.
111303.Arrest Records 1: Before the arrest, the subject had long been a wanted criminal for a failed attempt to assassinate Chief, but her whereabouts were elusive. Eventually, the subject was found unconscious and severely injured at the entrance of the MBCC and was brought in to be treated, arrested, and detained.
111303.Arrest Records 2: Born in Eastside to unknown parents, the subject was adopted by the leader of the *Garden* and specifically raised to become an assassin. Members of the *Garden* addressed the leader as the *Mentor*.
111303.Arrest Records 3: After a brief period of discreet activity as the assassin of the *Garden*, the subject debuted as *Sumire the ikebana artist* in high society. Thanks to her artistry in ikebana, she was fairly well-known among the upper class and had many fans. The subject was able to frequent important occasions with her forged identity which provided convenience for her assassination work.
111303.Arrest Records 4: The subject had already quit the organization and ceased ikebana activity before the arrest. During the arrest, the corpses of several assassins also belonging to the *Garden* were discovered near the Bureau and were believed to be on the way to assassinate Chief. The wounds on their bodies matched the shape of Sumire's umbrella blade perfectly.
111303.Performance 1: The subject loves planting flowers and has planted various kinds of flowers in the garden to be used as ikebana materials. With extensive knowledge in plant care, barely anyone can top the subject when it comes to gardening skills.
111303.Performance 2: With old injuries accumulated from all the years as well as severe headaches and auditory hallucinations, the subject rarely goes out unless it's for executing battle missions. Despite that, the MBCC has never received any special medical requests from the subject. The subject claims that "she doesn't want Chief to worry about her."
111303.Performance 3: Tea ceremony is another expertise of the subject's after ikebana. In her free time, she's almost never seen without a cup of tea in her hand. Her excellent tea-brewing skills have won her quite a few tea ceremony partners. Other Sinners are very welcome to follow the flower scent to her room and enjoy a tea-drinking session there as her guest.
111303.Performance 4: Every week, she takes a break from visitors for a day and focuses on ikebana. The final product will always appear on the windowsill in Chief's office the next morning.

111305.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output using Sculpture. Can deal Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111305.Mania Intensify Text: Core Damage dealt by Ultimate is increased by <color=#63b4c3>1</color> point.
111305.Name: McQueen
111305.Case: Profiteering From Making And Selling Forgeries
111305.Criminal Record 1: An art dealer active among the rich and famous of Eastside, but in private, she gets involved in all manner of shady activities that concern art and money, including appraisal of collectibles, proxy buying of masterpieces, job placement, selling of forgeries, and plagiarism. McQueen's studio engages in innumerable illicit dealings, and McQueen has cultivated quite a reputation for herself in the black market in recent years.
111305.Criminal Record 2:
Besides her special power, the subject also possesses masterful art forgery skills. She has a more profound gift for art than regular art forgers, but she will never admit it. Compared to when she's interrogated by other staff, the subject definitely appears more cooperative and more willing to talk about herself when interacting with Chief.
Under the MBCC's strict supervision, the subject's art forgery business has entirely ceased since her detention.
111305.Ability Summary: The subject's power allows her to make replicas of objects. For her power to work, she needs to possess an adequate knowledge of the object she wishes to replicate. As a rule, McQueen can only replicate a work of art or herself, with the replica and the original being slightly different.
111305.Awakening Signs: The subject awakened her power on account of the strong emotions she felt when she was betrayed and almost lost her life, an experience that left her both traumatized and disillusioned.
111305.Corruption State: The subject suffers from a medium level of Maniac corruption. No visible abnormalities have been found on her body, but she is mentally unstable, troubled by occasional nightmares. The Maniac energies inside her seem to have magnified her dark side, leading her to destructive actions that defy comprehension.
111305.Arrest Records 1: The subject crosses paths with MBCC Sinners during the Witching Hour Exhibition in the Belphegor Art Museum. She escapes when it's discovered that she's a Sinner trying to make replicas. As soon as the exhibition ends, the MBCC carries out a search and arrests McQueen; the MBCC is also able to gather evidence of McQueen making forgeries.
111305.Arrest Records 2: The subject, who used to go by the name of Jennie, was an art student at a college of art in Eastside. During her school years, she stayed on the straight and narrow and had a great passion for art. But the collectors in the profession doubted her talents and potential as an artist, despite complimenting her on her efforts.
111305.Arrest Records 3: The negative reviews sent her down a spiral of depression. It was when she was at rock bottom that she met an art dealer called McQueen in an art gallery and was unknowingly led onto the path of art forgery by the art dealer's lies and deception. When she found out, she had a falling-out with the art dealer, awakening her power in the process, which directly led to the death of the art dealer.
111305.Arrest Records 4: This experience left Jennie disillusioned about the entire art scene. She abandoned her old name and gave up her career as an artist, going deeper into the forgery market as an art dealer under the new name McQueen. Ever since then, she has been making forgeries that are passed off as genuine, in an effort to get back at the Eastside art world that has failed her.
111305.Performance 1: McQueen keeps in her room a few Klein blue ornaments and decorations, which she takes great care to wipe immaculately clean. When she notices that many MBCC staffers and Sinners show interest in them, she insists that they come over to take a look and asks to them guess if a particular item is fake or genuine. And as it turns out, all of her collectibles are fake.
111305.Performance 2: Every time McQueen goes to Eastside for a mission, she almost always encounters someone she knows, from upper-class customers to black market brokers. Man or woman, young or old, they all have a good rapport with McQueen. On a few occasions, McQueen even managed to quickly sell one forgery or two to a passerby when the MBCC staffers' backs were turned.
111305.Performance 3: McQueen is easy-going, stylish, attractive, and a people person through and through. Her popularity within the MBCC is climbing into the stratosphere. This pleases her so much that she creates several clones of herself to cater to a growing fan base.
111305.Performance 4: McQueen insists on using such saccharine terms of endearment as *Darling*, *Baby*, and *Beauty* to address Chief, and tries out such acts as head-touching and Kabedon on Chief time and again. These tricks don't work on Chief, but that doesn't discourage her in the slightest.

111306.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Damage whose Ultimate deals Core Damage.
111306.Mania Intensify Text: When Lynn breaks a core, all allied Sinners gain a CRIT Damage increase of <color=#63b4c3>40%</color> for 10 seconds.
111306.Name: Lynn
111306.Criminal Record 1: Lynn was a missing student from Eastside. She vanished without a trace following a hideous "accident." She was rumored to be the cause of the "accident," and later earned the nickname Eastside Cyclops.
111306.Criminal Record 2:
After a series of investigation and interrogation, it's found that the subject had been constantly bullied and isolated due to her background and timidity. Her power awakened and went out of control as she tried to exercise self-defense but not intentional harm. None of the students injured during the Eastside school incident was fatally harmed and all of them have since been discharged from the hospital.
Besides, under Chief's encouragement and mediation, the subject has gradually come out of the mental restraints her family has put on her and is determined to start a new life.
111306.Ability Summary: Lynn's eye releases energy blasts continuously, and she has no control over it. The energy blasts are highly destructive but can be prevented from spreading into the environment with a helmet made from a special material.
111306.Awakening Signs: Lynn's weak character, which, compounded by her Syndican origins, made her an object of ridicule and bullying. She endured attacks from her fellow students without protest until she awakened her power out of an overpowering urge for self-preservation when her right eye was slashed by a utility knife. The energy blast she released on that occasion was so powerful that it eliminated everything in its path.
111306.Corruption State: Lynn suffers from a moderate level of Maniac corruption, which manifests itself mainly in her eye but shows signs of metastasis to the brain.
111306.Arrest Records 1: Lynn was found by OwO in the sewage system in the Blockbuster Films Incident and recruited by OwO as a cinematographer to her film crew. After the incident was resolved, Lynn was taken back to the MBCC, for safety reasons.
111306.Arrest Records 2: Lynn was born into an ordinary family in Eastside. Her parents were among the small cohort of Syndicans with a clean record who had come to Eastside legally after the passing of West District Order Management Regulations. Still, the family was ostracized by Eastside society because of their origins, and Lynn was a long-time sufferer of unfair treatment in school.
111306.Arrest Records 3: Lynn ran away in the wake of the Eastside School Incident. In her haste to put distance behind her, Lynn slipped and fell into a drainage ditch on a construction site. She gathered scrap from the ditch and assembled a helmet that could hem her power in. She had been wearing the helmet ever since while living in Eastside's sewage system, coming out only at night.
111306.Arrest Records 4: Lynn is mousy and withdrawn, avoiding human contact like the plague. A talented photographer who has never received any formal training, she takes great photographs simply by instinct. The skyscrapers in Eastside hold little appeal for her. What tickles her imagination as a photographer is the unorthodoxy of Drifter Camp, the ruggedness of the Syndican border, and the colorfulness of people's everyday life.
111306.Performance 1: When Lynn was a newcomer to the MBCC, she put up a wall around her with her shyness. She never initiated a conversation, and when she was dragged into one, she averted her eyes throughout. Her awkwardness was most obvious when she was interacting with Sinners who were excessively friendly.
111306.Performance 2: Lynn balks at the idea of engaging in battle, but she's dutiful and dedicated when it comes to non-combat tasks assigned by the MBCC, doing her utmost to complete as many tasks as possible and complete them as satisfactorily as possible.
111306.Performance 3: Lynn has a good taste and is very handy. She makes lovely handicrafts in her free time. The Sinners and staffers often come to her for handicrafts to use as trinkets or ornaments, and she seems to relish the feeling of being needed.
111306.Performance 4: Lynn has been acting strange lately. On more than one occasion, she opened her mouth to say something in front of Chief, only to clamp it shut. Only after days of self-debate does she pluck up the courage and, cheeks flushing red, ask if Chief would like to be the subject of a photobook.

111307.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111307.Mania Intensify Text: Deal <color=#63b4c3>20%</color> more damage to enemies that have been marked with [Weakspot].
111307.Name: Garofano
111307.Criminal Record 1: A young widow running a tailor shop has been unmasked as an undercover spy for the Garden organization. She's adept at blending in, winning over her targets, and achieving her goals. Her actions have deep ties, implicating many top figures. We need to bring her in for questioning right away.
111307.Criminal Record 2: Upon close examination, we learned that a tragic family event has fueled a strong resentment and mistrust for the FAC's top brass. This drove her to team up with the Garden, seeking a chance for payback. Additionally, she's become overly protective of her loved ones, showing an intense desire to shield them. However, since being brought in and experiencing the soothing environment of the Bureau, combined with Chief's comforting words, she's cooled down and seems to have found a new place where she belongs.
