111307.Ability Summary: The subject can easily stab the needle into any part of an object. Once the ability kicks in, the item begins to degrade by Mania starting from where the needle touched, crumbling away to nothing. The subject decides how fast and how much it corrodes. And even if you pull out the needle, there's no stopping the damage.
111307.Awakening Signs: Once just a regular Eastside dweller, her life took a dark twist when Mania unexpectedly hit home. The subject was the sole survivor of that fateful day. Amid the chaos, the subject was infected with Mania, transforming into a Sinner.
111307.Corruption State: On the outside, there's nothing out of the ordinary. But given the subject's knack for disguise and strong mental composure, it's tough to gauge if the subject's grappling with deep-seated psychological issues. Still, the occasional hints of paranoia hint that the chaos left an enduring mark on the subject's psyche.
111307.Arrest Records 1: The prime suspect in a messy inheritance-related murder, the subject is taken into custody by the Public Security Bureau following standard procedures. Given the Sinner status, the subject is temporarily moved to the MBCC for special handling during the investigation.
111307.Arrest Records 2: The subject ran a popular tailor shop in Eastside earning the trust and respect of the local folks for her unmatched skills and genuine nature. But when Younger Mr. Braun claimed she was behind her husband's death, a wave of skepticism swept the community. Yet, the moment her secret life as a Sinner came to light, all the supporting voices disappeared overnight.
111307.Arrest Records 3: According to the subject's statement, her home had once been subjected to a sudden and catastrophic Mania attack. Amidst the chaos, the only thing she managed to hold onto was a button from her younger brother's coat. She wears it close to her heart every day, claiming it brings the warmth and presence of her family around her.
111307.Arrest Records 4: The subject unveils a dark secret behind her awakening: Top brass from FAC had covertly ordered their dad to move a corrupting Mania substance without him knowing. This act morphed him into a Corruptor right in their own home, sparking a family tragedy. Fueled by a thirst for vengeance, the subject aligned with the Garden and has, so far, exacted revenge on every key player linked to this horror.
111307.Performance 1: After being brought onboard, the subject admits she's not cut out for the front lines and instead volunteers to help with behind-the-scenes tasks. The team can't help but admire her gentle touch, patience, and reliable way of getting things done.
111307.Performance 2: The subject often requests sewing supplies from the Supply Office, supposedly because she's inundated with outfit requests from both Sinners and staff. Chief has put out several notices to address this, but things haven't changed much.
111307.Performance 3: The subject has a big heart for every Sinner, going the extra mile for the younger ones. Folks often say she has a strong motherly vibe. Beyond always being up for any tailoring tasks, she's known to share their homemade treats and homey wisdom, making her a favorite around the Bureau.
111307.Performance 4: The subject once crafted a shirt for Chief. Investigations reveal it's the only personal item left behind during the subject's escape. Though security cleared the shirt of threats, a withered carnation lay hidden inside.

111308.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111308.Mania Intensify Text: Damage dealt by summoned creatures increases by <color=#63b4c3>15%</color>.
111308.Name: Eureka
111308.Criminal Record 1:
Originally from Eastside, Eureka has been dedicated to the research and manufacture of various eccentric inventions for years. Her contraptions are often hard to control and have caused numerous disturbances disrupting public order.
Subsequent investigation revealed that an allegedly man-made explosion occurred in a suburban factory when Eureka was an employee there. As a major suspect, she was to be immediately detained and interrogated.
111308.Criminal Record 2: Upon interrogation, it was learned that Eureka didn't intentionally make the weapons that harmed innocent civilians but was deceived and coerced into doing so. During her detention in the MBCC, she proves to be sincere and kind, earning the favor and recognition of many within the Bureau. Under Chief's supervision and guidance, invention-related accidents have also significantly reduced. Eureka is evaluated to be no longer a threat to society.
111308.Ability Summary: Her special power can change or enhance a material's properties, facilitating her invention process. Her weapon of choice is a specially modified screwdriver which she uses as a tool in daily life and as a slender sword in combat.
111308.Awakening Signs: According to Eureka, she awakened as a Sinner several years ago when she accidentally touched Mania-tainted raw materials while manufacturing weapons in a black market workshop.
111308.Corruption State: Physical examination results show that Eureka's level of corruption is low with no physical mutations, and all indicators are within the normal range. She is generally lucid and emotionally stable, with occasional fluctuations when recalling past experiences.
111308.Arrest Records 1: Chief met Eureka at the Buonanotte Toy Factory. After the incident, she returned to the MBCC with Chief and willingly turned herself in without any resistance.
111308.Arrest Records 2: She is absent-minded and reticent, yet her mind is a playground of ideas with boundless imagination. She is obsessed with invention and creation, often traveling to various places in search of fresh inspiration. Beyond her string of novel yet impractical inventions, she seems to have a fair understanding of weapon development as well.
111308.Arrest Records 3: Born into a humble working-class family in Eastside, Eureka's childhood was rather stifling. With her parents' tough lives, they projected all their hopes onto her, frequently chastising her for mediocre grades and her penchant for handicrafts. Her school life was no different. Her eccentric hobbies earned her the label of a *freak*, leading to isolation and bullying.
111308.Arrest Records 4: During her university years, Eureka met her best friend Jessie. With aligned interests, they often collaborated on invention and research. After dropping out of school, she followed Jessie to work at her uncle's factory. It wasn't until she accidentally touched Mania-tainted materials and awakened as a Sinner that she realized the factory was in fact a black market weapon workshop. Unwilling to aid in the making of harmful inventions, she seized an opportunity to cause a disturbance and successfully escaped the factory.
111308.Performance 1: Even after joining the MBCC, she's never ceased her invention. However, the constant noise from her room greatly disrupted the daily life of other Sinners in the Bureau. A small workshop was thus set up in a secluded corner specifically for her creative endeavors.
111308.Performance 2: Despite not being a social expert, she is passionate about repairing things for others. With her handy skills, she can easily make any severely worn item brand new again. But she can't always resist the urge to modify all ordinary objects. Recently, the Bureau had to deal with the peculiar sight of self-rotating flying trash cans whizzing down the corridors.
111308.Performance 3: Gentle and friendly, she rarely comes into conflict with others. Her dazzling array of novel inventions has piqued the interest of many Sinners and staff members. Some of the more generous Sinners have repeatedly funded the research for her new inventions.
111308.Performance 4: It is roughly estimated that ever since joining the MBCC, Eureka has gifted Chief with a variety of special inventions, including an Emergency Ejection Chair, a Gesture Communication Watch, a pair of Lightning Escape Shoes, an Auto Strikeback Shield, and a Nightmare Catcher Helmet. Although most of these have never been put to actual use, she continues to pack Chief's office with new gadgets. This could be an awkward friendly gesture on her part.

111309.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111309.Mania Intensify Text: Core Damage from Ultimate increased by <color=#63b4c3>1</color>
111309.Name: Thistle
111309.Criminal Record 1: Trained by the Garden, she was tasked with assassinating the president of the Future Charity Foundation during an operation targeting Paradeisos officials. After being captured and incarcerated by the Eastside Public Security Bureau, she collaborated and executed escape attempts with other Sinners, causing social unrest with a detrimental impact. Immediate detention and interrogation is recommended.
111309.Criminal Record 2: Interrogation and testimonies from other Sinners reveal that after losing both parents, the subject joined the Garden seeking a chance for vengeance. She was briefly trained and participated in only a few missions. Most of her aggressive actions are a response to her protective urge. Since her detention, she's been comforted by the stable living environment, companions, and Chief's promise. Her mind has gradually stabilized, and she has rediscovered her passion for life.
111309.Ability Summary: The subject can form a flame blade in her palm or line the weapon she's holding with fire and extend the blade. The flames possess all the characteristics of ordinary fire and can continue burning with blood as fuel upon contact with wounds.
111309.Awakening Signs: While searching for her mother, she accidentally uncovered a conspiracy by the mastermind. She followed the suspect to the Rust and witnessed another victim become part of the broken wall. As the subject was infected by the Rust's highly concentrated Mania and under extreme anger, panic, and grief, her special power awakened.
111309.Corruption State: With a lighter degree of corruption, her body shows no physical signs of mutation. Though mostly sane, she's impulsive and exceedingly stubborn in nature. It's believed that she is still under the influence of Mania.
111309.Arrest Records 1: She was suspected to be hiding in Syndicate with the remnants of the Garden and her Mentor, but the Bureau did not detect her presence during the arrest of the Garden's remnants. A few days after the detention, she planned and executed an assassination attempt on Chief alone, which failed and resulted in her capture by the Bureau.
111309.Arrest Records 2: The subject's father was a member of the FAC, and her mother worked at a publishing house before marriage. After her father died on a mission in N.F. 103, her mother gave up all her benefits and moved to the outskirts of Eastside to raise the subject alone. Despite their impoverished life, the subject continued to receive a normal education and engage in social activities.
111309.Arrest Records 3: After failing to file for her mother's disappearance in N.F. 111, the subject attempted to investigate on her own and accidentally discovered that her mother was killed for persistently seeking the truth about her father's death. Her power awakened by the shock, she vowed to seek vengeance and disappeared at the end of N.F. 111. The subject admits to have joined the Garden to prepare herself for her revenge.
111309.Arrest Records 4: After completing her revenge, she saw protecting the Garden as her new purpose and helped the severely injured Garden's Mentor and the group's remnants relocate to their hideout in Syndicate. She continued to sharpen her skills at the same time, gradually becoming independent. However, she remains deeply concerned about her Mentor's health and constantly worries about lacking the strength to protect her family.
111309.Performance 1: The subject has always kept her journaling habit inherited from her mother. Whenever possible, she spends over an hour writing and drawing in her journal daily. She also uses ginkgo leaves to make handicrafts like roses. Since the materials are easy to obtain and the products are delightful, many Sinners have asked her for lessons.
111309.Performance 2: She loves wandering the streets and visiting shops, especially bakeries, boutiques, and arcades with claw machines. She knows all about the locations, styles, and price ranges of these stores. Whenever she gets a chance during any mission in Eastside, she makes sure to drop by these places and bring back gifts for the other Sinners, especially the members of the Garden.
111309.Performance 3: After losing her parents, she's been consumed by vengeance, often disguising herself with an aggressive façade and believing herself unpopular. However, following incidents like giving up a limited edition doll to Mess and helping design decorative laces for Lynn's helmet, her sincerity and kindness have become an open secret among Sinners of her age.
111309.Performance 4: She gifted Chief a thick limited edition journal and suggested Chief too should jot down three happy moments each day for memories and mood regulation. She even lent some of her own journals to Chief for inspiration.

111310.Info: A Sinner adept at aiding the battle with mushrooms. Her Ultimate can deal core damage.
111310.Mania Intensify Text: Damage dealt by summoned creatures increases by <color=#63b4c3>15%</color>.
111310.Name: Shrooma
111310.Incident: Spreading Negativity in Dark Web Communities
111310.Criminal Record 1: Born into an immigrant merchant family, the subject is now a student at a private school renowned for its strict regime. Not only is she a perfect daughter in her parents' eyes, she is also a straight-A student for her teachers. According to close examination of her files, the subject has never used her power to instigate trouble or harm anyone.
111310.Criminal Record 2: Interrogation reveals that the subject mistook malicious impulses for negative emotions due to familial and educational influence. Having repressed her true feelings for years, she failed to form any meaningful emotional attachment and learn to relate to other people, resulting in her perverse ways of venting. As Chief helped the subject find an appropriate outlet for her pent-up feelings and a correct way of internalization, the subject was enabled to learn about the truth, get over hard feelings, establish wholesome emotional attachments and embark on a healthy path.
111310.Ability Summary: The subject can control and rewrite the genetic factors in spores, making them grow rapidly into large mushrooms for various combat purposes. The subject can also use her rewriting ability to change her appearance, breathing, heartbeat, and growth rate, even reducing them to a fungal level (almost zero).
111310.Awakening Signs: According to the subject and her mother's accounts, the subject became a Sinner due to maternal infection. Her abilities awakened under the emotional influence of her mother who was placed in extreme circumstances, enabling the subject to camouflage herself for self-preservation.
111310.Corruption State: The subject's corruption level is moderate, but her camouflage ability prevents any visible mutations. She's sane most of the time but often has radical thoughts.
111310.Arrest Records 1: After the Elysiland incident, the subject caught Chief's attention due to her actions on the island and was detained for investigation at the Bureau, during which she behaved well. Considering the subject's close social ties, to avoid further complications, Chief pretended as her summer camp instructor when arresting her, to which she reacted cooperatively.
111310.Arrest Records 2: The subject appears to come from a wealthy and harmonious family, but in reality she has been living under extreme stress. This has resulted in long-term self-repression and an inability to relieve her pent-up frustration through normal social interactions. The subject could only vent by initiating radical discourse on a dark web forum and finding solace in other netizens in similar situations.
111310.Arrest Records 3: Excellent at concealing her true nature, the subject knows how to act like a well-behaved straight-A student to fit into her family's pleasant image. She's even earned social capital for her family and is therefore their *favorite*. However, beneath this facade, the subject continues to suffer scrutiny and neglect due to certain past events.
111310.Arrest Records 4: While still in her mother's womb, the subject was infected with Mania because of a family feud. Although she awakened as a Sinner and protected herself and her mother, the premature death of her other sibling led to silent rejection from her family members. Despite the subject's slightly egocentric character due to Mania's influence, she has never harmed anyone and is not the *monster* her prejudiced family makes her out to be.
111310.Performance 1: The subject is a fast learner and perfectly capable of taking care of herself. She consistently meets course goals and completes daily tasks punctually. However, random inspection reveals that the subject hasn't completely overcome the occasional laziness and playfulness typical of kids her age. The only difference is that she's able to perform well in class even after staying up all night surfing the dark web.
111310.Performance 2: Possibly due to her mutation, the subject's sense of taste is extremely insensitive. Although the subject claims her favorite food is her mother's onion meat roll and that she dislikes broccoli, she once ate two servings of broccoli (and some food other Sinners slipped into her plate) while distracted without protest.
111310.Performance 3: Habitually keeping her camouflage when first arriving at the Bureau, the subject actively tried to expand her network and successfully fit into the Sinner community. But deep down, the subject's not very sociable. Having gradually adapted to the environment and accepted her true self, her social circle has shrunk to include only Sinners of similar age or those with compatible personalities.
111310.Performance 4: The subject once left a delicate postcard on Chief's desk containing a dark web URL and a set of login credentials. Upon logging in, Chief discovered a secret forum accessible only to two users, in which all posts were personal thoughts the subject had noted down.

111311.Info: A Sinner adept at breaking cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111311.Mania Intensify Text: Energy Recovery Speed is increased by <color=#63b4c3>15%</color>.
111311.Name: Poffy
111311.Criminal Record 1:
The subject previously debuted as a child actor but left showbiz after suffering a mental breakdown while shooting a TV show. After changing her name, she became active online as a mukbang content creator.
Investigation reveals that hunger causes the subject to collapse mentally and lose control of her Mania, posing a great threat to society. Temporary detention and monitoring are recommended.
111311.Criminal Record 2: Investigation reveals that the subject's emotional instability was caused by years of excessive control by her mother. During her time at the Bureau, she has received guidance and can now control her desires and emotions. She has consistently demonstrated good behavior and actively participated in various activities. Currently, she no longer requires mandatory detention and only needs to return to the Bureau for routine examinations.
111311.Ability Summary: The subject possesses the ability to sense and manipulate calories. She can detect and regulate the thermal state of food within a certain range, and can instantly detonate the internal energy of food items. Therefore, the subject typically employs food as her weapons.
111311.Awakening Signs: Her special power awakened when she was forgotten by a film crew at a high M-value shooting location near the edge of the Rust. Her power manifested due to her hunger and fear.
111311.Corruption State: She displays mild corruption with minor physical mutations. She remains lucid most of the time, but will lose control when experiencing extreme hunger.
111311.Arrest Records 1: The Bureau received reports of a suspected Sinner snatching food from pedestrians at the Eastside Food Market. During the investigation, the subject voluntarily turned herself in to the Bureau.
111311.Arrest Records 2: The subject was discovered by a talent scout at a young age and became a child model. However, after being infected with Mania, she experienced several emotional breakdowns at school and while shooting TV shows. During these episodes, she bit multiple civilians and caused small-scale explosions. After that, she quit showbiz and dropped out of school.
111311.Arrest Records 3: After venturing into the livestreaming industry on her own, she endured long-term emotional and physical abuse from her management company. She was forced to eat strange foods and do competitive eating in front of the camera. Although she wished to leave the company, she was unable to pay the *massive penalty fee* her manager repeatedly threatened her about. With no other options, she came to the Bureau seeking protection.
111311.Arrest Records 4: The subject's real name is Nibella. Since a young age, she had been under her mother's excessive control, with her diet strictly regulated to maintain an attractive figure for modeling. Years of living under her mother's constraints rendered her unable to control her own emotions and desires. Consequently, when facing external pressure, she would often resort to extreme behaviors as a coping mechanism. It's been observed that her binge-eating behavior is actually a form of rebellion.
111311.Performance 1: She loves eating and has an astonishing appetite, which caused the Bureau's cafeteria to overrun its budget several times. She particularly enjoys sweets and rice, and frequently exchanges culinary insights with Ignis. However, she is not skilled at cooking and could almost be characterized as a disaster in the kitchen.
111311.Performance 2: As a former child model, the subject has her own unique fashion sense. She favors dopamine-inducing colors in her clothing and cute, colorful accessories. She often covers the minor mutations on her body with food-themed stickers.
111311.Performance 3: Friendly, outgoing, and a mood-maker, she is well-liked within the Bureau. During her stay, she made quite a few friends/dining partners. She also frequently carried rice balls around, which she gave out to Sinners she deemed to be looking hungry.
111311.Performance 4: The subject viewed Chief as her designated feeder in the Bureau. Whenever she felt she hadn't eaten enough, she would confidently stroll into Chief's office with various excuses to mooch food and drinks.

111401.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111401.Name: Pricilla
111401.Criminal Record 1:
One half of the phantom robber duo Fox and Rabbit, the subject goes by the code name *Rabbit*. Serial theft suspect whose crimes involved an inestimable sum. It's unclear where the money has gone. The serial thefts have inspired multiple copycat crimes, seriously undermining social stability.
Later snuck into an important organization of the EDGE with a partner, jeopardizing the intelligence security of the DisCity. The subject must be strictly supervised.
111401.Criminal Record 2:
According to reliable sources, the victims of the Fox and Rabbit theft cases are almost exclusively billionaires and politicians with a questionable track record. The so-called *theft trend* they've set only lasted briefly before it vanished like other fads.
The MBCC has detained both the subject and her partner Tetra. Their close relationship makes supervision easier and currently there's no risk of information leakage.
111401.Ability Summary: Able to distort space with her power, enlarging or shrinking a target area or space. The suitcase created with her power can store a large volume of weapons and resources. It can even be used as a hiding spot or an emergency exit.
111401.Awakening Signs: According to the subject's account, the subject was cornered following a failed theft attempt and the fear induced her awakening. The subject was able to distort the space and escape the life-threatening plight in the end.
111401.Corruption State: With scarce Hypercube resources, Zart Village lacks protection. But the nature of the subject's body is unique and it has developed a certain resistance to contamination. Both the corruption level and mutation speed are low and the mental state is stable.
111401.Arrest Records 1: Snuck into the MBCC with the accomplice and intended to steal property information from Chief's office using their special power. Security discovered the subject's escape trail in time and a close investigation resulted in the subject's detainment.
111401.Performance 1: Unwilling to submit to rules or teaching, the subject has repeatedly managed to escape from the Bureau despite having announced the escapes beforehand. She calls it an *escape game*. Out of the 175 *escape games* she's played with Chief, Pricilla has had 174 losses and 1 tie.
111401.Performance 2: Passionate about flamboyant and bizarre disguises and possesses masterful transformative makeup skills. Many times, she's been surrounded by curious onlooking Sinners for her dramatic and strange guises. This has brought a strong party vibe to the Bureau and seriously disturbs the strict execution of routine management work.
111401.Performance 3: Is friendly with many Sinners and often visits other Sinners in their detention rooms outside the permitted hours. It's impossible to police her visiting means. The staff have been reassuring themselves that "it's good for fostering the friendship among Sinners" and tolerating her roaming from one room to another.
111401.Performance 4: Once, the subject got drunk and volunteered to perform magic tricks. Toward the end of the performance, she slipped into the suitcase she always brought with her and vanished. The next morning, a still unconscious Pricilla was found next to Chief's bed. She claimed she had no idea why she was sleeping in Chief's bedroom.

111402.Info: An extremely lucky Sinner. Can deal <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and an extra <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111402.Mania Intensify Text: Roulecca is guaranteed to fire 1 [Lucky Bullet] every 6 attacks.
111402.Name: Roulecca
111402.Criminal Record 1:
Demonstrated stubborn and petulant behavior. Initiated in total several dozen serial explosions and shootings in the name of *rising to the top of Syndicate*, causing several hundred casualties.
Frequenting all major casinos over the years, the subject's abnormally high winning rate and uninhibited character often attracted grudge. It's suspected that the subject asked for trouble intentionally and more violent incidents may result if the subject is not properly controlled.
111402.Criminal Record 2: Interactions and counseling with the subject reveal that she witnessed the murder of her father and his gang members at a young age, which awakened the power and she defended herself with it. Evidence shows that the victims of the serial explosions and shootout were all rival gang members and no civilians were harmed in the incident. With Chief's further counseling and company, the subject has gradually rectified her petulant character.
111402.Ability Summary: Possesses eerily strong luck and will almost never get hit by fatal objects like bullets, knives, and explosives. Able to control the development of things according to her will. Uses a Colt Python revolver habitually and never misses a target without having to aim, relying solely on her special power.
111402.Awakening Signs: The first recorded energy fluctuation occurred during a fight between two gangs in Syndicate. During the fight, the subject was apparently severely shaken mentally and had an awakening triggered by an intense urge to revenge. More details are to be obtained in further interrogations.
111402.Corruption State: In early assessments, the subject was misdiagnosed due to the intense vengefulness unfitting for the age. It's now been confirmed that the subject's mental state is normal and no apparent signs of corruption have been detected. Blessed by the *strong luck*, the mutating speed is way slower than that in normal people to the point of almost negligible.
111402.Arrest Records 1: During the investigation of a serial explosion case with unknown cause, the subject requested temporary protection from the MBCC. When the request was processed by the shelter, the subject's Sinner identity and past criminal records were unraveled and she was then kept under further restraint.
111402.Arrest Records 2: The daughter of the boss of a small gang named *Four-leaf Clover*. Her mother died early, but she was doted on by her father and the gang members and had a happy childhood. Under the gang's protection, she possessed a certain degree of *luck* early on and was banned by gambling businesses and lottery booths.
111402.Arrest Records 3: The subject insisted on calling herself the boss of the Four-leaf Clover and frequented the major casinos in Syndicate, beginning revenge missions targeting other gangs on her own.
111402.Arrest Records 4: The Four-leaf Clover was indeed one of the many small gangs in Syndicate. It mainly focused on gambling business and rarely involved in violent activities. The gang was eliminated amid the expansion of other powers in Syndicate and all registered members are dead.
111402.Performance 1: A picky eater and crazy about candies, the subject shows mild symptoms of malnutrition. After joining the MBCC, the subject has gradually gotten a taste for the nutritionally balanced food provided by the logistics department, and her candy addiction has greatly lessened.
111402.Performance 2: There have been frequent explosions in the Bureau lately, and investigation shows that the subject enjoys igniting all kinds of explosives. So far, the power station, fuel storage, and kitchen have already suffered severe losses.
111402.Performance 3: Passionate about gathering Sinners within the MBCC to play *games* - any game of chance such as dice games, airplane chess, etc. Since the subject wins every time, the other Sinners are gradually losing interest in these *games*.
111402.Performance 4: Recently, the subject seems particularly fascinated by Chief's office and engages in activities such as placing a whiteboard duster on the doorstop or changing Chief's desktop background to a laughable character from a certain comedy, apparently hoping to attract Chief's attention.

111403.Info: A Sinner adept at Long-Distance Output. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111403.Mania Intensify Text: When an enemy's core is broken, that enemy is inflicted with [Hunt] which reduces their Defense by <color=#63b4c3>20%</color> for <color=#63b4c3>10</color> seconds.
111403.Name: Wolverine
111403.Criminal Record 1: Several fellow Syndicate gangsters testified that the subject has collected materials for Mania Weapons, frequently conducted illegal hunting in the Rust, assisted in importing dangerous materials, promoted the mass circulation of Mania Weapons, indirectly worsening the violent conflicts in Syndicate and posing a serious threat to the society.
111403.Criminal Record 2:
Interrogation reveals that the subject had been isolated from human society since childhood and therefore lacks common sense. Soon after he was adopted by scavenger Hank, he ended up in the hands of a Syndican gang. He only gathered ingredients for Mania weapons and poached under the gang's coercion and threat.
After breaking free from the gang, the subject has begun eliminating Corruptors voluntarily, in a way aiding the authority that manages the Rust's contamination.
111403.Ability Summary: The crossbow and arrows are the normal Syndicate gang style. The body functionality was enhanced with his special power, significantly increased the crossbow's penetrative and destructive strength.
111403.Awakening Signs: Recently awakened and familiar with his special power. Claims to have awakened during a life-threatening and physically depleting battle.
111403.Corruption State: No mutation in physical appearance. Relatively stable mental state. Born with some erosion resistance due to extremely intense Mania density.
111403.Arrest Records 1: Violently resisted during the arrest and was captured using the electricity grid. The electronic restraint was met with the subject's violent resistance. The situation improved after the traditional arrest method was employed.
111403.Arrest Records 2: Born in the Rust area. Parents are unknown. Lived with wild animals and a savage lifestyle as a child. Once taken in by "Hank", a scavenger of the Rust and acquired some knowledge of human society.
111403.Arrest Records 3: Tamed by the gang system. Skilled at shooting and hunting skills. Has muscle memory for battle commands which leads to involuntary subconscious reactions. Coerced by the gang to hunt Corruptors and abandoned as bait in the critical moment.
111403.Arrest Records 4: A victim of human trafficking, but has no hatred for the perpetrators. The follow-up investigation found that the subject has protected scavengers from Corruptors when wandering around to hunt at the Rust.
111403.Performance 1: Extremely defiant and irritable when first arrested, who smashed seven sets of tableware, eight cleaning robots, and fifty-five computers. The MBCC staff attempted to persuade the subject to participate in basic modern primary and secondary school education, but the results were average due to a lack of patience.
111403.Performance 2: Skilled at cooking games. Able to quickly deconstruct and handle pheasants and rabbits and cook them over a fire. But the subject refused to share food with people other than Chief and often ate extra meals alone late at night, which had been repeatedly reported by other Sinners.
111403.Performance 3: Displayed excessive aggression and little trust in other Sinners. Frequently in conflict with others. Serious disciplinary criticism can only deter repeated offence for a few days.
111403.Performance 4: Has a strong desire to protect Chief. Acts as a security guard without submitting a request. Now no one can come close to Chief's office, which has caused many issues in the MBCC's daily operation.

111404.Info: Matilda's pistol has 10 bullets. Each normal attack consumes 1 bullet. When all bullets are depleted, it takes 2 seconds to reload.
111404.Name: Matilda
111404.Incident: Executive Committee and Rustfire Serial Event
111404.Criminal Record 1: As a member of Family Cavendish in Eastside, she once served on the Executive Committee as Donald's adjutant. After the West District riot, she didn't return to Eastside and was therefore seen as a family outcast by those around her. In reality, she was a secret supporter of Rustfire.
111404.Criminal Record 2: The subject received an elite education in Eastside from a young age, but her experiences in the West District changed her value on this world. After going through the hearing with Chief, she refused the assistant position offered by her aunt and chose to stay at the MBCC.
111404.Ability Summary: She has an excellent grasp of firearms, being able to use any gun proficiently as soon as she gets her hands on it. Not only that, she can use different firearms to adapt to different combat situations.
111404.Awakening Signs: During her duty in N.F. 112, she was contaminated and awakened as a Sinner, seen as a disgrace that needed to be covered up by her family.
111404.Corruption State: The subject has very high moral standards, a stable mind, and a low degree of corruption.
111404.Arrest Records 1: After the Rustfire serial events, the subject joined the MBCC almost as if she was transferred there. Investigations revealed that she concealed her Sinner identity during her tenure at the Executive Committee. Now, the MBCC detains her as a Sinner. During her detention, the subject has not tried to resist in any way.
111404.Arrest Records 2: The subject's full name is Matilda Cavendish, and her aunt is the star councilor of Eastside, Bernadette Cavendish. After the West District incident, the subject was invited to the hearing to speak for the people of West District.
111404.Arrest Records 3: The subject's parents died in the Abel assassination turmoil, and she was adopted by her aunt. During their time together, her aunt sent her to the best elite school in Eastside, but she struggled academically and suffered a lot of stress. All those times, she regarded her aunt as a role model in life.
111404.Arrest Records 4: After graduation, the subject started working at the Executive Committee and noticed that the real situation in the West District was nothing like what she learned in Eastside, and her perspective started to change. At the hearing of the West District incident, the subject firmly advocated for cooperation between West District and Eastside. After Family Cavendish decided to support her, the situation in Eastside changed.
111404.Performance 1: After being transferred to the MBCC, the subject voluntarily took on many tasks within the bureau, completing them all with high efficiency and flying colors. However, due to her overly serious nature, the subject has a distant relationship with most Sinners and is not good at communication.
111404.Performance 2: The subject often goes to the shooting range for practice, using various firearms with a poker face and indifferent demeanor, leading some Sinners to mistakenly perceive her as a difficult person. However, in reality, the subject will immediately apologize sincerely if she realizes that her gunfire has disturbed others.
111404.Performance 3: As she spends more time at the MBCC, the subject is accepted by more and more Sinners, and some Sinners begin to enjoy teasing her and watching her funny reactions.
111404.Performance 4: The subject often works overtime until late at night, and she has repeatedly publicly stated that she wants to be like Nightingale, a reliable adjutant at Chief's side.

111405.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and an extra <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111405.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111405.Name: Yanyan
111405.Incident: Damaging Public Property and Causing Disorder
111405.Criminal Record 1:
Born in Outland, the subject was revered as a spiritually gifted Sinner in her homeland. She visited DisCity as a member of the Eastian delegation. Possessing a prophetic gift for sensing *divine will* and conveying *oracles*, she actively cooperated with the DisCity authorities to counter the Apostle of Ashes *Sun Crow*.
However, during her temporary stay in DisCity, her abilities were unstable, resulting in disruptions to routine operations, damage to public property, and public disorder. Detention and supervision of the subject during her temporary stay in DisCity is recommended.
111405.Criminal Record 2: It has been clarified that the subject's abilities are closely related to the customs and geography of Eastia, so their effectiveness is limited in DisCity. Additionally, she was deeply demoralized by the failure of the Sun Shot, leading to a series of unintentionally inaccurate *prophecies*. Her true character is sincere and lively and she always acts out of goodwill. She gradually regained her abilities and faith as a seer during her temporary stay in DisCity, under the guidance and companionship of Chief. She has now left DisCity to return to Eastia. Supervision for the subject has come to an end for now.
111405.Ability Summary: The subject can manipulate special flames. As her usual weapon is a slingshot, she typically condenses flames into fireballs with a radius of less than 10cm and shoots them. Additionally, she possesses a mysterious *propheticc gift* which occasionally subjects her to disturbing visions of *oracles* and makes her convey information from unknown sources in an unconscious state.
111405.Awakening Signs: According to the subject, she sustained a disaster in her childhood which led to the loss of her parents and home. In a critical situation, she heard a mysterious calling and was taken over by visions. She claims that she saw the *god* at that moment, and that was when her power awakened.
111405.Corruption State: Moderate degree of corruption despite lack of mutations on the body surface. She is usually sane, but will become unconscious when she is *possessed to convey oracles*, during which her mind becomes unstable.
111405.Arrest Records 1: She did not return home with the Eastian delegation after the repairs, claiming she needed to deepen her understanding of DisCity and requesting a temporary stay. After negotiations, the Bureau has extended her detention and supervision as an A-Class Sinner for a short period. She has no objections to this arrangement and cooperates actively with the Bureau.
111405.Arrest Records 2: Due to her special *prophetic gift* and her high sensitivity and passion for myths, she had been designated as the next *seer*, a position she felt a great sense of responsibility for. However, after experiencing the series of events in DisCity, her beliefs were shaken. Faced with the instability of her abilities, she now fears she's not fit for the duties of a seer.
111405.Arrest Records 3: Raised by her grandmother, a folk culture enthusiast and researcher, the girl grew up listening to myriad myths and legends told by her only family. Influenced by her, the subject developed a profound interest in folklore and myths, inheriting her grandmother's unwavering belief in the divine. She takes it upon herself to seek out and prove the existence of gods.
111405.Arrest Records 4: As a child, she lost her parents to a disaster. Her special power was later awakened following the vision of a *divine oracle*, and she used it to protect herself and her grandmother. Over time, this ability grew stronger. Under her grandmother's guidance, she learned about pursuing the gods, hoping to use the divine power to fulfill people's wishes and lead them to overcome disasters.
111405.Performance 1: She often resorts to superstitious customs and rituals to solve problems. Such a practice deviates from the DisCity's culture and has sparked a sensation within the Bureau, and the subject is also keen on showcasing her knowledge. Despite the inconsistency in the spells she recites during her performances, the enthusiasm on either side has not been dampened.
111405.Performance 2: Coming from an entirely different culture, the subject is highly curious about all the dishes offered in the cafeteria and is keen on observing the work in the kitchen. Once, she mistook a plate of salad for a raw ingredient and stir-fried it, but the dish received surprisingly positive feedback.
111405.Performance 3: With her genuine and lively personality, she has quickly become a beloved figure among the Sinners during her stay at the Bureau. She has grown especially close to the Sinners from Eastia. Although her boundless curiosity and barrage of questions sometimes overwhelm some Sinners, the situation is gradually improving.
111405.Performance 4: She invited Chief to join the *DisCity Myth Tour* she organized. Some of its highlights include an ethereal, incorporeal beautiful lady, a talking glowing tablet, and a highly addictive herbal soup. The tour lasted 18 hours and 21 minutes. After that, Chief decided to start reading the encyclopedia to get better prepared for next time.

111407.Info: A Sinner adept at fighting flocks of enemies. Deals <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more damage.
111407.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>15%</color> more damage to enemies without any cores.
111407.Name: Jane
111407.Criminal Record 1:
The culprit behind the robberies of multiple Eastside banks within three years involving a total of 37 million DisCoins.
Although no injuries were incurred, her crimes resulted in significant social and economic impact and losses to Eastside.
111407.Criminal Record 2:
While the subject was paying off her father's gambling debt, her ability awakened and she attacked the debt collectors. The subject caught the attention of the leader of the criminal group Ghost, who recruited her for her talent. Upon completing her training, she was tasked with robbing multiple banks in Eastside.
The subject attempted more than once to dismantle the group, but due to her limited ability and fear of implicating her family, she never followed through with her plan. The subject adhered to her principles and never killed any innocent Eastside civilians.
After killing the leader of Ghost, she did not accept Eastside's offer to offset her wrongdoings with her contributions and insisted on repaying all the stolen funds.
111407.Ability Summary: Her ability activates automatically under high pressure or combat environments, significantly enhancing her physical capabilities. In this state, the subject cannot fully control her emotions and can barely maintain a stable mental state.
111407.Awakening Signs: Due to her father's huge gambling debt, the debt collectors threatened her family's lives when they couldn't get the money. The immense mental pressure forced her to awaken.
111407.Corruption State: Her degree of corruption is relatively mild, and she remains sane most of the time. The subject only becomes corrupted by Mania during combat or under high-pressure environments. According to the Bureau's research statistics, the shackles can stably suppress such corruption.
111407.Arrest Records 1: Ghost has reappeared in Eastside. As a gang notorious for bank robbery, their presence gives the sheriffs a huge headache. If the situation continues to worsen, the FAC hopes the Bureau can take up the case when necessary.
111407.Arrest Records 2: Her father was once a highly respected sheriff in Eastside, and her mother was an accountant for a well-known company. But three years ago, after her father accumulated a huge debt, her family fell apart.
111407.Arrest Records 3: The subject was once a member of the robbery gang Ghost. When her father went missing and her mother was severely injured, Ghost noticed her exceptional reflexes and Sinner gift, and coerced her into joining the group by threatening her parents' safety. Due to the events three years ago, she has developed a fear of the act of shooting.
111407.Arrest Records 4: The subject personally killed the leader of Ghost. Having understood the course of the entire incident, Eastside decided to neither punish nor commend her and that the banks would absorb their own losses. However, at her insistent request, she was detained by the MBCC's Chief and agreed to surrender all her earnings from working at the Bureau to compensate for the bank's losses.
111407.Performance 1: An almost fanatical gun enthusiast, she collects firearms of different models from before Nightfall and modifies these guns and ammunition. Because she possesses too many dangerous firearms, most are stored in the Bureau's armory and can only be accessed freely during missions.
111407.Performance 2: The subject is detained by the Bureau as both an employee and a Sinner. She does office and administrative work when she's not deployed on missions as a Sinner. The subject refuses any form of financial aid and uses all her income to repay the 37 million DisCoins stolen during the robberies.
111407.Performance 3: The subject loves watching TV shows and movies, particularly police dramas and gunfight films. The subject often becomes fully engrossed when watching these films and would write detailed reviews and ratings.
111407.Performance 4: The subject regularly visits a nursing home in Eastside to see her parents, accompanied by the MBCC's Chief. Every time, her parents would pull her aside to whisper something to her, glancing at her companion from time to time.

111408.Info: A Sinner adept at Physical Damage who cannot block enemies or be targeted by enemies.
111408.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111408.Name: Pine
111408.Criminal Record 1:
A current affairs commentator who went viral during the election period and the owner of a media channel *The Hedgehog's Eye*. She actively publishes content across various platforms.
The subject's channel focuses on conspiracy theories, actively digging up and exposing the controversial pasts of selected individuals. Her content contains a lot of unverified information that may lead to significant adverse consequences. Immediate detention is mandatory.
111408.Criminal Record 2:
Records about the subject's past indicate that she once held hope for the future, but Worthington's deception destroyed her faith. She became convinced that the only way to survive in the dark was to blend into it, achieving goals by muddying the waters.
Currently, the Bureau monitors her external activities and article publications to prevent her from causing social unrest. The subject is gradually beginning to trust and approve of Chief. Her pessimistic attitude unchanged though, her behavior has become significantly less disruptive.
111408.Ability Summary:
The subject's special power makes her presence almost imperceptible, facilitating stealthy movement during intelligence gathering.
Her weapon is a custom-made launcher capable of shooting out surveillance gadgets such as cameras and listening devices.
111408.Awakening Signs: She once got involved in a conspiracy. Upon discovering the truth behind and refusing to submit to another individual involved in the plot, she was almost murdered. It was during this critical moment her special power awakened.
111408.Corruption State: Her corruption level is mild, with no visible physical abnormalities. Her mental state remains stable most of the time, only showing occasional fluctuations when writing about gossip or revealing scandals.
111408.Arrest Records 1: The subject first encountered Chief during the Eastside election. After exposing scandals and inciting unrest during that period, she was brought back to the Bureau by Chief for investigation and supervision.
111408.Arrest Records 2: Since her childhood, the subject has been independent and unsociable. She developed her understanding of the world's darker side and human depravity by wandering the streets, observing different social classes, and assuming false identities to experience their lives firsthand. To further comprehend the structure and workings of society, the subject began focusing on the upper echelons in charge of maintaining social order, and later resolved to become a journalist to expose the true nature behind their pristine public image.
111408.Arrest Records 3: Due to practical constraints, the subject failed to become a news journalist and instead began a paparazzo job. Once, while tailing a B-list celebrity, she accidentally discovered the celeb's amour and subsequent dispute with Vick, then-councilor of Shedde Town. Later that night, the celebrity was found dead at home. Pine immediately rushed out an exposé suggesting the councilor's possible involvement in the star's death, which however was banned by her superior. After confronting her boss, she resigned.
111408.Arrest Records 4:
Having quit her job, the subject continued investigating both the celebrity's death and Vick's activities, attempting to expose his corrupt dealings. With assistance from Worthington, a "righteous" commissioner, she successfully sent Vick to prison. However, she happened to discover that Worthington fabricated the evidence and was using her to eliminate Vick and secure the position for himself. Her refusal to continue working for Worthington almost cost her life, but she survived thanks to her newly awakened special power.
This incident taught the subject the dark nature of the political circle, prompting her to create her own media channel "The Hedgehog's Eye," where she began exposing the crimes of Eastside politicians by mixing fake news with facts.
111408.Performance 1: Shortly after moving into the Bureau, the subject surreptitiously installed surveillance cameras and listening devices in every corner, including but not limited to trash bins, ventilation ducts, flower pots, and dining tables. The technical team is currently conducting a systematic sweep to locate and remove these devices.
111408.Performance 2: The subject maintains a highly irregular schedule, typically resting during the day and working at night. Hence she has no trouble missing precisely every single meal at the Bureau's cafeteria. Consequently, the subject single-handedly consumes over half of the Supply Office's monthly stock of instant noodles and other fast food.
111408.Performance 3: Many of the Bureau staff members and Sinners are devoted readers of The Hedgehog's Eye. While the subject shows no interest in proposals related to fan meetings or fan clubs, she is actively recruiting informants within the Bureau to provide her with leads and scoop.
111408.Performance 4: Having spent some time together, the subject has become extremely curious about Chief and is planning to launch a new column in her channel titled *Chief's Untold Stories*, dedicated to documenting Chief's past and secrets. Recent days the subject is gathering information through her sources, becoming a major headache for Chief.

111409.Info: Thalia deals <color=#63b4c3>15%</color> more damage to enemies marked with [Discount].
111409.Name: Thalia
111409.Criminal Record 1: The subject is a leading DisCity influencer with exceptional monetization abilities and considerable influence among young demographics. Investigations indicate suspected involvement in illegally smuggling Mania-related contraband using personal resources. Due to the high-risk nature of the threat posed, immediate detention and further investigation are recommended.
111409.Criminal Record 2: Investigations have confirmed that all of the target's personal assets are derived from legitimate income, with tax records revealing no anomalies. The target has maintained a cooperative stance and provided active assistance, playing a pivotal role in enabling FAC to successfully dismantle the Mania smuggling network. Consequently, following a thorough evaluation, the Bureau has determined to drop all charges. The target is hereby released from mandatory detention.
111409.Ability Summary: The subject can designate any object as a commodity, using Mania to amplify others' desire for it and draw them toward the target. The longer the ability remains active, the more irresistible the attraction grows. If the designated target is a living being, their mobility will be impaired to a certain degree.
111409.Awakening Signs: After her family's downfall, the subject drifted to Syndicate, where she was deceived into transporting and selling Corruptor remains to make a living. During this work, she accidentally came into contact with Mania contamination and awakened her abilities when faced with mortal danger.
111409.Corruption State: The subject displays mild corruption without evident physical abnormalities, and her mental condition remains largely stable. However, under Mania's influence, the obsessive aspects of her personality have become heightened.
111409.Arrest Records 1: The subject was lawfully apprehended by the Public Security Bureau for possessing a Mania-related item suspected of ties to smuggling operations. During processing, she was classified as a Sinner and subsequently transferred to MBCC for further investigation.
111409.Arrest Records 2: The subject's online persona is that of a resilient, inspirational fallen heiress who rebuilt her life through sheer hard work after her family's downfall. Her success stems from her warm, relatable streaming style combined with the refined taste and discerning eye cultivated during her privileged upbringing. As a result, the products she reviews and recommends consistently become trending sensations.
111409.Arrest Records 3: The subject was once the heir to the Ellington family, a prominent aristocratic house in Eastside. During her youth, she lived in luxury, with access to the finest resources. However, after her father became embroiled in a financial fraud scheme and took his own life, the Ellington family fell from grace and was shunned by high society. Stripped of all assets, she found herself with nowhere to turn, even facing homelessness. In the end, she was forced to abandon her university studies and relocate to Syndicate to survive on her own.
111409.Arrest Records 4: After facing mortal danger in Syndicate, the subject swiftly depleted her savings to return to Eastside, planning to earn money through safer, legal means—namely, livestream commerce. However, by her own admission, she utilized her abilities to attract viewers during work. To date, the subject has fully settled her debts, repurchased her previously mortgaged ancestral home, and returned to university to complete her studies.
111409.Performance 1: The subject possesses an extremely strong entrepreneurial drive. Even during her detention by the Bureau, she continues her regular livestreaming and product reviews without fail. Her room has been converted into a professional streaming studio, and she has even borrowed the Supply Office's depot to store her merchandise.
111409.Performance 2: The subject shows little enthusiasm for combat field missions, but excels in social communication scenarios, particularly those requiring formal protocol. Given her specialized skills, the Bureau will strategically assign her to more suitable operations.
111409.Performance 3: The subject generously shares brand-sponsored products with fellow Sinners and Bureau staff, collecting feedback on their experiences. During livestreams, she enthusiastically invites interested Sinners to join her on camera for casual conversations or talent showcases. These collaborative streams have consistently generated excellent viewership and positive audience response.
111409.Performance 4: The subject functions on very little sleep, requiring only four hours of rest to sustain high energy levels. Since her late-night work schedule closely aligns with the Chief's, she often brings midnight snacks to check on and feed the hungry, overworked Chief during overtime, while also using the opportunity to promote health supplements.

111501.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and an extra <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111501.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111501.Name: Victoria
111501.Case: Father murdered after turning into a Corruptor
111501.Criminal Record 1: The subject and her father are suspected to have been in collusion with a mysterious power, engaging in Corruptor modification and aiding the power's upward infiltration. The subject killed her own father for some unknown reason during the process. Afterward, the subject spread the news about her father's mutation into a Corruptor and escaped the Public Security Bureau's arrest with the help of the dangerous Syndican organization *SALVA Hospital*. She also concealed a series of illegal experiments SALVA had been carrying out.
111501.Criminal Record 2:
Documents about the subject have been found in a special operation targeting illegal organizations. The analysis of the information reveals that the subject did not join the illegal activities fully on her own account. She was only misled by her father's improper education.
Although for a long time, the subject did not have any basic concept of life and its value, her understanding of it has been significantly swerved under further education in her detention.
111501.Ability Summary: Able to solidify blood bleeding out from the body into thorn-shaped crystallized spikes, causing indiscriminate damage within a linear range.
111501.Awakening Signs: Awakened at around seventeen. The Mania level shot up under the combined effect of drug influence, physical damage, and mental stimulation, though the detailed context is still to be investigated.
111501.Corruption State: No physical signs of mutation have been detected and no noticeable behavioral abnormalities have been observed. The mental state is unstable with occasional nightmares and unconscious sleep-talking.
111501.Arrest Records 1: During a mission, the MBCC accidentally discovered that the special SALVA patient was a Sinner on the wanted list. After an undercover investigation, the MBCC decided to arrest the subject. As the subject was physically weak, she did not attempt to orally defend herself or resist during the arrest.
111501.Arrest Records 2: Following up on the rumor concerning a Corruptor the subject had spread, a secret sterile chamber was discovered in her home, where a mummified Corruptor corpse was kept. The corpse's features match those of the subject's father. It appears that he had been confined and abused when still alive.
111501.Arrest Records 3: The subject's family is highly influential in the political world. After giving birth to Victoria, her mother died of complications from obstructed labor. The subject's father allegedly abused his authority to collude with a mysterious power and was eventually killed by the subject after mutating into a Corruptor.
111501.Arrest Records 4: Due to her weak immunity, the subject had never been in touch with the world outside the sterile chamber in her childhood. Having received a restrictive, distorted formative education from her father, the subject lacked a basic understanding of life and emotions. Later, the subject was transferred to SALVA as a special patient and received free medical assistance.
111501.Performance 1: Avoids non-sterile environments whenever it's possible and must put on the special respirator from SALVA before she leaves the sterile chamber. To save the MBCC's staff unnecessary trouble, the subject rarely goes out.
111501.Performance 2: The subject doesn't possess regular common sense gained from real-life experience, so she often makes misjudgments due to her distorted moral values. As she continues to communicate with others, this discrepancy between her mental age and physical age is gradually lessening.
111501.Performance 3: Often raises philosophical questions to other Sinners. Though the subject has no ill intention, the people who get asked tend to feel like they've taken a hit in their brains and will begin to doubt their entire existence.
111501.Performance 4: Once tried to perceive life by keeping small animals as pets, but got stopped by the staff due to the cruelty of the process. Recently, the subject has been preying on plants instead and still refuses to give up after already causing the death of more than a dozen plants. Apparently, she wants to grow a white rose to express her love for Chief.

111502.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and an extra <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111502.Name: Ignis
111502.Criminal Record 1:
The culprit of a large-scale serial arson case who had already caused multiple fires in several Eastside residential areas years ago. During the arrest, the subject burned down three street blocks, injuring many people and causing massive property damage.
Escaped from the detainment during a riot, but turned herself in after staying briefly in Eastside for unknown reasons. The subject is suspected to pose a safety threat.
111502.Criminal Record 2:
Proper public awareness of Sinners had not yet been formed when the incident happened, which resulted in severe emotional repression in the subject during her formative years. The lack of specialized Sinner detention and training institutions at the time also led to the outburst of the Sinner's special power after she was harassed, which in turn resulted in the accident.
The retrieved MBCC records reveal that the subject was ushered out by the crowd during the riot and did not escape on her own account.
111502.Ability Summary: Able to make any substance within a ten-meter radius combust instantly. When the subject is emotionally unstable, the ability will go out of control and create highly destructive blazes that are hard to extinguish across a wide area.
111502.Awakening Signs: During a culinary accident in her childhood, the subject grew fretful and furious due to an operational mistake and triggered their special power, incinerating the entire kitchen. Since the incident happened long ago, the precise awakening trigger cannot be determined.
111502.Corruption State: Though the subject's special power is unstable and highly destructive, her signs of corruption are rather inconspicuous. The subject sometimes calls for her parents in her dreams, displaying mild sleep-talking symptoms.
111502.Arrest Records 1: During the MBCC's investigation of the severe fire at the food festival, the subject approached the MBCC and revealed her Sinner identity, turning herself in on the spot.
111502.Arrest Records 2: The subject's parents are both famous cooks in their local region and cook highly acclaimed dishes. To help cover up the subject's Sinner identity, her parents even gave up their careers and relocated several times.
111502.Arrest Records 3: Since the subject has zero gift for cooking, her parents encouraged her to nurture a food reviewing hobby after school. She's set up a food review social media account named *Crème Brûlée Official* and has gained a substantial following. The blog is currently on hiatus.
111502.Arrest Records 4: Some rude fans once tried to probe the subject's personal information and managed to find her location and trespassed into her home. This behavior directly caused an emotional breakdown in the subject which in turn resulted in a fire.
111502.Performance 1: The fireproof room the MBCC's specifically prepared for her has made her the center of attention among all the Sinners. She's even gained a new nickname *Apple Peel* because of her unique hairstyle. Although the subject appears annoyed by this nickname, she's sneakily changed her social media profile picture to an apple.
111502.Performance 2: A foodie and especially obsessed with the crème brûlée sold at a certain shop. Every time when she comes back from a mission, she asks Chief for a pudding. This is one of her few interests she's willing to let others know about and she appears surprisingly enthusiastic about it.
111502.Performance 3: Exceptionally passionate about cooking. Have snuck into unguarded kitchen to attempt to cook many times, but every time it ended in a fire in the kitchen. The subject is puzzled by this as well, thinking she should make an excellent chef now that she can perfectly control her combustion ability.
111502.Performance 4:
After 36 small-scale fires in the kitchen, the subject finally succeeded in making her first finished product, a crème brûlée whose recipe originated from her favorite shop.
The Chief supported her throughout her attempts and offered feedback after tasting, therefore putting on some weight during that period.

111503.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and an extra <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111503.Mania Intensify Text: Deals <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more Damage, and another <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111503.Name: Luvia Ray
111503.Criminal Record 1: Hiding her Sinner and electroshock maniac identities, she appeared as an actress in Eastside during the day. She has harassed over a hundred individuals with her powers during the night, giving rise to the rumors of late-night electroshock attacks. The subject's method is very similar to that in the case of a certain director's death by electrocution several years ago. More details are to be investigated.
111503.Criminal Record 2:
Interrogation reveals that the subject possesses another personality which arose due to the traumatic encounters she had earlier in her life. The said personality is righteous but brutal, and will *punish* alleged sexual harassers with the subject's special power.
Interrogation also uncovers that she indeed caused the injury of a director whom she worked with a few years ago. But being in a life-threatening situation at the time, she only activated her power for self-defense. After a period of discipline and supervision, the subject has promised to never abuse her power again.
111503.Ability Summary: The subject's power is an electrical release but with varying voltage, ranging from causing pain to incinerating the victim. This ability has the potential for precise control, which the subject has not yet mastered.
111503.Awakening Signs: According to Luvia, she suffered from dissociative identity disorder even before awakening. The first power release was during abduction by Luvia, the main personality, under the encouragement of Ray.
111503.Corruption State: A patient suffering from severe dissociative identity disorder with two personalities—"Luvia" and "Ray." The examination results showed that this was her psychological symptom unrelated to mutation. Currently at a stable incubation period.
111503.Arrest Records 1: During the investigation of the "Eastside serial electrocution case," she was caught after committing the crime in the street late at night, who switched from being agitated to gentle. The change was suspected to occur in the progress. No actual harm was caused to the arresting officers.
111503.Arrest Records 2: Born in an ordinary family in Eastside with ordinary parents, who supported her acting career with their salary. Her parents are still in regular contact, but are unaware of her dual personality and arrest.
111503.Arrest Records 3: Has an outstanding appearance. Dreamed of becoming an actress since young. After graduating with an acting degree, she never got a role of her choice and had never been involved in the production of medium to large-scale films until she was arrested due to her lack of talent.
111503.Arrest Records 4: A victim of similar illegal abductions and kidnappings twice. Though the subject was never directly assaulted, two irreversible consequences resulted—a split personality and the awakening of her special powers. The civilians she attacked at late night all had criminal records.
111503.Performance 1: Half of the room is mainly pink with a CD wall and celebrity posters everywhere, while the other half is mainly purple with items scattered around messily, but the two parts do not mix together with a boundary in the middle.
111503.Performance 2: Despite the extreme personalities, the two get along and often communicate with notebooks. And when it comes to crucial issues, Ray often compromises and lets Luvia make the final decision.
111503.Performance 3: Luvia has never given up her dream of acting and has strict daily skincare and body management. Her willingness to share these professional beauty tips won her the support of many female Sinners. But Ray is a loner and never socializes proactively.
111503.Performance 4: Luvia repeatedly asked Chief to act out the script with her to practice basic skills. The script was chosen from a romantic movie in which a proposal is made, but Ray would interrupt at the critical moment every time.

111504.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal multiple Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111504.Mania Intensify Text: Core Damage dealt by Ultimate is increased by <color=#63b4c3>1</color> point.
111504.Name: Hecate
111504.Ability Summary: The subject's special power can turn the accumulated nightmares into substance and cause mental damage on opponents during attacks. The subject may also have potential of prophetic dream, which is yet to be further confirmed.
111504.Awakening Signs: Born with special power. The laboratory's cultivation and strengthening have enhanced the subject's strength and functionality.
111504.Corruption State: It can be inferred from an experiment report of unknown origin that S-019 is a born Sinner and an experimental subject. In S-019's early years, there has been frequent late-stage mutation symptoms, terrible nightmares that make it difficult to sleep, severe internal body erosion, and the subject possesses a high risk to the outside. The end of the report includes the life expectancy of S-019: 14 years.
111504.Arrest Records 1: The subject was handed over to the MBCC as a "test body" to control the use of special powers.
111504.Performance 1: The subject is unusually quiet and able to stay in the room alone for an entire day if without order. The MBCC has provided each Sinner with multimedia entertainment facilities, but the subject has not been seen using them.
111504.Performance 2: In the shackle contact between S-019 and Chief, occasionally the phenomenon of visualization conjugation can occur, and fragments of some strange scenes can be observed. The scenes are not part of Chief's memory, nor does 019 remember having such issues happening before. Below is S-019's explanation to Chief regarding this situation: "This is but a dream. No need to be concerned."
111504.Performance 3: After the rehabilitation training, the subjects began to communicate through the notebook and practice independent thinking. Few empathic Sinners were able to understand the subject's thoughts through the sketch book apart from Chief.
111504.Performance 4: After a long time of guidance and communication with Chief, the subject successfully regained some humanity and was freed from being a "test object." The initial emotional recovery may require further repair, but this is still worth celebrating.

111505.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal multiple Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
111505.Mania Intensify Text: Upon breaking enemies' cores, all enemies take <color=#63b4c3>10%</color> more damage for <color=#63b4c3>10</color> seconds.
111505.Name: Oliver
111505.Criminal Record 1:
The subject had repeatedly fabricated experiences of abuse, faked injuries, and deliberately swindled wealthy women's property in Eastside, and was also found to have imitated badges of *The Homeless*, and abusing powers to perform violence to others while pretending to be part of *The Homeless*.
The suspect is suspected to have committed more dangerous crimes, but because the subject lies a lot, no conclusive evidence has been obtained yet. Pending in-depth investigation to correct the subject's behaviors.
111505.Criminal Record 2: According to the in-depth interrogation and investigation, it is clear that in the case of the aunt, Oliver did not intentionally injure anyone, but only resisted in defense in a desperate situation. Those who had been hoodwinked by Oliver did take pity on Oliver and let Oliver off the hook. MBCC will continue to provide Oliver with positive guidance on values and correct Oliver's old habit of lying.
111505.Ability Summary: Owns a special power that creates invisible wires which can be pulled to change the actions of others. The subject often ignores the target's pain and causes irreversible physical damage to them with this special power.
111505.Awakening Signs: The analysis showed that the subject had awakened the power amid anger and hatred unfathomable for normal teenagers. The exact cause has yet to be identified.
111505.Corruption State: No visible lesions were found at this time, but mental corruption is more severe and nightmares were frequent. The subject is still mentally stable while awake.
111505.Arrest Records 1: Arrested by an Eastside sheriff on charges of intentional assault and fraud. The subject's identity as a Sinner was exposed during the escape and was therefore brought back by MBCC field guards.
111505.Arrest Records 2: Both of Oliver's parents were accidentally killed when Oliver was a little child. Oliver's aunt adopted Oliver as the last kin. Instead of a healthy upbringing, Oliver is treated harshly in aunt's home.
111505.Arrest Records 3: The aunt's family, who are in a bad and declining financial situation, not only tries to abandon Oliver but also repeatedly covets the only relic left by Oliver's mother. Oliver fights back against the aunt's family in an overzealous attempt to protect the relic.
111505.Arrest Records 4: Oliver's living conditions even improved after the loss of all relatives. According to the investigation, Oliver often intentionally roamed the streets of Eastside, picking out targets to lie to for sympathy. After one of the lies was exposed, Oliver fled alone to the border between Eastside and the Rust to escape capture, and was accidentally caught up in a series of incidents at a toy factory.
111505.Performance 1: A picky eater whose gustatory preferences are dictated by the mood. For the sake of the Sinner's health, the MBCC cafeteria has no choice but to provide customized meals.
111505.Performance 2: Oliver will pretend not to understand If a staff member makes a direct request in a commanding tone. Oliver is willing to comply only when the staff uses words like "please", "could you..." and "would you mind..."
111505.Performance 3: Although claimed to have become good friends with all other Sinners, Oliver in fact rarely initiates conversations with those from Syndicate. Only a few naive and wealthy Sinners from Eastside identify as Oliver's "good friends."
111505.Performance 4: Once, Chief woke up with both hands and feet tied with a strand of silk. Despite the conclusive surveillance footage, Oliver refused to admit to this late night crime.

111506.Info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more Damage, and an extra <color=#63b4c3>5%</color> more for enemies with broken Cores.
111506.Mania Intensify Text: [Neurotoxin] Reduces the enemy's Movement Speed by <color=#63b4c3>15%</color>.
111506.Name: Lamia
111506.Incident: Death of the Thaumas Society President
111506.Criminal Record 1:
A well-known internet celebrity, the "Ocean Messenger" of the Thaumas Society in Eastside. This society, in name, is an organization for ocean culture enthusiasts, but in fact, they have violated regulations and held offline meetings multiple times.
The president of the Thaumas Society died unexpectedly in the Insatiable Fiesta incident, which is suspected to be related to the subject. It is recommended to detain the subject immediately and conduct an investigation.
111506.Criminal Record 2: Through investigation and interrogation, it was found that the subject's extreme personality and distorted mindset were caused by unfair treatment and living in a high-pressure closed environment for a long time. She mostly used her special power to hurt others out of self-defense. After the interrogation, the subject began to waver. She acknowledged Chief and gradually began to open up. Recently, Chief has been trying to help the subject re-understand the world and herself, in order to reshape her erroneous concepts.
